You are a requirements analyst auditing discussion forum posts for potential feature requests.
You will be provided with a Moodle discussion forum post that includes the post title and post description. Moodle is a free and open-source learning management system (LMS) used by schools, universities, and workplaces to create online courses and manage learning activities.
Your task is to classify if the provided discussion forum post is a feature request or not for Moodle. A feature request is a post where the user asks for new functionality, missing functionality (e.g., features available in other apps), new content, or changes/improvements to existing features in future releases. Posts that are not feature requests include: bug reports, troubleshooting questions, usage questions, configuration issues, announcements, or general discussions. 
Respond strictly with one of the following labels: FEATURE_REQUEST or NOT_FEATURE_REQUEST. If the forum post is a feature request, return FEATURE_REQUEST. If the forum post is not a feature request, return NOT_FEATURE_REQUEST. Use the title of the post and the description of the post to make the assessment.
Forum Post: 
Post title: Forum not sending messages
Post description: It's now more than 5 hours since I put some post in two different forums, and they have not been sent. My experience is that the time elapsed since you put a post and it is sent varies enormously. But frequently it takes 2-3 hours. Do you experience  a similar problem? What can we do ? I understand that in Moodlecloud could you cannot run manually cronjob. Any idea/suggestion would be welcome. Regards. Enrique

Forum Post: 
Post title: How to see all submissions that need grading across an entire course
Post description: Hello! I am looking for a way for a teacher to see all the submissions that need grading across an entire course.  Specifically, if a teacher has graded assignments initially, but then students modify their submissions, it is difficult to find a list of what the teacher needs to go back to.  If I go into EVERY assignment, I can look at the Needs Grading count.  But I want the teachers to have a single place to look to see what they need to grade.  I have found mention of a Grade Me plug in in other Moodle help forums, but it doesn't seem to be available in MoodleCloud. Any assistance would be greatly appreciated.

I have read in previous discussions that there could be a way to retrieve my content and put it back up on my cloud (which I have re-created through a subscription). Post title: Sharing resources with other institutions
Post description: Good afternoon everyone, What would be the best way to share resources with another institution? Our curriculum is powered by LTI and we are trying to figure out a way that is easiest for our Moodle customers to import our curriculum into their courses. We have setup a Moodlenet account; but were curious if we could somehow setup our curriculum in our MoodleCloud and allow for a "Guest" access for our customers to download / import our curriculum directly. Please let me know your thoughts and please let me know if these ideas are violating any "Terms of Service" with either Moodle or Moodlenet. Thank you for your time and consideration, Thomas E. Bennett

Post title: Has anyone implemented Shibboleth for MoodleCloud?
Post description: Trying to implement SSO for MoodleCloud and all of the documentation seems to refer to configuring Apache to serve up the /auth/ shibboleth /index.php as a Shibboleth auth type. That isn't really valid for cloud installs as we don't even have access to those types of configuration options from what I can tell. I've looked at the plug-in code and it's looking for $_SERVER vars that should be provided if Shibboleth has authenticated correctly. It's not even finding the HTTP_SHIB_APPLICATION_ID/Shib-Application-ID variables. I have no access to Shibboleth logs so I have no idea if the authentication is failing. And I'm not sure which Shibboleth variable names I should be mapping to - are they using the default Shibboleth names? Any guidance from someone who's configured this before would be appreciated.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Weekly progress report to students
Post description: We are on MoodleCloud. Moodle version 4.3.3. Our course is self-paced, meaning students can sign up anytime and complete the course at any time. We would like to send out weekly progress reports to all of our students to let them know which assignments they have completed and what they still need to complete. Currently, we manually e-mail every student individually. We run a course completion report and copy it into an e-mail to each student. This is time-consuming, error-prone, and not scalable as our registration numbers increase. I saw that there is a Participation Report where we can send a message for each assignment to students who have not completed the assignment. That means students who haven't started any assignments would get 26 e-mails, one for each of our assignments. That's not a great user experience. I saw the Pulse plug-in and believe that functionality is what we're looking for. However, we can't install plug-ins on MoodleCloud. Are there any options for us to automate sending out weekly progress reports? Or do we have to stick to doing it manually?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Understanding Question Banks since MoodleCloud's upgrade to Moodle 5.0
Post description: Previously, MoodleCloud (versions 4.5 and earlier) had a single question bank per course. With the Moodle 5.0 upgrade , courses can now have multiple question banks , making it easier for teachers to share and reuse questions across different courses. With the upgrade, any existing questions from the course context are automatically moved into a new ' [Course name] shared question bank.' Additionally, any quizzes in a course with questions also have their own dedicated question bank, and listed under 'Other activities with questions'. Find out more in Question banks in upgraded sites !

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud performance issues in USA region
Post description: Hi MoodleCloud Users, We've had some unexpected demand spikes in the USA region. This has resulted in performance degradation for all sites in this region between 14:30 and 01:40 (GMT+0) on 2020-09-02. Resolved the root cause on 2020-09-03 01:40 GMT+0, and services are in the process of returning to normal performance now.  Engineers will be continuing to watch the issue. I want to thank you for your patience. As always, you can get the latest information on active incidents over at status.moodlecloud.com . Thanks, Frances The MoodleCloud Team

Post title: An H5P/moodle video mess
Post description: Hi I'm using the h5p interactive video content in moodle, which I access in the Content Bank. I uploaded a 98.4 MB video. I think the limit might be 100 MB. And it was fine. But then after maybe 5 minutes, I get "video source missing." (Note: Even if I post a link to a youtube video, it will look fine, and 5 minutes later will say "video source missing." and the link I pasted in, will be gone.) At that point I can't do anything for the rest of the day, because the video I uploaded is taking up most of my free moodle disk space. The video file is still there. I see it in 'User Storage' when one clicks "see all." But no way to delete it until something behind the scenes deletes it by the next day. So frustrating. And here's the other thing. That video which I can see in "user storage" doesn't match the size in MB of the file on my computer. The 98.4 MB file on my computer, uploaded to moodle is now 93.88 MB. Yet they should be identical. When I take that file name which I can see in 'user storage' (renamed by moodle into a series of letters and numbers) and try to paste it as a link into HP5 I get a message "video format unsupported." At first I thought I was getting too close to my moodlecloud storage limit. But that's not the case because I'm monitoring that. Thanks in advance for anyone's help.

Forum Post: 
Post title: 🚀 Big News: MoodleCloud is Now Running on Moodle 4.5! 🎉
Post description: Hello MoodleCloud Users, We’re thrilled to announce that MoodleCloud is officially on Moodle version 4.5 for all new sites — and it’s packed with new features, improvements, and a fresh, modern experience that will elevate the way we deliver online learning. Why is this exciting? Moodle 4.5 brings a host of game-changing updates including: Exciting new AI subsystem!: We’re introducing the foundation of an AI subsystem designed to supercharge your content creation and management capabilities. Content organisation with subsections: Organising course content just got easier! Streamlined assignment management: Key actions, now conveniently located at the top, save you scrolling time Improved Performance: Faster load times, smoother interactions, and a more responsive experience for users. Better Accessibility : A focus on making learning even more inclusive with new accessibility enhancements for all users. This upgrade is a major milestone for MoodleCloud, and we’re incredibly excited to see how it will empower our users and customers to get the most out of our platform. A Huge Thank You to Our Product Teams! This release wouldn’t have been possible without the dedication and tireless effort of our amazing Product, Engineering, and QA teams. They’ve worked around the clock to ensure that everything is seamless and up to our high standards. Their passion and commitment to delivering the best possible experience for our users is what makes this upgrade such a success. Let’s take a moment to celebrate all the hard work that went into this release and give a huge thank you to everyone involved. 🙌 What’s Next? Now that MoodleCloud is live on 4.5, we’re eager to hear your feedback and see how these new features are benefiting our users. Keep an eye on the forums for tips and tricks to make the most of Moodle 4.5, and as always, feel free to reach out with any questions or suggestions. While the version update is running for our current customers, you’ll notice a banner in your MoodleCloud Customer Portal; once the updates are complete, the banner will disappear. After your site is updated, you’ll have access to all the new features and improvements. Let’s continue to innovate and push the boundaries of online learning, together! Cheers to a brighter, faster, and even more powerful MoodleCloud experience! 🌟 Frances MoodleCloud - Product Manager

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud Sites have been Upgraded to 4.3.2
Post description: Hi All, We're happy to announce that all MoodleCloud sites are now on Moodle 4.3.2! This latest release continues our ongoing journey of empowering our users, with improvements designed to help them unlock their creativity, help facilitate cooperation and optimise learning outcomes. MoodleCloud 4.3.2: New features Packed with many improvements and new features, here are the key highlights for Moodle 4.3 & 4.3.2 (see release notes for the full list and the Moodle 4.3 new features page for some screenshots): Activity Card Redesign. Educators and learners will appreciate the revitalised activity cards – now more compact and intuitive, ensuring seamless management of groups, restrictions, and activity completion conditions. Default activity completion. Courtesy of the Moodle Users Association’s valuable input, administrators and educators can now set default activity completion conditions at the site level. Course communications. The launch of our new integration with the Matrix Messaging system provides access to a contemporary messaging interface directly in the heart of Moodle. Additional functionality will make working with other messaging systems (e.g. Slack or Teams) more seamless in the future. These new in-course communication options will help educators and learners stay connected, foster increased engagement, and work more closely together! Other interesting features LTI external tools Report Builder Gradebook enhancements Security enhancements Question bank enhancements And much more! Thanks for using MoodleCloud and we hope you like the new features! Cheers, Frances MoodleCloud - Product Manager

Forum Post: 
Post title: New MoodleCloud plans for up to 1000 users (and much more!)
Post description: Hi All, Thanks to everyone who participated in the MoodleCloud Users Survey in September this year. You were all very clear about what you wanted, so now your wishes are coming true! We are excited to let you know that we have just launched new MoodleCloud Plans, and they’re pack full of what you were asking for! New Large plan By far the most requested improvement was larger plans, and today we can announce the MoodleCloud Large Plan, with 1000 users and 5GB storage. New User Count that excludes Suspended users on all new plans For new plans, we’ve changed the way we count Users to something that is better value for you. For all MoodleCloud customers on one of the new plans launched this week, suspended users will no longer be counted in your user quota. This works much better than deleting users, as you will still have their data and will be able to run reports on what they’ve previously completed. Storage increases on all new plans We’ve increased the storage on all new plans, and more than doubled it on others! Starter: Was 200MB, now 250MB Mini: Was 200MB, now 500MB Small: Was 400MB, now 1,000MB Medium: Was 1,000MB, now 2,500MB Large: 5,000MB New Free Trials Everyone not yet using MoodleCloud will be able to start a 45 Day Free Trial that includes all features from all plans. We thought it seemed fair that you should be able to try it before you buy it! Ready to upgrade? You can upgrade your plan from any existing Starter and School plans to the new plans at any time (the system will automatically give you a pro-rata refund on any unused time in your old plan too)! If you do choose to move from a Moodle for School plan to one of our new MoodleCloud plans, please note that the following features are no longer available: School theme & school domain (sitename.moodle.school) MoodleCloud theme Group Choice Activity Level up! Quizventure We have more information on important changes to read before upgrading from Moodle School to the new Moodle LMS plans . Moodle School plans no longer available for purchase They were with us for five years, but we’ve finally decided to retire the old Moodle for School plans, and they are no longer available for purchase. You can retain your existing Moodle for School plan if you are already on it (we’re not requiring you upgrade at this time, although we’ll highly likely end these plans entirely when Moodle v4 comes out in early 2022). Thanks, and happy Moodling! Lee Goldsworthy Product Manager - MoodleCloud

Issue : When I access the site using Edge on the Toughpad, the hamburger menu and the custom drop down menus do not work. If I tap on them a box appears around the outside of the menu item, but the side-drawer nor the drop-down menu shows. I have narrowed down the issue to the pseudo-class focus-within, which I have found here: https://mysite.com/theme/styles.php/boost/1652874062_1649605921/all (The site is hidden behind a login page so I'm not sure how useful sharing the link to the site would be?) And it looks like this: .dropdown-item:focus-within {outline:0;background-color:#EEBC1D;color:#fff}.dropdown-item:active a,.dropdown-item:hover a,.dropdown-item:focus a, .dropdown-item:focus-within a{color:#fff} I think I may have found a potential workaround here , but I have no idea how to implement this to affect the hamburger side-menu and my custom drop-down menus. This is an absolute deal-breaker, as aforementioned I cannot change the browser or the hardware. Any help would be much appreciated.

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud's HTML5 Player and "Hidden from Vimeo" video iFrame
Post description: Hi everyone, So I've encountered a bit of an issue while using some of the additional security features on Vimeo and the HTML5 embedding feature on a "Page" source. I'm wondering if anyone here can help with info on the matter. On Vimeo I have my videos uploaded as a "Hidden from Vimeo" video and the privacy setting to only allow for the videos to be embedded on approved domains. The only approved domain I have listed are my moodle pages "_____. MoodleCloud .com". After copying and pasting the embed code from the Vimeo video into the Moodle "Page" source under HTML5 I get a notification from the Vimeo player "Sorry Because of its privacy settings, this video cannot be played here." I checked Vimeos information boards and found this: "If you’re seeing this error in the player, the video you are watching has domain -level privacy enabled. The video’s owner can adjust the domains where a video can appear within “Where can this video be embedded?” section of the embed settings page. If the domain is listed in your video settings page, but the error is still appearing, the domain specified in your address bar may be different from the domain sent to the Vimeo player. In these cases, the privacy error may appear. Contact a web developer to confirm if there is anything in your site's HTML code that could be blocking the referrer from reaching our player iframe." Is the HTML player reporting a different domain back to Vimeo? I am using a trial version of moodle to evaluate Moodles efficacy for the task. Will this issue persist after I move from the trial version to the paid version of Moodle? Is there a way to have my site report the proper URL back to Vimeo to reach the player iframe? Thanks in advance for any insight, Josh P.S. I'm new to the forum so if I posted in the wrong thread let me know and I will remediate the issue.

Post title: too small font size in writing contents
Post description: I'm using Moodlecloud with the Moodlecloud theme selected. I'm a teacher and I'm used to writing contents myself (page resources). And I prefer the TinyMCE editor . Well till last May I worked well, and the editor worked well for me and I used it nicely. Now (November) I noticed some significant changes in the Moodle GUI (although the theme is always the same: the Moodlecloud theme). No problem, the new GUI is nice too. But using the HTML editor is another thing. The font display size is too small for me to write easily: the paragraph style is 5 pixels high (height of the lowercase x letter). This is simply too much small for me. I've an 1920x1080 display too. Also, the <h5> headers, which I often use, are only 4 pixels high! Those sizes are shown to me only in the editor: when my students open the page I wrote, they see the paragraphs of 8 pixels high (lowercase letters) which is OK for them. Now, can I restore the previous font display size in my HTML text editor? Thanks in advance, Luigi

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle EULA
Post description: We use MoodleCloud for our courses and allow our users to self-register.  When a new user logs in the first time, they are immediately hit with the two Moodle EULAs with no explanation of what it is and why it is necessary. It confuses many first time users, particularly if they are not particularly computer literate.  I think it is overly intimidating without the ability to at least presenting a screen that explains what they will see next and what they need to do. Alternatively, it would be nice to, like many software providers, have a less intrusive way for users to accept the EULAs without having to physically scroll down each and click accept. So my question is if there is currently a way for organizations that use Moodle as a platform for delivering content to allow for adjustments to the default way new users see the Moodle EULAs, and if so, where can I find documentation on that? Thank you very much.

Post title: MoodleCloud Sites are now on 4.2.1!
Post description: Hi All, We're happy to announce that all MoodleCloud sites are now on Moodle 4.2! This latest release builds upon the refined user experience of Moodle LMS 4.1 with new and improved features that create efficiencies for educators, trainers and systems administrators. This update brings enhancements to course creation, reporting, activities and messaging, making it quicker and easier to create engaging learning experiences, measure learner progress and improve learner outcomes. MoodleCloud 4.2: New features Here is an overview of the key features and improvements in Moodle 4.2, or watch our YouTube playlist of 4.2 New features Bulk editing in courses Moodle Users Association brings a new bulk editing feature Allows you to bulk duplicate, delete, move or change the availability of activities or course selections. Gradebook improvements Streamline visibility of learner progress and performance through Gradebook A search option in the Grader report Grader report records Collapsible grade categories in the Gradebook setup Enhanced Course page design and features Duplicate sections and add an activity anywhere in a section Activity types are only shown to teachers (not learners) when editing mode is on Permalink URLs allow educators and trainers to share specific locations in courses and indentation has been restored Check out all new features in Moodle 4.2 Thanks for using MoodleCloud and we hope you like the new features! Cheers, Frances MoodleCloud - Product Manager

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud & unprecedented demand from COVID-19: Impacts and next steps
Post description: Hi everyone, MoodleCloud are currently experiencing staggering new demand (more than 20,000 new schools and businesses in the last 10 days), and I wanted to share the impacts of this increased demand, and a few things that we're doing in MoodleCloud to respond to this. 1. Infrastructure Uptime - We have succeeded in keeping all services up during this period by staying one step ahead of the hard bottlenecks that would have otherwise caused outages at specific threshholds of users/sites. This has been our focus (to the exclusion of all else) over the last 10 days. 2. Infrastructure Performance - We have not succeeded in maintaining fast page load times during this period (as this has been secondary to #1 above). We are now at the final stages of testing and expect to add capacity for more sites and concurrent users in the EU and US regions today and tomorrow. We expect these upcoming changes to substantially improve performance to usual page load times, but until then, users in EU and US regions will see slower page load times during their local business hours peak times. 3. Customer Support - We have not succeeded in maintaining our usual ticket respond/resolve times during this period. We have added support staff to the MoodleCloud team and are training them as we speak to assist with bringing down support ticket respond/resolve times. I understand this experience is challenging for you at a time when you need Moodle most, and for that I would like to apologise. Forum Post: 
Post title: Delete backup files
Post description: A few months ago I backed up a couple of
courses and downloaded the backup files for storage off Moodle. Then I made
sure backup was disabled. Now it's time to delete the unneeded backup files
from Moodle storage. A forum post said to use this process: 1. Log in as admin 2. Go to the course 3. Click gear > Restore 4. Click Manage backup files 5. Click the File Picker icon (the little sheet of
paper) 6. Click the link of the file to be deleted 7. Click Select this file 8. Click the link of the file to be deleted again,
under the Files folder 9. Click the Delete button (here is where you also
have the option to download it before you delete it) 10. Click OK 11. Click Save Change

Forum Post: 
Post title: Workbook-type activity
Post description: Hello, I have recently come across a tool called Wobo which basically allows you to integrate a digital workbook into your LMS. It looks great in lots of ways but is still quite new and unfortunately does not integrate perfectly with Moodle yet. As a small-ish charity we also don't have the funds to spend a monthly amount on it (even though it is very reasonably priced). I'm just wondering whether there is any way of creating a similar type of acvitiy directly in Moodle, on the MoodleCloud server . The kind of course which we run is one where students are required to: - complete self-assessment forms, which they may want to refer back to over the course of the programme - create action plans, which, again, they will need to refer back to, potentially make changes to, etc. - keep track of their progress by rating themselves on a scale for various parameters. Over time, this rating should improve, and they should be able to see this improvement The "Feedback" activity type does not work for these kinds of activities , because once submitted, participants cannot see their responses. The only work-around I have come up with so far is to ask them to download , complete and submit a worksheet as an "Assignment" activity, but this feels clumsy and I would really like these activities to be integrated. An online workbook like Wobo seems to be the ideal solution, but as I say, Wobo itself is not quite there yet. Does anyone know of a similar tool, or a good work-around on Moodle?

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud is now on 5.0.2! 🎉
Post description: Hello MoodleCloud users! We are excited to announce that MoodleCloud's Moodle version has been upgraded to Moodle 5.0.2. What’s new? These version upgrades include many exciting new features and improvements: A new centralised course overview page, making it easier for you to navigate your courses and find what you need faster Additional AI functionalities for improved reporting and an explanation option to summarise course content Improvements to SMS notifications An easier to use and more powerful question bank Important security improvements, such as the ability to set password requirements for your users. The 5.0.2 version upgrade also includes many accessibility and general improvements to further enhance your site. A big thanks to the teams involved! These improvements would not be possible without the work and expertise of our Product, Engineering, and QA teams. We’d like to take a moment to show appreciation for their motivation and commitment to providing our users with the best experience possible, their efforts have truly made an impact on MoodleCloud's quality and standards. What’s next? MoodleCloud is now running version 5.0.2, bringing new features, enhancements, and performance improvements. We’d love to hear how the update is working for you and how the new features are supporting your teaching and learning. Keep an eye on the forums for tips and ideas to help you get the most out of Moodle 5.0.2. Thanks for being part of the MoodleCloud community! Cheers, Frances Product Manager, MoodleCloud

Post title: Impact Of Deleting A User & Re-Using The Vacancy
Post description: I am wondering if we can delete a user (student) from the MoodleCloud application, and what will the impact be on the courses in which that user has been enrolled in. We are currently on the 100-user package and it is estimated in about 3 to 4 months' time we will hit the 100% quota. Courses run by us are not long - 3 months to 6 months on the average. And some students will not continue with us after they have finished their chosen courses though they can opt to continue with other related courses. Can we delete such students from our users database and re-use the empty slots without breaking the courses that these students were enrolled in (in terms of grades and contributions from such deleted students)? Or would all information (grades & contributions) of such students be wiped clean as well? Would appreciate guidance on this so that we can make decision whether to increase the quota when the time comes. Thank you.

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud Sites are now on 4.0.1!
Post description: Hi All, We're happy to announce that all MoodleCloud sites are now on Moodle 4.0.1! Moodle has a new personality! Welcome to a new contemporary interface, intuitive tabbed navigation, and a redefined course experience that makes it easier for educators or trainers to create and edit courses and for learners to reduce distractions and prioritise course work. What’s new on Moodle 4? Connect your site with MoodleNet MoodleNet is an open, social, media platform for educators to share and curate collections of open educational resources. With this new update, you’ll be able to easily send ready-to-use content from MoodleNet to your site. Learn more about how to use MoodleNet on MoodleCloud in our knowledge base article . Once your site has been updated, you’ll receive an email that confirms that MoodleNet has been enabled for your site. Theme Changes The Classic theme is no longer available on MoodleCloud and the Boost theme is set as the default. If you have used custom CSS to style your site, any custom CSS that goes with the Classic theme also is removed. You can learn more about what to do with your custom CSS in our knowledge base article . Enhanced course creation experience New navigation to find your way around the course and activities with clear tab menus. Drag and drop sections and activities to organise your content in seconds. Enhanced support for screen readers and keyboard navigation to make your courses more accessible. Check out all new features for teachers in Moodle 4 . New features for Moodle administrators Custom reports: easily create reports at user, course and site level in a new drag and drop interface and share them with your team. Site configuration presets: keep things simple and remove anything your users don’t need with just one click. Plus, save your site configuration as an exportable Preset to import into other sites. Customised login page: add a background image for the improved login page Check out all the new features for administrators in Moodle 4 . Thanks for using MoodleCloud and we hope you like the new features! Cheers, Frances MoodleCloud - Product Manager

Post title: Collating several "Feedback" activities into one document
Post description: Hello, I am wondering if there is a clever work-around on MoodleCloud to collate several "feedback" activities into one document. To explain - we are developing a child protection training, during which, at the end of each module, participants will produce a part of a child protection policy. e.g. in Module 1 they will be asked to describe the laws around child protection in their country, and to put this information into a "feedback" activity. By the end of the training, they will have filled in lots of these "feedback" activities and by doing so, will have written most of their Child Protection Policy. Is there a way of extracting the information that they give and collating it into one document? Ideally into a pre-existing template where their responses get slotted in at the appropriate points? If not, is there a work-around which would achieve the same results? Thanks!

Post title: Customising language in Quiz on MoodleCloud/Alternatives to this
Post description: I'm using Moodlecloud to design a 6 week course. The course encourages participants to take part in some exercises each week and to set a goal which they can aim to achieve over the six weeks of the course. I want to create a function through which participants can set a goal at the beginning of the course and then come back to review/reflect on it (and even edit/add to it) throughout the course. However, I'm struggling to find a function that suits this on Moodlecloud. For example, the Feedback option is good for open entry text but participants cannot review it after they've submitted it. I've also considered using the Quiz option. This works well in terms of function but the language is misleading since it refers to things like 'quiz', 'result' and 'assessment', which are not relevant. I read that you can change this language under 'language administration', but when I try I see a message saying "this feature is not available in MoodleCloud." I also read about other plugin options to help with customisation, or options such as the journal plugin - but it would seem these aren't available with Moodlecloud either? My questions are: 1. Am I missing some steps that would make the above options work with MoodleCloud? If so, what are they? 2. If these options don't work with MoodleCloud, is anyone aware of alternative ways I could create this goal-setting function? I basically just need them to be able to type in a goal and be able to refer to it throughout the course. Is it possible to code within MoodleCloud? Also just to note I'm working on behalf of an organisation so don't have control over what type of account they have. Thank you.

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud announce increased free quotas plus NGO and nonprofits program
Post description: Hi all, We are committed to providing open source, free e-learning tools for educators. That’s why all our software is free and open source, and this will never change. Hundreds of thousands of institutions have downloaded and are using Moodle on their own servers worldwide. MoodleCloud is one of our official hosting services that makes it simple for anyone to get a Moodle site without needing to install it on a local server .  Since 2015, MoodleCloud has provided a number of simple packages for smaller users, including a 50-user Free plan with 200Mb. Announcement 1: New free trial with larger quotas We are happy to announce the launch of a new MoodleCloud Free Trial with four times more users (200) and double the storage (400 MB). Everyone will be able to use their MoodleCloud Free Trial for 45 days before deciding to move to one of our inexpensive paid plans. Announcement 2: NGO and nonprofits program As part of our mission we are now offering our larger MoodleCloud plans completely free to registered NFPs and NGOs. All you need to do is apply here , and if accepted, we will give you a full-size MoodleCloud plan for no cost. Costs are subsidised by donations we've received. Does this replace the existing free plan? Yes! This new Free Trial upgrades and replaces our old Free plan (that expires if unused for 14 days). Will people keep their existing MoodleCloud free sites? Yes! Sites currently on the old Free plan will remain unchanged (so long as you use them at least once every 14 days!). Your support is welcome If you, or someone you know, would like to make a donation towards paying for deserving institutions to have free MoodleCloud sites, please visit moodle.com/donations . Thanks, and happy Moodling! Lee Goldsworthy Product Manager - MoodleCloud (Edited by Frances Le Page - original submission Wednesday, April 15, 2020, 3:06 PM) (Edited by Frances Le Page - original submission Wednesday, April 15, 2020, 3:06 PM) (Edited by Frances Le Page - original submission Wednesday, April 15, 2020, 3:06 PM)

Forum Post: 
Post title: Forum policy - PLEASE READ before posting
Post description: This forum is for community discussion about MoodleCloud. MoodleCloud is our own hosting platform, designed and run by Moodle HQ, the people who make Moodle.  MoodleCloud provides a super simple way to get up and running with the latest Moodle version in minutes. MoodleCloud hosting is inexpensive because we don't include a lot of support. If you need assistance with setup and configuration of your site, visit the Moodle community and Moodle documentation for lots of helpful information on any Moodle topic.  There is a handy link in the footer on each Moodle page to take you to the appropriate Moodle documentation for that area of Moodle. To this point, we have developed this policy for posting to this forum.  Posts which violate this policy may be edited, moved to a more appropriate forum or deleted at the discretion of our forum moderators. If you have a question about MoodleCloud Ensure you have explored our dedicated FAQ page to see if your question already has an answer. Is your question a Moodle question? Does the question start with "In Moodle, how do I..."  If so, then please search for the appropriate forum for the post. This will provide a better experience for all and the answer may already be provided. If you think it may be an issue or bug in MoodleCloud and you can verify your issue does not happen on the same version of Moodle outside of MoodleCloud, please open a bug over at https://tracker.moodle.org under the CLOUD project. Etiquette Discussion tone should be kept polite and focused on facts. Our public forums must not be used for defamation or flaming. Don't forget to talk about good experiences as well as the bad! Your identity Fake identities created on Moodle.org for the purpose of criticism will not be tolerated, and those accounts may be closed. Text taken from the Moodle.org site policy .

Forum Post: 
Post title: Important Update: MoodleCloud Performance
Post description: Hello MoodleCloud Community, We’re reaching out to update you about the recent performance issues that have affected some MoodleCloud sites. We understand how frustrating this has been for you and your learners, and we want to assure you that resolving these issues is our highest priority. After a thorough investigation, we can confirm that these problems are not related to any security breach or external attack; your MoodleCloud site remains secure and protected. Our technical team has identified several underlying causes that have contributed to slower performance in specific situations. In simple terms, we’ve found that some parts of the system have been handling background tasks and caching less efficiently than intended. These inefficiencies have, at times, increased load on our servers and caused slower page response times. We’re actively working on a set of fixes that will: Reduce unnecessary background activity, helping pages load faster. Optimise how data is stored and retrieved , especially in courses with more complex structures. Improve memory management for users who access sites without logging in. Ensure commonly used information loads more quickly and consistently. These improvements are currently being finalised and tested. They will be included in the upcoming Moodle 5.1.1 release, scheduled for 8 December 2025 . We’ll send a follow-up update on that date to confirm the release and share any further details. Thank you for your patience and continued trust as we make these improvements. We’re committed to ensuring MoodleCloud remains a reliable, high-performing platform for you and your learners. Frances The MoodleCloud Team

Forum Post: 
Post title: Checking for Unmarked Assignments
Post description: All, I've been receiving really useful help here - maybe this will help others in the same situation as me: Ona typical course, I have 40 students, each has between 8 and 24 assignments to submit. Going through Moodle, opening each assignment one by one and checking for unmarked assignments is a real nuisance. I have made a spreadsheet with a bit of VBA. It cycles through all assignment windows in a course and opens each one in a separate tab. I then run through the tabs, and any where "Needs grading" is not zero, I know I have assignments to mark there. Where I see a zero, I just close that tab. In seconds, I'm left with only the tabs where I have marking to do. To make this: Create a spreadsheet, save it as an .xlsm (macro-enabled spreadsheet) Select a range of cells - single column. Into the cells, copy & paste the url's of each grading summary page (the one that shows Participants, Submitted, Needs grading), one under the next. Name this range - I called mine " Assignment_URLs" Copy & paste the following code in as a VBA module: Sub Open_Assignment_URLs_In_New_Tabs() Dim rng As Range Dim cell As Range Dim URL As String Sheets("Sheet 1").Select ‘Change this to the sheetname where the links are [Assignment_URLs].Select ‘Named range where the links are ' Check if a single column is selected If TypeName(Selection) = "Range" Then If Selection.Columns.Count = 1 Then Set rng = Selection ' Loop through each cell in the selected column For Each cell In rng ' Get the URL from the cell URL = Trim(cell.Value) ' Open the URL in a new tab If URL <> "" Then CreateObject("WScript.Shell").Run URL End If Next cell Else MsgBox "Please select a single column containing URLs.", vbExclamation End If Else MsgBox "Please select a single column containing URLs.", vbExclamation End If End Sub If you aren't sure how to insert VBA, ask ChatGPT - it gives a good explanation and examples. To use the spreadsheet: Log in to Moodle as teacher. Run the code; it should open as many new tabs in your browser as you have url's in the named range. Hope this is of use, Ian

Forum Post: 
Post title: Forum not sending messages
Post description: It's now more than 5 hours since I put some post in two different forums, and they have not been sent. My experience is that the time elapsed since you put a post and it is sent varies enormously. But frequently it takes 2-3 hours. Do you experience  a similar problem? What can we do ? I understand that in Moodlecloud could you cannot run manually cronjob. Any idea/suggestion would be welcome. Regards. Enrique
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Enrique. Due to the nature of MoodleCloud, we cannot continuously run cron jobs for sites. Instead we run cron for small batches of sites. We try to prioritise active sites when processing batches (this is based on the last time someone logged in to the site). It isn't unusual for there to be a delays of several hours between a particular site's cron run. Cheers, Cam
Comment 2: Thank you Cameron for your reply. Some times 6 hours have elapsed before a post was sent to the students. I have found that  I have to use the option of sending without waiting time for editing. The the posts are sent in 20-30 minutes. I suggest that you consider introducing some change to correct this. Kind regards. Enrique
Comment 3: Hi Enrique, If you believe this is a bug or problem in Moodle, feel free to report it on the issue tracker under the MDL project. Cheers, Cam

Post title: HP5 in Moodle Cloud School

Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Brendan, In Moodle 3.8, work on core integration of H5P was started, but not completed. I gather you'd still need the 3rd party plugin to create H5P content directly in your Moodle instance. For now, significant steps have been made to allow for easier embedding of H5P content in any text area through the ATTO editor, and the filter to make sure the H5P content is displayed correctly in those text areas. I expect the mod_hvp to become part of Moodle core by 3.9 (May 2020), as can be read in the Developer's Moodle Docs : https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Roadmap

Forum Post: 
Post title: How to see all submissions that need grading across an entire course
Post description: Hello! I am looking for a way for a teacher to see all the submissions that need grading across an entire course.  Specifically, if a teacher has graded assignments initially, but then students modify their submissions, it is difficult to find a list of what the teacher needs to go back to.  If I go into EVERY assignment, I can look at the Needs Grading count.  But I want the teachers to have a single place to look to see what they need to grade.  I have found mention of a Grade Me plug in in other Moodle help forums, but it doesn't seem to be available in MoodleCloud. Any assistance would be greatly appreciated.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Jen, To keep our Standard plan costs low and your site simple to manage, it is not possible to install any plugins on MoodleCloud sites . If the plugin or feature is essential for your organisation, you can upgrade to a Premium Solution - use this contact form to reach out to the sales team for Moodle Premium Solutions. Kind regards, Barbara
Comment 2: But is there a way to do this without a plug-in? It seems like the most basic function of an LMS -- allow the teachers to see what they need to grade. Can I do it with a report? A search? ANYTHING?
Comment 3: Hi Jen, According to one of our Moodle education experts, this is an often requested feature. Unfortunately, in core Moodle LMS, there is currently no way to see all student submissions that need grading across all assignments in a course (including marked and resubmitted assignments). FYI , the Grade Me plugin is often recommended for Moodle LMS users, however, even that is only assignments that haven't been submitted and not modified submissions. However, using the "requires grading" filter saves some time, when you go from one assignment to another. Kind regards, Barbara

Forum Post: 
Post title: Transferring users
Post description: Good day to all. Currently I am moving a moodle site from my local server to the MoodleCloud. I wish to know if it is also possible to copy accounts from it to there. Or will my students have to make new ones? (They have already filled in all the user data) Thanks.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You could use Bulk User Actions to create a download file of your current users and then upload users to your Moodle cloud site. The only thing you’ll lose is their password, which can easily be reset in bulk or individually - everything else will be transferrred. If you're backing up courses from your old site though, you can include enrolled user data and new accounts will be created on your new site for the restored courses. You’ll still need to sort the passwords though.
Comment 2: Right, that worked. Thanks a lot. Although it seems the only option about passwords was "generate if needed and send via e-mail". I hadn't told the students that I'm moving the site, so they may be confused about those messages.
Comment 3: You could use that, or use a generic password in the upload file and tell them by email when you’re ready.

Post title: Admin user is UNABLE to login on paid MoodleCloud organization
Post description: Could someone look into this URGENT case? I tried to login my paid MoodleCloud organization as " admin " user, and the system keeps telling me " Invalid login, please try again " US region https://wbcpc.moodlecloud.com/login/index.php I logged in as "admin" user for several times before and it all worked. I tried to reset my password via "lost password?", but it threw error message at the last step after setting the new password, so I am stuck to login as admin user. Instead of the admin user, another user in our organization is able to login.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Perry, Thank you for reaching out and sharing your concern. We're here to assist you with any issues you're encountering. To provide you with the best support possible, could you please direct your concern to our customer support portal: https://moodlecloud.com/app/en/support Looking forward to assisting you further. Best regards, Dustin Layugan MoodleCloud Developer
Comment 2: Thank you Dustin! It works now
Comment 3: I've had the same problem this morning.  I was exporting the site.  The export didn't finish (perhaps there was a problem on moodlecloud, or the export timed out?) and the site was left in maintenance mode so no one can log in. Is there any way to take the site out of maintenance mode, as I could do on my own Moodle site, or does it require action by Moodle HQ?
Comment 4: If you could please contact support as outlined above this will be resolved
Comment 5: Thanks very much, Brett.  I have. I guess from your referring me to the support site that the answer to my question (*) is that there is no facility in MoodleCloud for the site admin (i.e. registered MoodleCloud user) to take the site out of Maintenance mode.  I thought that would be useful information for others who find their way here with this problem. (*) "Is there any way to take the site out of maintenance mode, as I could do on my own Moodle site, or does it require action by Moodle HQ?"
Comment 6: Apologies, I misread that bit. No there isn't a way for an admin to take a site out of maintenance mode. The maintenance mode page is put in place to give students a nice page rather than an error when infrastructure work is required on MoodleCloud such as upgrades or more recently a database migration to ensure that the system was running on a supported and secure infrastructrure. This is why Admins can't turn off maintenance mode. Once the work is complete all sites should automatically be set back but on occasion one or two fail to do so. With 10s of thousands of sites its not always as easy as we would like to catch the ones that have not changed back. We are looking at improving monitoring to help mitigate this posibility futher.
Comment 7: Thanks, again, Brett.  That all makes sense. The site's out of maintenance mode and available again now.

Post description: Hi. I am a new Moodlecloud user and facing some teething problems. Appreciate your help in finding a solution to a basic issue! I have created a course and would lie to disable the functionality of the students able to see which other students are online. Comment 2: Hi Rana, I know of the "Online Users Block", but I'm not sure if there are other ways for students to see which other students are online. Are you thinking of something else? For the block, you can edit the Student role (under /admin/roles/manage.php) and "prevent" the capability "block/online_users:viewlist". I would probably set all capabilities relating to this block to "prevent" for Students at that point, since it's kind of useless. Let us know if there's something clearly MoodleCloud-specific for this, I'm curious. Otherwise, you would be better served by the original forum where you posted.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Accessibility
Post description: Hi, I really need web speech API on my MoodleCloud school, once I have many blind students interested in the language courses - but so far, I couldn`t find an alternative for me to do so. I invested a good amount of time and money to this project - can anybody help me with a solution? Thank you all.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Normally, you don't need to use the web speech API in your website. Normally blind studenst use a screen reader like NVDA ( https://www.nvaccess.org/ ) or Jaws.
Comment 2: If you want to experiment with either of those products, NVDA is entirely free and Jaws has a free version that requires a re-boot after each 45 minutes of usage.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodlecloud as a workplace learning
Post description: Hi, I wanted to know that could we use Moodlecloud as a workplace  learning? As we noticed there are no options to change language string(i.e. students to learners) and also couldn't add corporate related plugins. Thank you, Azmat
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello Azmat. You may use MoodleCloud for any kind of training and learning, but as you have realised, there are limitations to the product. You cannot certain aspects and you cannot add plugins. If you want a more specific workplace learning package, then you can either download, install and set Moodle up yourself as you wish, or you can contact one of our official Moodle Partners and discuss your needs with them.
Comment 2: Thank you.
Comment 3: Hi Azmat, What Mary said is definitely the right answer, but more specifically, you can rename the roles names on a per-course basis, using the form at the bottom of the course settings page. More information about this can be seen on https://docs.moodle.org/34/en/Course_settings#Role_renaming Mathieu
Comment 4: Thank you for the message. Yes you're right we can change role on course basis and also system level role can be rename by an administrator using Administration > Site administration > Users > Permissions > Define roles . Azmat

Post title: BigBlueButton webcams on MoodleCloud
Post description: Only the Moderator's webcam appears to participants on BigBlueButton on Moodle Cloud (free version) but the Moderator can see all the participants' webcams.  I've clicked on the gear icon above users' names and checked the 'lock viewers' settings.  If I make everybody Moderator we can see all the cams.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Change all the student's status in "Moderator" isn't an option. The can ban you from your lessons! I hope there will be a solution for share the student's webcam..
Comment 2: If MoodleCloud uses the Blindside network hosting solution, then the announcement of BigBlueBUtton on March 27th explains this. Below you find a copy from the newsletter I have received. Lock settings for students seeing other student’s webcam We've been seeing increased pressure on the servers to handle so many webcams. Also, we've seen students on low bandwidth getting disconnected when many other students in the session shared their webcams. To reduce the overall load and to reduce the disconnects (which makes it hard for students to participate), we have temporarily enabled the webcam Lock Settings so students do not see other student's webcams. Webcams are still a BIG part of the lecture: 1. Students can share webcams.
Comment 3: Thank you for your answer. I will try to ask Blindside if they are involved and how long they believe disabling student webcams will last.
Comment 4: Thanks for your replies.  Has there been any further info from Blindside?  I see that the 'free' MoodleCloud site has a limit of 45 days now.  Do you know that if we pay the fee for the upgrade will we be able to see all the cams?  thanks.
Comment 5: MoodleCloud does indeed use Blindside for BBB. Upgrading to a paid plan doesn't change any restrictions Blindside themselves place upon their platform. Cheers, Cam
Comment 6: So, the solution to students being able to see each other, according to the quote from Blindside, is to put everybody in a breakout room.  I'll check the capacity of breakout rooms.  I'll try to find the BBB conditions on MoodleCloud.  Thanks
Comment 7: Do we have any updates on this?
Comment 8: I have read that there is a max of 8 breakout rooms but no max on the numbers of users, depending on the server .  Presumably if you had 8 users in a breakout room, they can all see each other, whereas if you have 8 in the main room, they can't?  Doesn't seem right.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Weekly progress report to students
Post description: We are on MoodleCloud. Moodle version 4.3.3. Our course is self-paced, meaning students can sign up anytime and complete the course at any time. We would like to send out weekly progress reports to all of our students to let them know which assignments they have completed and what they still need to complete. Currently, we manually e-mail every student individually. We run a course completion report and copy it into an e-mail to each student. This is time-consuming, error-prone, and not scalable as our registration numbers increase. I saw that there is a Participation Report where we can send a message for each assignment to students who have not completed the assignment. That means students who haven't started any assignments would get 26 e-mails, one for each of our assignments. That's not a great user experience. I saw the Pulse plug-in and believe that functionality is what we're looking for. However, we can't install plug-ins on MoodleCloud. Are there any options for us to automate sending out weekly progress reports? Or do we have to stick to doing it manually?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Why don't you use the Custom Reports to build that report. It has scheduling options; I have not looked at yet - but they appear promising. Kind Regards
Comment 2: Thank you, Shirley. I believe that Custom Reports will meet our needs.
Comment 3: Hi Season, I have been searching for a progress report for Moodle and my situation sounds similar to the one you were in last year. Could I ask if you were able to make a custom report that worked for you to send out to your students? Thank you, Alex
Comment 4: If students are not regularly logging in to check their own status, I wonder if your emails are helping. However, I tend to teach adults, who I think should be responsible enough for checking their own status. Perhaps this is not your situation. How do you know that students are reading your weekly emails? Shirley's suggestion may help.
Comment 5: We see a flurry of Moodle activity after sending out the progress reports.
Comment 6: The Completion Progress block is a nice option for both students to visually track their own progress along with the teacher able to monitor the entire class completion on a single page. This block uses the Moodle Activity completion functionality on the specific setting for successfully completing the activities . There are lots of benefits using this Completion Progress Plugin !
Comment 7: We have this enabled.
Comment 8: I'm not sure if the Analytics system is available on Moodle cloud , but it could be another option. It can send a general message to users that they have upcoming activities due (it wont tell them what, but it directs them to the Timeline block on the dashboard which will display this information): More info here https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=454023#p1837306
Comment 9: Just another approach that might be worth considering; Under Grades / Grader Report, there's an option to download grades given for each assignment to each student as an Excel spreadsheet. With a bit of VBA, this could be used to generate emails for each candidate showing which assignments they've completed, their scores and what is outstanding. You could also include a "student average" as a guide for them. I do most of my tracking using Excel. Ian

Post title: moodlecloud portal recurring subscription payments to moodle
Post description: Hi everyone I have my own moodlecloud portal which I set up last year. I'm just wondering how I check on  my portal ( via admin ? ) if recurring subscription payment details have been set up or how I renew a subscription ? I set my portal up on 30/1/23, and I'm wondering if it automatically renews ? I have moodlecloud : Moodle 4.2.3 (Build: 20231009)
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi there, If you paid for a yearly subscription when you signed up and haven't disabled recurring payments, it will probably be renewed automatically. If so, you will receive emails reminding you of this well in advance of the renewal date. Log in to the MoodleCloud Portal ; Update my MoodleCloud billing details and payment method ; Cancel my MoodleCloud subscription ; If you encounter any issues, you can Contact the MoodleCloud Team . All the best, Christian
Comment 2: Thank you Christian, I've sorted it now

Forum Post: 
Post title: Is server needed for moodle?
Post description: Hi I would like to know if you have to rent a server when you have  LMS Moodle Thanks.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: It requires a server to run. It can be run on your local machine but for anyone else to see it you will need a machine that your users can access.
Comment 2: Yes, Moodle is a client-server web application. Pl. read https://docs.moodle.org/en/About_Moodle .
Comment 3: But, if you pay for MoodleCloud, you don't need your own server. That is just one of various ways that you can pay someone else to look after the server for you.

Forum Post: 
Post title: How do I set prerequisite courses for a course?
Post description: I need to be certain that a student has completed one course before moving on to another. How can I set prerequisites in Moodle Cloud ? I have searched everywhere. This is such a basic necessity of ANY LMS site and have found on every other LMS I have used. Where would it be?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello there. In some ways your post is also relevant to standard Moodle , not just MoodleCloud , as it is a frequently asked question. But I will leave it here since one possible solution involves plugins which you can't add to Moodlecloud. There is no standard way to be certain that a student has completed one course before moving onto another. A popular workaround is mentioned in the Moodle documentation : Can I make access to a course conditional upon completing another? where basically you set up course B with an enrolment key and  in course A you use Restrict access and Activity completion to conditionally display the enrolment key in a Page once every activity in course A has been completed. This works, but if you have  a group of students who communicate with each other it would be easy for them to pass on the enrolment key to course B. But then - you would know - because the logs will show that they have not completed course A.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Creating a Second Moodle Site
Post description: I'm interested in creating two Moodle Sites which are nearly identical. First, can this be done on the same Moodle account? Second, is there a quick and easy way to ensure the second site is operating under the same settings as the first site? -Thank you
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Jessica, There's no automated way to keep two MoodleCloud sites synchronised. You can backup your courses and restore them in the second site, but this will be a manual process that you have to repeat in order to keep the sites synchronised. If you need more users or storage, the best way is to upgrade to a bigger plan . Cheers, Cam

Post title: Is there a limit to number of courses on Moodle Cloud? site?
Post description: I've been searching high and low for an answer, and don't want to assume the lack of an answer means the answer is "no limit." Assuming we don't exceed the limit for content storage or users, could we have 1000 courses? 2000 courses? Thank you for taking the time to respond!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Dear Tennille, You are correct, as long as you stay within the storage limits and user count, you can create as many courses as you like on your MoodleCloud site. Of course unless the courses contain text only, the likelihood of creating 2000 courses (and at the same time staying within your storage limit) is less likely. I hope that this helps. Kelly
Comment 2: Yes, it's precisely what I needed to know. Thank you!

Forum Post: 
Post title: how do I add a table that people will be able to fill out?
Post description: Hi there ! i would like to know how do I add a table that people will be able to fill out in my course? I would like people to write 20 shorts sentences in a table. Thanks for your answers D.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Dean, Others might know if there is existing Moodle Cloud functionality to do this. Could you use a workaround: Insert an activity - a file for students to download - a table, either an Excel or a Word file that they can fill the 20 sentences in. Insert a second activity - an assignment, which gives them a drag & drop window to upload the completed worksheet / document into? It's a bit clunky, but it would work if there's no cleaner way of doing it. HTH , Ian
Comment 2: Hi Dean, In addition to Ian's suggestion, depending on what you want to do with that information, you can use the Assignment activity and allow your users to upload their answers, use the Feedback activity , or even create a Google Sheet (use the publish file feature) and use iframe to insert it in a Text and Media area ; you'd have to edit the sheet's access capabilities and edit the src URL to make it editable while embedded. There are guides in the web. I'm sure that there are many more options to do this. Please feel free to explore Moodle's Documentation to learn more about these and other features. All the best, Christian

Post title: Change password
Post description: I can not figure out how to change my password for MoodleCloud version 3.2. First of all, I would like to say that I really like Moodle,
and I opt.in to allowing Moodle to use my questions, trials and errors to help
improve. I did take the learn.moodle course, took notes, but still I
have questions. My question is how do I change my password? When I log-in a Portal comes up.  I have tried clicking all over the place, but I don't think I have found a way to change my password there.  The Portal also comes up with my site name hyperlinked.  I click on it and my course, or site (whatever it is called) comes up in a new window.  I have clicked on things all over the place in this new window, but so far I have not been able to find the place where I make the password change. How do I change my password? Thanks in advance.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi - you can change your password via your MoodleCloud site login screen. Go to your site login screen. I t will have this format: [yoursitename].moodlecloud.com Locate the link that says "forgotten your username or password?" You will be redirected to a page that asks you to enter your username or email address. Once you’ve entered your information an email will be sent to the email address you registered with, instructing you on how to change your password . More info at https://moodle.com/cloud/faq/
Comment 2: My login screen has no "change password" text.  All it has is a little red box that says Log In.  That little box is in the upper right area.  When I click on it,  a box appears under it where I enter my site name and password.  These boxes are in the upper right.  I tried entering an incorrect name and password and pressed log-in, but still no forgot password link came up, and in fact the original log-in box disappeared and only a log-in box titled "Invalid username or password" in the lower left area became available.  I looked all over for the forgot password box, but could find none.  So then, trying to force that "change password" link to appear, I tried entering wrong info.again into this new box, clicked log-in.  Still no password change link appeared. I really hope I can change my password.
Comment 3: If your site name is still guessandcheckdiscovery.moodlecloud.com (found it in another post!), go to https://guessandcheckdiscovery.moodlecloud.com and the forgotten password link is there. For ease of reference, click on https://guessandcheckdiscovery.moodlecloud.com/login/forgot_password.php
Comment 4: The name I enter when logging in is guessandcheckdiscovery.  I think the full name is guessandcheckdiscovery.moodlecloud.com.
Comment 5: Click this link guessandcheckdiscovery.moodlecloud.com On the right you will see a red link Forgotten your username or password? Click it and you will see a form to complete .

Forum Post: 
Post title: Changing URL
Post description: Hello, Simple question here as my team has built our course and is ready to upgrade to the paid version of Moodlecloud. Unfortunately, we'd like to change the URL of the site. Is this possible? If so, how would we go about doing this. Thanks for your help!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Craig, When you sign up for MoodleCloud you need to choose a site name which can only be changed by contacting us. You select your site name when you sign up for MoodleCloud (ie. yourchoice.moodlecloud.com). MoodleCloud does not support other types of domains. If you want a customized URL (e.g. sitename.com) you will need to contact one of our Moodle Certified Service Providers who offer paid services and alternative hosting options. If you wish to change your existing site name, this is available for paid MoodleCloud subscription sites - please contact us for details. Best Regards, Craig R Morton

Forum Post: 
Post title: Understanding Question Banks since MoodleCloud's upgrade to Moodle 5.0
Post description: Previously, MoodleCloud (versions 4.5 and earlier) had a single question bank per course. With the Moodle 5.0 upgrade , courses can now have multiple question banks , making it easier for teachers to share and reuse questions across different courses. With the upgrade, any existing questions from the course context are automatically moved into a new ' [Course name] shared question bank.' Additionally, any quizzes in a course with questions also have their own dedicated question bank, and listed under 'Other activities with questions'. Find out more in Question banks in upgraded sites !

Forum Post: 
Post title: An H5P/moodle video mess
Post description: Hi I'm using the h5p interactive video content in moodle, which I access in the Content Bank. I uploaded a 98.4 MB video. I think the limit might be 100 MB. And it was fine. But then after maybe 5 minutes, I get "video source missing." (Note: Even if I post a link to a youtube video, it will look fine, and 5 minutes later will say "video source missing." and the link I pasted in, will be gone.) At that point I can't do anything for the rest of the day, because the video I uploaded is taking up most of my free moodle disk space. The video file is still there. I see it in 'User Storage' when one clicks "see all." But no way to delete it until something behind the scenes deletes it by the next day. So frustrating. And here's the other thing. That video which I can see in "user storage" doesn't match the size in MB of the file on my computer. The 98.4 MB file on my computer, uploaded to moodle is now 93.88 MB. Yet they should be identical. When I take that file name which I can see in 'user storage' (renamed by moodle into a series of letters and numbers) and try to paste it as a link into HP5 I get a message "video format unsupported." At first I thought I was getting too close to my moodlecloud storage limit. But that's not the case because I'm monitoring that. Thanks in advance for anyone's help.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello Alan. Not a solution but just a suggestion: is there any way you can edit that video, either to condense its file size down from 98 MB or else (how long is it in minutes?) cut it up into smaller chunks and upload them separately?
Comment 2: Hi Mary, and thanks for all the excellent moodle learning videos you have made, well-written and produced, and with a great narration voice, they have greatly helped me learn moodle. Video is 2 minutes long. I could compress it down more, but I wonder where my threshold will be. Like will I be problem-free at 50 MB or 80 MB. Also because the hp5 module also threw out a test youtube link, maybe I've somehow corrupted the hp5 module and should start from scratch. Another thing I might explore is using JW Player on my own server storage space that comes with my email account. I tried yesterday to simply upload my video into my www space that comes with my email account, and then pasted that link into the hp5 module: but that didn't work. LOL. I realized a player is needed, not just the file. I understand it's a tall order for an LMS to also be a video hosting site. I'm going to keep trying to figure out a solution. I like the idea of large video files, because then the user could click the expand button to get full screen which for me is 1080p. But first I'll try to get something small working.
Comment 3: JW Player didn't work. They mentioned on their website that they have something that allows their videos to be played on Wordpress, so maybe it takes a collaboration between the companies. Didn't see anything about JW Player and any LMS.
Comment 4: Hi Alan, You can read more about videos and Moodle here . Can I ask you to submit a support ticket from your Portal (orange Help button bottom right of screen) so that we can look into this further? It sounds as if there may be an error with your site uploads. Thanks Kelly
Comment 5: Thanks Kelly, I tested it some more and got similar results with an 80 MB vid file. Ticket is #82304.

Post title: Images pixels logo, course description, badges
Post description: Hello, I have a Moodle for School account and I need some help with the image size specifications for: Logo size Course description image (one automatically appears at the moment - I am hoping to change that with an appropriate image. I assume that I can use the course description to upload the new image or am I stuck with the default one. Is there a bank of images?) The badge size Thank you.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Michelle, About the school theme: The logo preferred aspect ratio is 6:1 with a height of 80 pixels. The course image will be cropped to a height of 175 pixels, the width depends on how many courses are displayed, image will be cropped accordingly The open badges specification ask for file that has a square aspect ratio, is at least 90x90 pixels and less than 256kb in size. Mathieu

Forum Post: 
Post title: BigBlueButton has Breakout Rooms Now - Thank you
Post description: Hello I just discovered that the BigBlueButton activity in MoodleCloud now has break out rooms. Fantastic! Thank you very much for including breakout rooms now in MoodleCloud.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: How many private rooms can you have ? On a free basic plan, I have 8 provates room max. How many on a School plan?
Comment 2: Hello Francois, Same for me in my School plan. The maximum number of breakout rooms I can choose is 8 rooms.
Comment 3: Bonjour François, The limit is not set by MoodleCloud , it's a BigBlueButton default and is hardcoded to 8: https://support.blindsidenetworks.com/hc/en-us/articles/360024516512-Create-and-manage-breakout-rooms I am not aware of the reasons of this limit or if there are any plans to change that eventually. Mathieu
Comment 4: Hello Mathieu, Great link, thank you.  I found a similar question on the BigBlueButton saying while the number of rooms are set at 8, there is not a limit on the number of users. --> There's a cap of 8 breakout rooms in a meeting. The user cap is more fluid. There are no hardcoded user limits in BigBlueButton so the biggest factor is server specs and then client bottlenecks. For the current HTML5 client build I would recommend not going over 100 users in a meeting and to reach those numbers requires a server that is beyond the minimum specs in the documentation. We're trying to raise the number of users that the client can sustain, but it's an ongoing process. https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/bigbluebutton-users/6hjfvfWNAsY/fwnu_CeNCAAJ
Comment 5: Merci mon cher! And I understand that this limit is not only for MoodleCloud users, but for all Blindside Networks users, since you are pointing towards their general documentation. Good to know.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Can I customize my MoodleCloud URL
Post description: Greetings, I have a self hosted Moodle site; www.mymoodlesite.com . I now have a MoodleCloud hosted site; mymoodlesite.moodlecloud.com. I set up a redirect from my URL and I arrive at mymoodlesite.moodlecloud.com but, obviously, the URL displayed in the address bar is mymoodlesite.moodlecloud.com. I would really like it to read mymoodlesite.com. Is this possible? How would I go about setting this up. Thanks in advance.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Edward, No, unfortunately this is not possible. If you have set up a HTTP 301 redirect from your self-hosted Moodle site then this will be a permanent redirect meaning the browsers/users will not attempt to request the original location any more and use the new one instead. A HTTP 302 redirect would be temporary. Many thanks.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Error message when taking quizzes
Post description: When my students take a quiz and submit, they receive the following error: An error occurred while processing your responses (Invalid course module ID). Click continue to return to the page you were on and try again. This seems to be happening with quizzes that are composed of questions in the System folder, and not of questions that are in the course folder (though I cleaned those out and deleted all of those questions. I could move them, but I really want the questions to be system-wide. If I click " More information about this error ," I receive a message that says "This page does not exist yet. You can search for this page title in other pages, or let us know by posting about it in one of the Moodle community forums " I'm seeing that folks are having a similar problem (not skilled enough to know if it's the same) on the moodle forum (not moodlecloud). ( https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=381116 ) Is there any way to figure this out? Is there technical support for moodlecloud? Thank you so much, Sarra
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You are right that this is the second time an issue like this has been reported. However, the first report did not give enough clues to work out what was going. In moodle, the 'course modules' database table is what links all the different activities and resources (quizzes, forums, pages, labels, ...) to the course. This part of Moodle has not changed in years, and normally works fine, so it is hard to guess what might be causing this error. We need more facts. It would be very helpful if you could turn on Debugging , and set it to 'Developer' level and trigger the error again. Then copy and paste the full error message here. That would tell us exactly where in the code the error is coming from.
Comment 2: Hi Sarra and Tim, Unfortunately, debugging is not available on MoodleCloud, but the issue is now quite well documented in both https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-64878 and https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-64895 . Mathieu
