Post title: 🚀 Big News: MoodleCloud is Now Running on Moodle 4.5! 🎉
Post description: Hello MoodleCloud Users, We’re thrilled to announce that MoodleCloud is officially on Moodle version 4.5 for all new sites — and it’s packed with new features, improvements, and a fresh, modern experience that will elevate the way we deliver online learning. Why is this exciting? Moodle 4.5 brings a host of game-changing updates including: Exciting new AI subsystem!: We’re introducing the foundation of an AI subsystem designed to supercharge your content creation and management capabilities. Content organisation with subsections: Organising course content just got easier! Streamlined assignment management: Key actions, now conveniently located at the top, save you scrolling time Improved Performance: Faster load times, smoother interactions, and a more responsive experience for users. Better Accessibility : A focus on making learning even more inclusive with new accessibility enhancements for all users. This upgrade is a major milestone for MoodleCloud, and we’re incredibly excited to see how it will empower our users and customers to get the most out of our platform. A Huge Thank You to Our Product Teams! This release wouldn’t have been possible without the dedication and tireless effort of our amazing Product, Engineering, and QA teams. They’ve worked around the clock to ensure that everything is seamless and up to our high standards. Their passion and commitment to delivering the best possible experience for our users is what makes this upgrade such a success. Let’s take a moment to celebrate all the hard work that went into this release and give a huge thank you to everyone involved. 🙌 What’s Next? Now that MoodleCloud is live on 4.5, we’re eager to hear your feedback and see how these new features are benefiting our users. Keep an eye on the forums for tips and tricks to make the most of Moodle 4.5, and as always, feel free to reach out with any questions or suggestions. While the version update is running for our current customers, you’ll notice a banner in your MoodleCloud Customer Portal; once the updates are complete, the banner will disappear. After your site is updated, you’ll have access to all the new features and improvements. Let’s continue to innovate and push the boundaries of online learning, together! Cheers to a brighter, faster, and even more powerful MoodleCloud experience! 🌟 Frances MoodleCloud - Product Manager

Forum Post: 
Post title: Recovering a "lost" attempt on MoodleCloud
Post description: Hello everyone, I'm hosting a Moodle course using the Moodlecloud basic plan. Last week, one of my students did a quiz attempt but, somehow, it got lost - I think she didn't submit it, but I'm not sure. The problem is: it's like it never happened. She can't continue the quiz and there's no memory of her attempt. However, I can find it in the logs. When I click it, it shows: "Can not find data record in database table quiz_attempts" Is there any way I can access the attempts table on MoodleCloud? Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Davi, This error is not specific to MoodleCloud and the folks in the quiz forum might be more helpful at explaining how this happens (and how to prevent it). It is not possible to access the sql tables of a MoodleCloud site, but if you contact us from the MoodleCloud portal (we would then know which site is yours...) we might be able to help. I agree with you that she might have not submitted her attempt and unfortunately in this case, looking at the database would not recover anything. Mathieu
Comment 2: There are only two ways this can happen: A teacher goes and manually deletes the attempt using the quiz reports. (Check the logs.) The permissions are set up wrong, so the student has the teacher's permission to preview the quiz instead of attempt it (Use Quiz administration -> Check permissions and look for mod/quiz:preview.)
Comment 3: Thanks for the reply, Tim! That makes sense: this particular student was also acting as my assistant, so she had administrator privileges. It's very possible that she just previewed the test and thought she was making a real attempt. In this case, is there any way to get her answers back? Thanks again!
Comment 4: Sorry, no. (Vote for MDL-54875 .)

Forum Post: 
Post title: Large Video File Upload to moodle but Uploaded to be changed audio File
Post description: Large Video File Upload to moodle. but Uploaded to be changed audio File .
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Our MoodleCloud plans do have strict limits and our max file storage is defined as the maximum storage for your entire site. The individual file upload size of 100mb is across all plans. For this reason we suggest hosting files externally: You can host files on Dropbox, Google Drive, iCloud or other web sites, and then link to them in Moodle using a Resource URL . This link explains how you could host on OneDrive and use in your course: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/OneDrive_repository Dropbox: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Dropbox_repository Google Drive: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Google_Drive_repository Amazon S3: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Amazon_S3_repository Host your videos on Youtube. Any link to your videos will be automatically and seamlessly embedded in a course in your MoodleCloud site: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/YouTube_videos_repository Think about linking/embedding existing websites for your content instead of redeveloping it all from scratch. Use Page and Book Resources in Moodle instead of uploading PDFs. Keep the quota for individual users down to something low, to encourage small files.

Forum Post: 
Post title: strange updates in my course
Post description: I'm the admin of a Moodle site, hosted by MoodleCloud. Today I noticed that all pages in a course section have the same timestamp : Thursday, March 20, 2025, 10:34 PM. All the pages in the section, even the ones I haven't touched in months. I looked at the log and it shows thirteen events with the same timestamp (March 20, 2025, 10:34:40 PM) made by me, with the same IP address (the right one), in that section. All events are tagged "course module update". The number of events (thirteen) matches the number of items in the section. On that day, I actually worked in that course and in that section, but only to assess a quiz taken by my students last week. I'm sure I didn't make any changes to all the other items. By the way, it would not have been possible for me to change all those activities and resources at the same time (same minute, same second). Is there any reason for this? Maybe some automatic update? Thank you all, Luigi
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Luigi, The "timemodified" timestamp is sometimes updated on apparently unrelated operations, but this exact behaviour, in this case, is new to me as well. I have sent you an email, with a few more questions that might help us go to the bottom of this one. Thanks, Mathieu

Forum Post: 
Post title: Migrate MoodleCloud site to another MoodleCloud site
Post description: Our school's finance department wants us to align the annual renewal date of our MoodleCloud site with the start of the fiscal year (which is April in Japan), so is it possible to migrate our MoodleCloud site to a new one purchased at the start of the fiscal year?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Dear Tyler, MoodleCloud's systems do not allow us to change the subscription date - however, f you send us a support ticket a few days prior to the day you would like to be billed, we can bill you in advance for the coming year. Thanks Kelly
Comment 2: Thanks for the reply, Kelly. Should I infer from your answer that it is not possible to migrate a MoodleCloud site to another MoodleCloud site?
Comment 3: Hi Tyler, If you mean moving a site from one account to another - this can be done. However as it is done manually by our Technical Team, you would need to submit a support ticket (as there is currently no way to move it yourself other than backing up and restoring every course one by one from one site to the next). Let me know if you need anything further. Thanks, Kelly

Post title: Migrate from Moodle for Windows on pc to MoodleCloud
Post description: Can I migrate from Moodle for Windows on pc to MoodleCloud?  If so how?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: In other words can I upload the course I have created on Moodle for Windows on my pc into my MoodleCloud account?
Comment 2: Yes you can. However, there are file limits on MoodleCloud (particularly the free version) so if your courses contain a lot of large sized files eg videos and powerpoints, you should first host them elsewhere eg YouTube, GoogleDrive etc. But other than that there is nothing stopping you moving your courses to MoodleCloud.
Comment 3: I have the same situation as Tom and still his question been unanswered: how can I actually do it? Can anyone please provide a tutorial or something?
Comment 4: And by the wonder of technology, your wish is granted! Here are links to the documentation that has existed for a very long time and is easily discoverable via this site or indeed any search engine of your choice... https://docs.moodle.org/36/en/Course_backup https://docs.moodle.org/36/en/Course_restore
Comment 5: Big thanks! Although it is easily discoverable only if you know the keyword "restore". Searching with "upload", "import" and "migrate" obviously returns nothing...

Forum Post: 
Post title: Removing a participant from Moodlecloud site
Post description: Hi, Is there any way to remove a participant from the Moodlecloud site (i.e. not a user from an individual course)? In my Moodlecloud, there seems to be no way to do that... Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You can both un-enrol a participant from a course (while the user keeps access to the site) and delete a user from the site (thus freeing some space in your allocated 50 users quota). To delete a user, you go to Site Administration -> Users -> Browse list of users, from there you can click on the 'X' at the right end of the line of the user you wish to delete.

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud Sites have been Upgraded to 4.3.2
Post description: Hi All, We're happy to announce that all MoodleCloud sites are now on Moodle 4.3.2! This latest release continues our ongoing journey of empowering our users, with improvements designed to help them unlock their creativity, help facilitate cooperation and optimise learning outcomes. MoodleCloud 4.3.2: New features Packed with many improvements and new features, here are the key highlights for Moodle 4.3 & 4.3.2 (see release notes for the full list and the Moodle 4.3 new features page for some screenshots): Activity Card Redesign. Educators and learners will appreciate the revitalised activity cards – now more compact and intuitive, ensuring seamless management of groups, restrictions, and activity completion conditions. Default activity completion. Courtesy of the Moodle Users Association’s valuable input, administrators and educators can now set default activity completion conditions at the site level. Course communications. The launch of our new integration with the Matrix Messaging system provides access to a contemporary messaging interface directly in the heart of Moodle. Additional functionality will make working with other messaging systems (e.g. Slack or Teams) more seamless in the future. These new in-course communication options will help educators and learners stay connected, foster increased engagement, and work more closely together! Other interesting features LTI external tools Report Builder Gradebook enhancements Security enhancements Question bank enhancements And much more! Thanks for using MoodleCloud and we hope you like the new features! Cheers, Frances MoodleCloud - Product Manager

Forum Post: 
Post title: Clone/copy a Moodle cloud server to my own location?
Post description: Hey there. I currently have a Moodlecloud server , and I would like to have a perfectly identical copy on my home server for things like experimentation without messing up the important one, having an alternative location, etc. How do I accomplish this? Thanks in advance! GSpencer
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, First a few things you should know - MoodleCloud extends core Moodle to provide things like BigBlueButton, a new theme and some other optimisations (caching etc) so you wont have a 100% exact mirror but it will be close enough. You can download Moodle from https://download.moodle.org/ You can perform a Site Export of your MoodleCloud site from the Portal by visiting https://moodlecloud.com and logging in using your site name and admin password, then going to Tools -> Export my site. You can restore your site export to the database on your home server and with a few minor tweaks of the provided config.php you will be up and running in no time. If you need help along the way be sure to check https://docs.moodle.org as we cannot provide support for sites hosted off the MoodleCloud platform.
Comment 2: Great, I expected as much. Although I'm curious what you mean by 'a few minor tweaks of the provided config.php'. Is it only updating the url of the new server, or something more involved? GS

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle Deleted MoodleCloud site
Post description: Hi everyone, Moodle recently deleted our MoodleCloud site while we were working on other priority projects. We've made several attempts to contact Moodle Support to inquire recovering the site with no response to date. Do you have any suggestions who to contact or any other actions to take in recovering the deleted site? Thanks in advance for any feedback.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Truc, Please submit a request from the MoodleCloud Support page (use the top-left "Submit a request" link). It is possible, for a fee, to perform a site restore. Please note that due to high volume, the backups are only kept for a few weeks after removal, so proceed quickly. Mathieu
Comment 2: The same happened to us. If you were using the Free version of MoodleCloud, they have a 60 day inactivity policy and after 60 days (and at least one notification - that we missed), they delete the site. Here is the message I received from support - and in a follow up i learned that after 90 days there is no chance of recovery - so, if you are willing / able to pay $100 AUD, then i would move quickly if you are in the 60-90 day window: "Sorry to hear you have lost your site, under our free site retention policy, if your Moodle for Free site has been inactive for more than 60 days, it is removed in order to maintain a vibrant and active system for all users. We do send a reminder email message before the site is removed. Your site - xxxx.moodlecloud.com was deleted on the 9 October 2019. A warning email about your inactivity on your site was sent to your email address on the 25 September 2019. To get the site back online, our technical team are able to restore your site data but as this is performed by our technical team there is a fee of $100.00 AUD to go ahead with the site restore. Also please note that to comply with our GDPR policies, as you are no longer as a customer, you will need to reply to this email for us to go ahead with the site restore within 14 days of the site deletion or your site will be deleted from our systems."

Forum Post: 
Post title: Using Google Drive to save file space on Moodlecloud
Post description: Hi all, I've been tinkering with Google Drive as a repository on my Moodlecloud site and it's all set up and working as far as I can see. I can add files from Google Drive to Moodlecloud directly using the filepicker. What I would like to be able to do is to add them without the files being added to the file storage limit. I appreciate that I could just create a shareable link on Google Drive and copy/paste that into the Moodlecloud site but this seems to defeat the advantage of using GDrive as a repository. Is there something simple that I've missed - I thought it might be in the Internal/External/Internal and External options in the Repository settings but this seems to make no difference. cheers Colin
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Colin, Using the repository system should indeed use the file directly from google drive and not count in your quota, provided the setup is done to use all "external" options, as you pointed out. Moodle does however save the file locally as draft, which gets removed later (4 days in the current Moodle version, iirc), which could explain the quota change you see. Mathieu
Comment 2: Thanks Mathieu, I tried these things and left it a week but the files are still being counted in our Moodlecloud storage. Does anyone have any other suggestions?
Comment 3: Hi Colin, I've been away for a while - I'm sorry to see this didn't work as expected. Can you confirm that (under "/admin/tool/oauth2/issuers.php") there is a "System account connected" for the google drive entry?
Comment 4: Hi Matthieu, Could you point me to the documentation for creating a Google Drive entry (as you state above). I'm a few steps behind you I think but want to achieve the same thing Colin is doing. Your help is really appreciated. Louis
Comment 5: Hi Louis, The documentation is at https://docs.moodle.org/33/en/Google_Drive_repository and the first step is to do the OAuth2 setup in your Google account, as explained on https://docs.moodle.org/33/en/OAuth_2_Google_service I suggest your read both pages completely before you get started. Make sure to connect a "System account" (on the OAuth2 services page in Moodle). As explained on the "Google Drive repository" page (linked above), you should use a dedicated account for this purpose (this is the account that will keep a copy of your files on google drive). Depending if you are using an enterprise (vs personal) Google account, the screenshots might be different from what you get on the site, but the process is the same. Once this is all done, you may want to enable the Google auth, by following the documentation on https://docs.moodle.org/33/en/OAuth_2_authentication Mathieu
Comment 6: Dear Mathieu, Thanks you soooo much for your reply. I'll read it all and let you know how it went (I knew I shouldn't "cowboy" the process). I'm particularly interested in working around the 200Mb data storage limit of MoodleCloud. Louis
Comment 7: Colin, I've been trying this as well (and/or with Microsoft OneDrive) and I haven't found a way around it either. At the moment I have to put the link to the files inside the assignment/ lesson which sort of defeats the purpose. Please let me know if you've made any progress. Thanks, Louis

Post title: discounts for Non profit organizations on Moodle cloud
Post description: Hello, We're an NPO based in India working with 10000 students and are looking potential ways to utilize Moodle as LMS in the work we do. Kindly share any subsidies/discounts for NPOs working at scale and how can we apply to them. Let us also know the pricing model for more than 5000 active users.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi there, Thanks for your interest in MoodleCloud . Please note that our plans go up to 750 users (see our Standard Plans in the MoodleCloud website). If you need to have more users than that, you'd have to either host your own Moodle LMS instance, or get a hosted Moodle LMS solution though us or a Moodle Certified Partner ( get in touch with our commercial team ). As for discounts for NPOs, our MoodleCloud Not-For-Profit/NGO program has been paused until further notice. So, we are no longer accepting or processing applications for free Not-for-Profit/NGO MoodleCloud sites. With regard to discounts for hosted Moodle LMS solutions, I do not have any information on that topic. You'd have to contact our commercial team to learn more. Thank you for your understanding, Christian

Exception - Call to undefined function ldap_connect() This is the same for any LDAP related plugins I attempt to configure. /admin/phpinfo.php comes back blank /admin/environment.php doesn't list the ldap extension Is there any way at all to enable to LDAP extension on MoodleCloud? I'm using the Free site (3.2.x). Thanks for any help!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi B J Currently LDAP authentication method isn't supported on MoodleCloud, so it would explain the problems you are having with the setup. Unfortunately there is some confusion with configuration settings you can access. The MoodleCloud team are looking to resolve this by disabling these from view. We do review the features available on MoodleCloud regularly so it may be enabled at some point in the future. Hope this helps clarify. Chris
Comment 2: Thanks for your reply Chris, I guessed that might be the case. Might have to consider the other authentication methods in the meantime.

Post title: Add Google Analytics to MoodleCloud
Post description: Hi, I was wondering if there is a way to add in google analytics to a moodlecloud site.  Instructions tell me I need to add the tracking code to the html head; however that is not editable as it appears to be overridden in config.php (which we cant change). Any other options?  What other type of analytics are available from MoodleCloud (page views etc.)? Thanks.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: hi there i tried these steps and it worked Get your tracking code from your Google Analytics account. Go to  installation folder and open “config.php” with a text editor. Go to the end of the file and add . $cfg->additionalhtmlhead = " ". Paste your tracking code into the “addionalhtmlhead” as shown in the figure below.
Comment 2: Hi Monty, Has you have seen, the additionalhtmlhead config option is indeed locked on MoodleCloud for security reasons. Unfortunately, I don't think there is a way to use Google Analytics on your MoodleCloud site at this time. Mathieu
Comment 3: Hi Even if you could track you site with Google Analytics, don't do it! Google is a surveillance infrastructure of unimaginable dimensions and they abuse your data. The very special irony of Google Analytics is that Google doesn't have to do anything actively, it is you, the webmaster, who sends data on each click of your users to Google. So you are sending other's data to Google. The law is catching up with this abuse and it is on the way to become illegal. Even now the major browsers have mechanisms built-in to block this communication. This is too broad a topic, or rather a whole bag of issues, to be discussed here. But unavoidable we touch it many forums on moodle.org. Here is a random short explanation I found: https://webmasters.stackexchange.com/questions/50824/what-are-the-security-implications-of-using-google-analytics . Please inform yourself. Generally people don't like to be tracked. There are so many tools and methods to find out whether a site is tracking. So finally the tracking can back-fire depending on the awareness of your users. If you have the trust of users, why don't you collect data transparently? Everybody knows that each click is "trackable" if one is logged in.
Comment 4: Thanks everyone for your help with this. I did notice that you can put it into the html body and it works just fine. Having said that we may not even need the analytics portion at this stage based on my discussions with my client as we mainly need reporting details which moodle already supports so I think we are good.
Comment 5: Interesting to know, since Google's documentation specifically requests the tag to be in the "head" section.

Post title: User Authentication
Post description: I recently signed up for a Moodle Cloud account with only 50 users.  I manually add these students to my site and then enroll them in my course.  I can clearly see how to remove them from my course.  However, I cannot figure out how to remove them from my site (remove authenticated users).  I want to be sure to keep my site users to less than 50 so may need to be able to delete some.  How do you do that?
Comments associated with the post:

Comment 2: Oh I see, I was doing that, but doing it within the course. That worked when you do it without enter the course. Thanks so much.

Forum Post: 
Post title: New MoodleCloud plans for up to 1000 users (and much more!)
Post description: Hi All, Thanks to everyone who participated in the MoodleCloud Users Survey in September this year. You were all very clear about what you wanted, so now your wishes are coming true! We are excited to let you know that we have just launched new MoodleCloud Plans, and they’re pack full of what you were asking for! New Large plan By far the most requested improvement was larger plans, and today we can announce the MoodleCloud Large Plan, with 1000 users and 5GB storage. New User Count that excludes Suspended users on all new plans For new plans, we’ve changed the way we count Users to something that is better value for you. For all MoodleCloud customers on one of the new plans launched this week, suspended users will no longer be counted in your user quota. This works much better than deleting users, as you will still have their data and will be able to run reports on what they’ve previously completed. Storage increases on all new plans We’ve increased the storage on all new plans, and more than doubled it on others! Starter: Was 200MB, now 250MB Mini: Was 200MB, now 500MB Small: Was 400MB, now 1,000MB Medium: Was 1,000MB, now 2,500MB Large: 5,000MB New Free Trials Everyone not yet using MoodleCloud will be able to start a 45 Day Free Trial that includes all features from all plans. We thought it seemed fair that you should be able to try it before you buy it! Ready to upgrade? You can upgrade your plan from any existing Starter and School plans to the new plans at any time (the system will automatically give you a pro-rata refund on any unused time in your old plan too)! If you do choose to move from a Moodle for School plan to one of our new MoodleCloud plans, please note that the following features are no longer available: School theme & school domain (sitename.moodle.school) MoodleCloud theme Group Choice Activity Level up! Quizventure We have more information on important changes to read before upgrading from Moodle School to the new Moodle LMS plans . Moodle School plans no longer available for purchase They were with us for five years, but we’ve finally decided to retire the old Moodle for School plans, and they are no longer available for purchase. You can retain your existing Moodle for School plan if you are already on it (we’re not requiring you upgrade at this time, although we’ll highly likely end these plans entirely when Moodle v4 comes out in early 2022). Thanks, and happy Moodling! Lee Goldsworthy Product Manager - MoodleCloud
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Thats exciting indeed. Does 100 user per session still apply to this?
Comment 2: Hi Sameer, The 100 user limit on new plans only applies to BigBlueButton sessions. If your plan includes 1000 users then they are all able to access your MoodleCloud site simultaneously! I hope this helps. Kelly
Comment 3: Thanks Kelly for your reply. It is so soothing to hear so. I hope it would be updated on pricing page for clarity. Sameer
Comment 4: Hi, I am currently testing with the free plan and I'm confused about the pricing of the "Starter" plan and the allowed number of users: is this 50 user accounts altogether on the site, or per course? And are 10 or 100 participants allowed for BBB sessions? You say 100 but on the site, it says 10 somewhere. Lastly, if I want to teach in the US, but I am located in Europe, can I get US servers? Thanks and cheers from Berlin!
Comment 5: Hi Marcus, With our Starter Plan you can have up to 50 active user accounts and they are all able to access BigBlueButton sessions. There is an error on the page which will be corrected shortly - our apologies for any confusion. At signup you are able to select which region you would like your site to be hosted. You can choose from Europe, Australia or US. Even if you are located in Europe you can choose US servers. I hope that this helps. Kelly
Comment 6: They make way more sense than the previous one... if theyt were available earlier, we would probably still be with you guys, but 500 wasnt enough for us and 1Gb was a pain!
Comment 7: Hello, I have many problems with the school theme (moodlecloud for school), maybe is it for that reason that moodle no longer include it in the new version?. I can't manage anything (settings, participants, qualification) within the courses, the administration, navigation, dashboard blocks do not appear, but they appear in boost theme. It will be that I keep trying to solve the problems with this theme (school).
Comment 8: Hi Ly, Existing Moodle for School plan sites should still be running normally. If you have customised the theme, then unbalanced HTML tags may make pages completely unusable (this is a known bug in Moodle documented here ). I f you contact MoodleCloud support from your Portal, we can investigate if this has occurred in your site. Warm regards, Kelly

Post title: Verify domain ownership on Google Search  for MoodleCloud-based website
Post description: Hi! I am struggling to verify the domain I own, because it is based on Moodle Cloud and the option to add a tag in the head-section of the site or upload an HTML file under the main directory  does not work. Has anyone faced similar issue with a cloud-based Moodle (at https://moodlecloud.com/ )? I am adding the question in the Themes forum, as there might be a setting, related to the theme, which i am missing, that will allow me to verify the site ... If  that's not the place, i will be thankful to guide me to the right place to raise the question.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, I cannot grasp what it is you are having a problem with.If you own a Domain Name then it has to be on a server in order to be seen. If it is not in MOODLE CLOUD THEN WHERE IS IT? Confused. Mary
Comment 2: ''Verifying a domain name'' is what every site owner does on Google Search Console https://search.google.com/search-console/ in order to utilize a number of google services. In my case, i need to run the procedure in order to use Google Oau th service (students register with their google account). ''Verifying a domain name'' is done in 2 different ways - you either enter a meta-tag provided through Google Search Console in the head section of your theme, or you add an HTML file in your directory. Moodle Cloud restricts both so my question was if someone has faced the same situation and has found a backdoor.
Comment 3: I didn’t know you could use your own domain name on MoodleCloud (other than just pointing it as a forward) - which package are you on? If you’re just pointing your domain to your MoodleCloud site, then you can use the DNS verification method with a TXT record - see https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/9008080?hl=en . In fact, you could do that even if you can use your domain on MoodleCloud. However, it’s definitely not themes related and there is a dedicated MoodleCloud forum ;)
Comment 4: Thanks, Jon! The reason I posted here is to find out if someone is aware on how to edit theme's <head> element on a MoodleCloud site, no matter the reason. Btw , the <body> element is available to change - add tags, code, etc., but not the <head> from what i can see. Now, when it comes to my particular need to add a meta-tag in the head element, it is because i need this verification of the subdomain (nsd.moodle.school). Because otherwise I cannot leverage the full potential of Google API plugins. Forwarding an external, verified domain towards my MoodleCloud site will not solve this. Thanks for the comment, though. It seems i just won't be able to add this meta-tag.
Comment 5: The head tag is locked down by a config setting in MoodleCloud . I suspect that’s related to the fact that there is potential to do some malicious things in the head of an html page. However, you raise a good point that things like google analytics and search functionality often requires an entry in that section. Might be worth asking in the MoodleCloud forum if they could add a special setting in the theme to allow that content without affecting head in general.
Comment 6: I'll just move this to the MoodleCloud forum so it gets seen there ;)

Post title: Are Ghostscript and Unoconv considered plugins?
Post description: That is, the grade feature seems to require them, and the feature appears as part of my moodlecloud site, but I don't know how to install and use them, or if they are plugins (and thus not available on moodlecloud)? Any help greatly appreciated. SL
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Sarra, Unoconv isn't a plugin in a Moodle sense. It is a command line tool which Moodle uses. On MoodleCloud sites there is the "MoodleCloud Converter" - read more about it here https://support.moodle.com/hc/en-us/articles/115003118111-What-is-MoodleCloud-Converter- The MoodleCloud Converter is included on
Starter and Moodle for School plans. If you are subscribed to one of
these plans, it is available and enabled by default. If you upgrade from a Free plan, it will be enabled automatically when the upgrade is completed. I hope this helps. Many thanks.
Comment 2: Thank you so much for your reply. Does that mean that it is not able to be enabled on a free plan, or that it is not enabled by default but can be enabled? Sarra
Comment 3: Hi Sarra, Yes. It means you cannot enable it on a free plan. If you upgrade your site to a Starter plan for $80 AUD/year then this feature will be available to you. Please see the link below for more information: https://moodlecloud.com/app/en/ Many thanks.

Post title: Trouble with the My Courses menu
Post description: I am having trouble with the My Courses Menu on the side menu  This is a live site so I also have a second free version of Moodle cloud to try things out on as a testing environent, The issue Neither Admins nor Enrolled participants can see their course listed under the My Courses tab.  What I would like to do is to either a) Remove the My courses listing from the block menu.  I have achieved this on the UAT environment by using Admin - > plugins - > blocks -> Courses -> (ticking) hide all course link and logging in as a participant  But its not working on the live environment I continue to get an empty list .  Other settings look identical? b) Configure my courses so that they appear on that list.  I cant see how to do this having searched around for a couple of hours.  Being Moodle cloud there is limited access to editing themes (quite rightly) Any thoughts on this would be appreciated. Thanks in advance
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: OK so.. a few things to check.. Admins won't by default see anything in the My courses link because they automatically have acess to all courses. You need to enrol them as teachers into a course (althought arguably if they are going to be teaching they should have a separate login) A usual reason correctly enrolled participants don't see their courses in the My courses tab is that the course start date is the future (or the end) No need to edit themes
Comment 2: Mary That's very helpful, I have not set a start or end date , so will give that a go. Thanks very much  for responding. Average of ratings: - Permalink Show parent Reply

Post title: Change my URL in MoodleCloud
Post description: Hello, Am I able to change my url from https://estudiobiblico.moodle.school/ to https://bibleschool.moodle.school/ ? If so, will there be any repercussions?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, Yes, it's possible to do it and there are no repercussions - apart from the obvious fact any outside URL to the original site will not work anymore. We do charge a fee for this operation. Please log in to https://moodlecloud.com/app/en/portal/ and open a request from the "Support tab" if you would like to go ahead with this. Mathieu
Comment 2: Hi, Am I able to do this manually? Now, if I were to do it through you guys, will I need to do a backup and restore somehow after I get my new url?
Comment 3: Hi, Sorry, this is a task that has to be performed server -side as it requires some operations directly in the database (like rewriting some links ), which has to be done while your site is inactive. There is a short maintenance window (a few minutes) where your site is offline while this is happening. No other operation is required from your side (no backup/restore). Mathieu
Comment 4: Hi Mathieu, dumb question but on an unrelated item where is the 'create request' on the support tab? I only see an option to reachout to a partner. THanks.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Navigation Drawer and Custom Menu Drop-Down not working!?
Post description: Hi all, Thanks in advance for any help you can give me, I've been puzzled by this for a while. To get started, my understanding of css and scss is extremely limited to being able to find the element I want to change in the Inspector and muddling my way through until I get the desired result...so you know where my knowledge level is at. Scenario : I have built an e-learning site using Moodlecloud. The hardware and browser the site is going to be accessed from is a Panasonic Toughpad FZ-M1 running MS Edge. The User profile is locked down so I cannot use another browser, and I cannot change the hardware either. Issue : When I access the site using Edge on the Toughpad, the hamburger menu and the custom drop down menus do not work. If I tap on them a box appears around the outside of the menu item, but the side-drawer nor the drop-down menu shows. I have narrowed down the issue to the pseudo-class focus-within, which I have found here: https://mysite.com/theme/styles.php/boost/1652874062_1649605921/all (The site is hidden behind a login page so I'm not sure how useful sharing the link to the site would be?) And it looks like this: .dropdown-item:focus-within {outline:0;background-color:#EEBC1D;color:#fff}.dropdown-item:active a,.dropdown-item:hover a,.dropdown-item:focus a, .dropdown-item:focus-within a{color:#fff} I think I may have found a potential workaround here , but I have no idea how to implement this to affect the hamburger side-menu and my custom drop-down menus. This is an absolute deal-breaker, as aforementioned I cannot change the browser or the hardware. Any help would be much appreciated.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello Matt, we had the same/a similar annoying flaw. Our workaround was adding the following code to "Within HEAD" section at Site Administration > Appearance > Additional HTML: <style> .dropdown-item:focus-within a { color: #00b894; } .dropdown-item:hover a { color: #000; font-weight: bolder; } </style> Don't forget to clear caches.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Display group membership in system notifications to graders
Post description: Hello Our students are assigned to different groups in our courses on MoodleCloud. Knowing the group membership of the students is important for the grading of their forum posts and submitted assignments. I am now looking for a way to display the group membership in the system notifications our teachers get, when the students make a forum post or submit an assignment. Can anyone help me with this? It would be highly appreciated. Esther
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Esther, While notifications can be edited using the Language Customisation feature in Moodle LMS, this is not available in MoodleCloud. But if your teachers are assigned to groups within a course, they should only receive notifications for activities completed by the students in the same group (provided that the activity is set as "Separate groups" and that teachers don't have the capability accessallgroups - Please refer to Groups FAQ ). Best, Christian
Comment 2: Hi Christian Thank you very much for your answer, this is helpful. Kind regards, Esther

Forum Post: 
Post title: Difference between Moodlecloud and Download
Post description: Hello I am new to moodle, I am reading articles but as there are so many I'm getting a bit lost. can anyone to me what is the difference between installing the free moodle on desk top or using a moodlecloud account ? Thank you
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: In the simplest terms: if you install free Moodle on your desktop you can't easily run courses for students on it because  it is just on your desktop and not on the internet. (Some people will try to tell  you that you can, but it's very complex) People do this to test Moodle. MoodleCloud is a service offered by the people who make Moodle and they (we) set up a Moodle site online for you so you don't have to do the technical stuff and can just get on with teaching your class. There are longer answers and more details  but hopefully that helps. Also - I see you are currently in our Learn Moodle MOOC. You could get yourself a MoodleCloud site to try restoring your practice course, if you wanted to.

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud's HTML5 Player and "Hidden from Vimeo" video iFrame
Post description: Hi everyone, So I've encountered a bit of an issue while using some of the additional security features on Vimeo and the HTML5 embedding feature on a "Page" source. I'm wondering if anyone here can help with info on the matter. On Vimeo I have my videos uploaded as a "Hidden from Vimeo" video and the privacy setting to only allow for the videos to be embedded on approved domains. The only approved domain I have listed are my moodle pages "_____. MoodleCloud .com". After copying and pasting the embed code from the Vimeo video into the Moodle "Page" source under HTML5 I get a notification from the Vimeo player "Sorry Because of its privacy settings, this video cannot be played here." I checked Vimeos information boards and found this: "If you’re seeing this error in the player, the video you are watching has domain -level privacy enabled. The video’s owner can adjust the domains where a video can appear within “Where can this video be embedded?” section of the embed settings page. If the domain is listed in your video settings page, but the error is still appearing, the domain specified in your address bar may be different from the domain sent to the Vimeo player. In these cases, the privacy error may appear. Contact a web developer to confirm if there is anything in your site's HTML code that could be blocking the referrer from reaching our player iframe." Is the HTML player reporting a different domain back to Vimeo? I am using a trial version of moodle to evaluate Moodles efficacy for the task. Will this issue persist after I move from the trial version to the paid version of Moodle? Is there a way to have my site report the proper URL back to Vimeo to reach the player iframe? Thanks in advance for any insight, Josh P.S. I'm new to the forum so if I posted in the wrong thread let me know and I will remediate the issue.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Josh, I know this post was posted a while ago, but I will do my best to offer support. We have worked with Vimeo in our organisation for the exact reason, having domain control. The platform is very effective in this way. From the information supplied it seems you are listing a domain that is not specific, so you are telling Vimeo it can accept any subdomain, but Vimeo does not work in this way, you need to list the exact website URL . In our experience this worked the best.

Forum Post: 
Post title: 'invalid' being added to email address
Post description: Several user accounts on our MoodleCloud site have had an 'invalid' added to their email address. Why is this happening and how can it be prevented?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Dan, The .invalid is automatically appended to an email address when a bounce occurs if the sent email can't be delivered because of a permanent issue. For example, a bounce might occur if the user's email address is either invalid or the mailbox is full or unavailable (even an "out-of-office reply" has triggered this bounce). This information is supplied by AWS (Amazon Web Services), who we use to host all MoodleCloud sites and deliver site related emails. MoodleCloud appends a user's email with ".invalid" when AWS tells us the email address bounces. This is automated to avoid repeated attempts to send an email that is bouncing back. You can manually remove ".invalid" from the users' email addresses in your site and this should resolve the issue, unless the user's mailbox does not accept the email. The user should also check their email filters to make sure they accept (and not automatically reject) the email notifications from your MoodleCloud site. If your users use an institutional email, check your organisation's email server for filters that may have been applied that detect the email is from AWS/bulk email, and reject it. Regards, Christian
Comment 2: Thanks, Christian, that helps. Although, one of the emails that was getting an 'invalid' tacked on was mine, dan@sabier.org, which is a manager account. There are some 'fake' emails I created for students who don't have email and will never use email and are just test accounts. The other email address also use the sabier.org domain name. Could Moodle or AWS be marking any email with that domain as invalide?
Comment 3: Hi Dan, The ".invalid" is added per email address, as the system is notified an email bounced. There is no bulk operation done for a domain as a whole.
Comment 4: We had the same issue, to stop tutors and admin staff getting .invalid when they went on holiday and had an out of office on, I instigated a rule on our email server that would not allow any email being sent to the noreply@ email address which sends all emails on behalf of the moodlecloud. This doesn't resolve the issue for learners, but did resolve the issue for staff. The main issue was that users aren't told that they are no longer going to receive emails, they just stop. So staff members missed assignments being handed in, and other announcements. We then do a monthly check on learners who have had .invalid added to their email address and see if something has changed. 98% of the time they have had an out-of-office on which has caused a bounce back.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Become a host
Post description: Hi , I would like to add plugins to my page but I cannot do so if I do not host the website myself. Can anyone explain how I can do that? Thank you very much! Best, J.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Jessica, We have a lot of plugins already installed. Moodle for Free sites are designed to be easy to use, and come with the standard MoodleCloud theme More. Your site is preconfigured with the plugins that are made
available in the standard Moodle version. Also included is an integrated
the open source web conferencing System, BigBlueButton . Starter sites include the same plugins as Moodle for Free sites and
also come with the popular and very useful Custom Certificate plugin
allowing you to reward students with certificates through your courses. Moodle for School sites come with the most popular and Moodle
plugins, that will cover the needs of most Educators. The current list
of provided plugins is available at https://moodle.com/cloud/school .
Keep an eye on the list as it will grow, and we always appreciate
feedback and suggestions, so let us know if you think a certain plugin
would benefit Moodle for School users. If you require specific plugins for your Moodle site, contact one of our Moodle Partners to discuss your custom hosting needs. Please take a look at our FAQs for more information - https://moodle.com/cloud/faq/ Many thanks.

Post description: I sent this via the contact form from cloud page twice. Never received any responses. Perhaps someone can help me. I need to know if basic cloud option has any restrictions on plugins etc.  Need to host an exam for very few students but must meet state requirements for real estate license. 100 multiple choice. ( no bathroom breaks ) Can pass a question and return to it later within the 3 hour time limit. Must be able to deliver a custom completion certificate. In most cases may never be but one person taking exam at any given time.

Comment 1: Others will probably give more advice, but I will try to get discussions started. As I recall, MoodleCloud does not allow plugins. However, you don't need any plugins for quizzes. I would say "no," but maybe someone else knows how to do this.
Comment 2: Hello Paul (and RIck) Sorry you didn't get a reply from the Moodle.com contact form - just to let you know I have moved your post here to the dedicated MoodleCloud forum which is regularly monitored by the MoodleCloud team. (And yes, you can set a custom certificate based on quiz completion or passing)
Comment 3: Hi Paul, One of our Moodle SDRs did send a couple of emails the 16th of February replying to all your questions. Please check your inbox to find their responses.

Post title: Respondus 4.0 and Moodle Cloud
Post description: I am a new Moodle subscriber and just recently acquired Respondus 4.0 to assist with loading test banks. I cannot get the Respondus software to publish to Moodle. After previewing creating and previewing the test questions in Respondus, I have selected the Publish tab and been directed to the screen to enter the Moodle web page url, pass word and login and selecting Next. An error message appears that says Web Services on the Moodle server cannot be found. Respondus support says I should be able to install a Respondus plugin to sole the problem. However, Moodle Cloud subscription does not allow for plugin installs. We are one week away from going live with our first online course using Moodle and it is appearing to be a wreck. Worst, there is nowhere to turn for support. Is there anyone out there that have had a similar experience?  If so, how did you resolve.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Moving to MoodleCloud forum...
Comment 2: Moodle Cloud offers a fixed set of plug-ins as advertised under "Extra plug-in pack" on https://moodlecloud.com/app/en/ . Discovered only one week before going on-line? Must be a very dynamic group. ;) You could try the Open Source route to (relatively) secure on-line examinations with Moodle in connection with the https://safeexambrowser.org/ .
Comment 3: Thank you for the response. We are not programmers and therefore cannot take advantage of Open source tools. We purchased the Moodle cloud subscription thining that it was a plug and play package. Initally all went well with our anility to build our courses and use the other tools. The textbook manufacturer assured us that their test bank was compatible with Moodle and that Respondus 4.0 would allow for us to upload their test bank without issue. Moodle is included in their Profiler and as such, we assumed it too would be fairly easy when the time came for its usage. We are now at that time but the usage does not appear to be readily aavaiable. We have over the last month moved the installation to another PC thinking it might be a configuration compatibility issue but achieved the same results. We are considering upgrading to the Moodle cloud for school edition but fear that we will encounter the same issue (if all packages contain the same plugins across the platform). Our question i thought was simple, does Moodle Cloud support Respondus 4.0 and if so, under which pricing plan? Or, has anyone in the Moodle Cloud Forum experienced the same problem and if so, how did they resolve it?
Comment 4: I have no official capacity in this forum. Just saw that your enquiry is waiting and responded because of the urgency. The people who manage Moodle Cloud will join soon, I hope. The Moodle for Schools plan doesn't offer the Respondus connectivity, I'm afraid. See the last line "Plug-in and theme installation" in https://moodlecloud.com/app . Also "mouse-over" the question mark there. But there is no reason for panic. Taking a Moodle site from one server to another is quick (for the routined). It is called https://docs.moodle.org/en/Moodle_migration . If you upgrade you Moodle to a Moodle Partner they will handle that for you. They are the same company. It is worth clarifying with your content providers whether the Respondus component is a must. Moodle has a complete work-flow in itself for on-line exams, from the very simple ones to higher education. No programming is necessary. Neither does the Open Source component Safe Exam Browser I mentioned. It is a stripped-down browser and a kiosk system for the students computers to restrict many ways of cheating.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle Cloud to replace Moodle Hosting
Post description: Hello, Installing Moodle on a server and hosting it yourself, or even through a partner, is quite a difficult and frustrating task. Even when using a partner there are several issues to deal with, such as lack of tech support and communication issues. My question is, what is the ultimate goal of Moodle Cloud ? Is it to essentially to do away with Moodle Hosting? In the near future, will Moodle Hosting be a thing of the past? Will Moodle Cloud eventually cost money? I am all for moving away from Moodle Hosting partners and going directly through Moodle Cloud when it becomes powerful enough. Just wondering if I am on the right track with this assumption. Thank you
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I don't work for Moodle HQ, but my guess is the answer is: No. I think Moodle cloud exists to give a low barrier to entry for people just starting with Moodle, or who want a very small site with minimal support. Hosting a large Moodle site is still a serious undertaking, so there will continue to be a market where people can buy that from a range of commercial suppliers, especially Moodle partners. And, the whole point of open source is the flexibility it gives, so there will still be many people who take Moodle, customise it, and host it themselves, to get exactly the solution they want.
Comment 2: Hi Sami, These are all great questions. Tim, while not working for Moodle HQ has answered them very well - Thanks Tim! The goal of MoodleCloud is to help as many users as possible get started with a Moodle site. It's a service that allows anyone to experience Moodle within minutes and helps users build a Moodle site to a certain level (500 users and 1Gb of file storage). As we offer limited support, we feel once you get to that level, you are ready for that next step and Moodle Partners can offer a more tailored solution and provide the necessary support and assistance for hosting a large site. As Tim mentions, the flexibility of Moodle means you can shape the solution that's right for you and choosing an appropriate hosting option is part of this. So it's likely that Moodle hosting will continue to will come in many shapes and sizes from many providers. Thanks Chris

Post title: change color of orange button
Post description: Hi - How do I change or remove the background color of the orange button at the top next to the menu? It could be white as long as I can change the test color to blue. Image attached for reference Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Dear Alyssa, Please note that you need to be quite technical to attempt this,as putting in incorrect CSS may break your site. Go to your MoodleCloud login screen at: MoodleCloud site login [yoursitename].moodlecloud.com Log in as an admin user Go to Site administration Go to Appearance Go to Themes - Boost (assuming you are using the Boost Theme) Go to Advanced Settings Here you can insert CSS or SCSS to make changes to the appearance of your site. You can also change presets. Learn more about presets here. I hope this helps. Kelly

Forum Post: 
Post title: Manual Backup for MOodle Cloud
Post description: We are using moodle cloud and I was wondering if someone could tell me how to setup a manual backup. I go to Administration < Courses but when I change the first setting to Manual and hit save it defaults back to disabled. Could someone please provide me with some useful instructions.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I believe that you can back up individual courses (it works for me.)  But maybe others will be able to point you to other solutions. (So, I can develop a course in MoodleCloud, and then move it to a production environment, for example.)
Comment 2: In MoodleCloud, the setting for whether automated backup is disabled, enabled or manual is defined as 'disabled’ in config.php, and therefore locked and cannot be changed by you. When you try to change it, it will revert to 'disabled' when you save the changes. As Rick says though, you can take a backup of any course individually by going to Course Administration > Backup

Post title: Share YouTube video in Big Blue Button
Post description: Hi, As of January - 2019, Big Blue Button supports sharing YouTube video. Please see the following link: However, I am unable to find this feature in BBB on my moodle cloud site. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks Ash
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Ash, The description of the video you have linked to mentions https://test.bigbluebutton.org/ and I believe the Youtube sharing might not have been released in BBB itself yet. Since MoodleCloud BBB server is managed by BBB itself, I have forwarded your question to their team. I'll let you know if and when this option is coming to MoodleCloud. Also, I'll point out that this is only in the new HTML5 client, which (on LInux at least) I can only access from Firefox. Mathieu
Comment 2: Hi Ash, I'm told the new HTML5 client will be launched on April 20. See https://blindsidenetworks.com/2019/03/15/html5-client-is-coming/ for details. Mathieu
Comment 3: Thanks Mathieu; much appreciated. Ash
Comment 4: Greetings from Hong Kong Tested the new BBB YouTube feature & must say it's very impressive! Question. As some of our students are based in China, and YouTube is blocked by China's Great Firewall, how could we PUSH video contents to the students in China either locally from the teacher's MacBook, NAS or other recommended method for Moodle Cloud users. Thanks in advance for your help. Peter
Comment 5: Being a web service one can not "push" a Moodle in to the classroom. If the teachers can handle video files a portable Moodle could be the solution. See MoodleBox http://moodlebox.net , for example.
Comment 6: Hi Peter, Sharing videos with a classroom using Moodle goes beyond this discussion on MoodleCloud's BigBlueButton integration, so you will find better hints in the general help forum. I would point you to https://docs.moodle.org/36/en/Media_embedding as a first step - you can host a video anywhere and provided it's in the good format, it should play on Moodle. Youtube is convenient, but there are plenty of ways around it. Best regards, Mathieu
Comment 7: Thank you Visvanath Ratnaweera & Mathieu Petit-Clair for your comment & suggestion. Sorry I did not made myself clear enough, with hind sight, I should have emphasis it's the inability to share YouTube videos during teaching session using BBB that's causing the issue & question. Maybe a solution could be provided by BBB in not hard coding YouTube only for 'pushing' video to participants.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Accessing Moodle Cloud directory files
Post description: Good day, I am very new to Moodle (please forgive my basic questions). I am trying to access the Moodle Cloud server files so I can clean up any unused/ large files, etc. Is there a way to access these files much like you would a File Explorer in your PC? The only way I can do it so far is using the File Picker if I upload a file onto the course site but it's a bit cumbersome. I was hoping that  I would be able to use the File Picker without having to upload a file into the site (and also being able to expand the window so I can get the "lay of the land" in terms of my files). Thank you kindly. R
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Rap, MoodleCloud offers a list of all files that are counting towards your quota which you can access by clicking on the "USERS" and "QUOTA" graph at the top right of any page (next the messaging icon), and then clicking "See all". From here the list can (in some cases) take you to the rough location in Moodle where those files are used; which should help you delete the files (by clicking the "View in context " button). Unfortunately due to the way Moodle stores files it is not always possible to show precisely where they are used. Cheers, Cam

Forum Post: 
Post title: Allow quiz to be attempted offline
Post description: On my moodlecloud account, "Allow quiz to be attempted offline using the mobile app" sets itself to default "yes." That then blocks me from other options, such as sequential ordering and such. When I try to set it to "no" it sets itself back and continues to block me. I need my quiz questions to be sequential. What do I do? Windows 10
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello Sarra - just to clarify: You want your quiz to use sequential navigation, yes? You can do that but you can't have sequential navigation with offline attempts. So if you want your quiz to be attempted offline then you need free navigation. (If you click the i (help)icon next to the setting Allow quiz to be attempted offline using the mobile app, it tells you which features are available offline.)
Comment 2: (Just replying to myself for clarity here - I edited my previous post but only after it came via email. So basically: sequential navigation and **offline** attempts do not work together.
Comment 3: It is also worth noting that with offline attempts at a quiz cannot use interactive feedback behaviours, feedback will only be given when the students re-connect. This is because the correct answers are not stored in the browser.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle vs Moodle cloud
Post description: Hi all, 1- what is the main differences between Moodle and Moodle cloud ? 2- Can we use Moodle cloud in any university as MOOC in stead of normal Moodle? 3- What is the additional features in Moodle cloud that is can not found or solve the problems found in Moodle? Thanks
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: 1 Moodle cloud is mainly for testing Moodle out rather than real use for anything more than small courses IMHO . It is very restricted (as it probably should be to minimise support issues and ensure stability). 2 Given the limitations, could be an issue depending on the variables of the intended MOOC. 3 None, quite possibly the opposite - the restrictions on Moodle cloud means you can't use plugins etc. to fill a gap in your requirements.
Comment 2: Hi, It's worth pointing out here that MoodleCloud is not just used for testing and is used for real use in production Moodle installations. The free site does come with restrictions, however you can upgrade to a paid site on a larger plan which offers more file space, more users etc... See more: https://moodlecloud.com/en/ Thanks.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Forum stopped sending notifications
Post description: Suddenly our moodleclod.school site has stopped sending forum notifications. It was working without problems but since yesterday forums do not send notifications. Any idea about this problem, and how to solve it? I'm afraid that the problem can affect also other notifications (as notifications to students when an assignment is revised and corrected. Thank you. Enrique
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hola Enrique: I'm experiencing exactly the same problem. It's the second time it happens within a month. The first time, about a month ago, everything my students or I published on the forums was not sent via email. So, I had to revise every single forum to see if I had not corrected anything. After about a week, I started receiving the forum messages again and the service started to work normally. However, yesterday (10/06/2020) the same thing happened and we're not getting the emails from the forum posts. I would be grateful if someone could help or if we can do something to solve it. Thanks. Un saludo, Fernando.
Comment 2: Hola Fernando, I have realized also that notifications after revising assignments are not being sent, also. Messages and notifications after the students post their assignment, yes, they are sent. But not forum posts and notifications of teachers after the correction of an assignment. Do you have the same experience? I posted a ticket to Moodlecloud about 8 hours ago, but no reply for the moment. Saludos.
Comment 3: Hola Enrique: No uso "assignments" con mis estudiantes por lo que no te puedo ayudar en eso. Gracias por tu ayuda. Te agradecería si me pudieras decir qué te contestan de MoodleCloud. Un saludo, Fernando.
Comment 4: Hi Enrique, Sometimes when MoodleCloud are running upgrades there will be a delay to emails being sent. We've been running upgrades on and off for the past few days to deploy some additional server capacity and this will certainly be the cause of these delays. We should be finished with these upgrades before end of day today and all outbound emails will catch up. Sorry for the impact here (we do try to minimise these events as much as possible), but I think this draws attention to how we could better communicate when there are known delays to outbound emails (such as getting this information up on status.moodlecloud.com). I'll pick this up with the team. Thanks! Lee Goldsworthy Product Manager - MoodleCloud
Comment 5: Hi Lee, Thank you for your message. Yes, I think that it would be extremely convenient to advise when there are planned activities that will imply a delay in sending emails. In this way we could prepare ourselves. Also, we would avoid the uncertainty caused by a sudden interruption of the communications, not knowing the reasons. In our case, we have been sending emails (out of Moodlecloud) to our students, that now have received the information duplicated. It's not a good image... Regards. Enrique
Comment 6: Hello, Today I'm having the same problem: forum stopped sending notifications. Are you running upgrades? Thank you. Enrique

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud Trial Platform
Post description: Hi everyone, First of all, thanks in advance for help. We are triying MoodleCloud platform and we have an error triying to restore a backup file: "The file you tried to upload is too large for the server to process." But the system says we have Unlitimed file size, MAX 5G in total. The file we are triying to restore is 2GB size. (*.mbz) Anyone had this issue too? Thanks in advance for your help BR, S.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi BR, The maximum upload limit for your MoodleCloud site is 100MB, this applies to all uploads including Restore files. If you have access to the Course that the Backup was created from you can go into the course, remove any large items (videos, pictures) and then recreate the Backup File and do a Course Restore again. You will then be able to upload them to the newly created Course. You visit each individual course and click on Settings, then Backup to create the Backup. You will need to go to  go to "Site Admin/Server Files" and find the automated backup there and download it to your computer. You then go to Site Admin / Courses / Restore Course to upload that file and Restore. You can learn more about backup and restore here: ​​​​​​​ https://docs.moodle.org/en/Backup https://docs.moodle.org/en/Course_restore I hope that this helps. Warm regards,

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud and Moodle Certified Integrations
Post description: Do Moodle Certified Integrations work on MoodleCloud?  I am specifically looking to use ReadSpeaker within MoodleCloud.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Corey, MoodleCloud is our off-the-shelf, pre-configured version of Moodle LMS. It is pre-configured with only a few selected plugins and additional plugins cannot be installed. The flexibility of installing a wide variety of plugins to customise Moodle is a feature of Moodle LMS rather than MoodleCloud. If ReadSpeaker (or any other plugin) is essential for your business, you will need to use Moodle LMS . You can get Moodle LMS through a Moodle Certified Partner or you can download Moodle for free to install and host on your own server . Kind regards, Barbara

Forum Post: 
Post title: capturing individual reactions in Moodle
Post description: Hello. Is there any way to capture linger time and revisit time in moodlecloud?  Are there any predictive analytics available? thank you. Carolyn
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Carolyn, MoodleCloud records a log of all course and/or site activity. These are accessible either from the menu within a Course (Reports > Logs) or as site administrator (Site administration > Reports > Logs). These logs are actions (clicks) only and does not include length of time a user may have had that page open on their screen. The report offers filter options and you can also download these logs (download link is at the bottom of the log report page) for further analysis. Kind regards, Barbara

Forum Post: 
Post title: Auto-delete inactive users?
Post description: Is there a way on Moodle cloud to auto-delete user accounts that have been inactive for a specified period of time. I don't mean to unenroll or inactivate participants in a course. I mean to delete the user account all together.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: HI Laurie, You can manually delete user accounts permanently (Log in as Site Administrator, Click Site Administration, Click Users, Browse list of users, then click delete icon (bin) next to the user you want to delete. There is no auto-delete feature.
Comment 2: Hi Laurie, Maybe this plugin is what you are looking for: https://moodle.org/plugins/tool_usersuspension/versions I share this with the note that you have to be absolutly sure that you want to do this automatically, since well - code just does what we tell them to do, and restoring accounts is A) not easy en B) full with risks since you will not always get all the data back (especially using GDPR rules). You can also choice for creating a report in Moodle that shows you the accounts that have not been used in a specifiec period of time, so you can go through them . Download this report, and use the Moodle User upload way to remove those you want. Gem
Comment 3: Hi Laurie,

Forum Post: 
Post title: Question: BigBlueButton Recording on MoodleCloud
Post description: Hi, we are evaluating the MoodleCloud Mini Package ($250/ year, 100 max users, File Storage 200MB) for our online classes. Wondering if anyone can help with the below questions: 1. On the mini-package, if we record a class session with bigbluebutton, where will this recording be saved? Will the saved file count towards the File Storage limit of 200mb? 2. As our class sessions are 90 minutes long, am pretty sure that any video recording will exceed 200MB, has anyone encountered this issue, and can you advise what to do to work around it? 3. We may run concurrent classes at the same time, and will require concurrent Web-conferencing sessions. Can anyone advise how many sessions could we run at the same time? 4. Is the file storage limit of 200MB site-wide for all users? It seems very low and easy to hit the limit. Thank you!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, 1 & 2 - The short answer is that BBB recordings are managed by the BBB folks, so do not count in any way in your allocated quota. 3 - Concurrent access to BBB is fine and there is no hard limit on concurrent sessions at this time. 4 - Yes, indeed, it is fairly low and it's possible we increase this limit in the future. In any case, Moodle allows for extensive use of 3rd-party hosting services (Google drive, Dropbox, etc.) and can embed content from Youtube and other video hosting sites. I recommend taking advantage of these features to save on disk space. Looking forward to seeing your site on MoodleCloud! Mat
Comment 2: Thank you very much!

Post title: too small font size in writing contents
Post description: I'm using Moodlecloud with the Moodlecloud theme selected. I'm a teacher and I'm used to writing contents myself (page resources). And I prefer the TinyMCE editor . Well till last May I worked well, and the editor worked well for me and I used it nicely. Now (November) I noticed some significant changes in the Moodle GUI (although the theme is always the same: the Moodlecloud theme). No problem, the new GUI is nice too. But using the HTML editor is another thing. The font display size is too small for me to write easily: the paragraph style is 5 pixels high (height of the lowercase x letter). This is simply too much small for me. I've an 1920x1080 display too. Also, the <h5> headers, which I often use, are only 4 pixels high! Those sizes are shown to me only in the editor: when my students open the page I wrote, they see the paragraphs of 8 pixels high (lowercase letters) which is OK for them. Now, can I restore the previous font display size in my HTML text editor? Thanks in advance, Luigi
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Luigi, Indeed, there's an issue that appeared when the 'clean' base theme was removed from Moodle, about 6 months ago. We have opened a bug report for this issue and will aim to fix it as soon as possible. Mathieu
Comment 2: Thanks a lot Mathieu,

Post description: We use MoodleCloud for our courses and allow our users to self-register.  When a new user logs in the first time, they are immediately hit with the two Moodle EULAs with no explanation of what it is and why it is necessary. Forum Post: 
Post title: File Storage - deleting unwanted images
Post description: I'm designing a course and I've uploaded about 15 image files, which have taken up 30 of my 200MBs. I'd like to delete them and reduce them before uploading them again. However, I can't work out how to delete unwanted images in order to free up more storage space. Can anybody help?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Dylan, You will need to delete the files from every location that they are located in. If you are using Moodle For School Theme: Go into your Site Administration settings Go into your Server files (Site Administration > Server > Files), select a file you want to remove and click “View in context ”, this will take you to the course where the file is located. You could also go straight to the course where the file is located. Turn editing on in your course Click the edit arrow next to where the file is (if unknown, go into each section of the course to try and find where the file is located) select “edit settings”.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Change of Moodle Cloud Site Name
Post description: Greetings, I have a paid school Moodle Cloud site and want to change the site name. Is this possible and if so how do you do it? With Thanks Michael
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Michael, It is possible to change the name of your MoodleCloud site once it has been created. This change is performed by our technical team and there is a fee of $50 AUD to go ahead with the site name change. You are only allowed to modify the first part of the URL - ncat.moodlecloud.com -- the domain must stay the same (moodle.school or moodlecloud). It may require some downtime (up to 30 minutes) of the site and needs to be scheduled. Please provide the details of the sitenames and a preferred workday you would like the change to occur and we can schedule it in. If you do decide to go ahead with the name change then we will produce an invoice and send it through to you for payment with all the confirmed details. And here is a list of resources you can use for help on any other Moodle topic:
Comment 2: Greetings Craig, Yes I would like to go ahead with this. I would like the name to change to utait.moodlecloud.com The change can occur ASAP. With Thanks Michael Stewart
Comment 3: Hi Michael, Thanks for confirming. I'll send an invoice to you shortly. Best Regards.
Comment 4: Hi Michael,
Comment 5: Hi Michael, Your site has now been renamed and can be found at https://utait.moodle.school Many thanks.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Bigbluebutton recording access in MoodleCloud site
Post description: Hello, I'm running courses with Moodle LMS / Small package. I gave my live lectures using bigbluebutton plugin and let my students watch my lectures later. Yesterday one of my students said a lecture was showing 'Error 404' saying "The recording could not be loaded. The recording that you are attempting to access cannot be loaded." When I checked it, the lecture was given more than a year ago and I can't assess the recording any more. In Moodle's 'FAQ' page, it is said, "MoodleCloud paid plans, recordings are made available for 1 year after the session has finished." Can't I have my recordings for an unlimited lifetime as long as I'm extending my Moodle paid plan? What do I need to do? Thank you. <
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: ​Hi Thurein, All our MoodleCloud sites include BigBlueButton, a video conferencing tool designed especially for education. Your BigBlueButton recordings are kept for 7 days on a free Trial account, and 365 days on any paid plan. You can have up to 100 students in a BigBlueButton conference, and up to 8 in each breakout room. See https://bigbluebutton.org/teachers/ for details of how BigBlueButton can be used to connect teachers and students in real time. Visit the BigBlueButton community pages for support: https://bigbluebutton.org/support/community/ For more information on the Moodle BigBlueButton plugin go to https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_bigbluebuttonbn If you need recordings to be downloaded you can either use software like Zoom Meetings, or you can move to a self-hosted installation or Moodle Partner hosting, where the BigBlueButton sessions can be downloaded. I hope this helps.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Sanjeev Mansotra | How can I Integrate MoodleCloud with Third Party Services?
Post description: Hello to everyone, my name is Sanjeev Mansotra. How can I integrate MoodleCloud with third-party authentication services (such as Google, Microsoft, or LDAP ) to streamline the user login process, while ensuring compliance with GDPR regulations and maintaining optimal data security and privacy for all users?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Sanjeev, MoodleCloud supports the same core authentication features as the Moodle free software distribution. I would invite you to have a read of the "Google service OAuth2" documentation on https://docs.moodle.org/404/en/OAuth_2_Google_service to get started. This is working well on MoodleCloud. I don't have a site currently setup with the Microsoft authentication. You may have to test that one on your side. LDAP is not supported on MoodleCloud. Moodle Partners are better suited to offer and support LDAP connections, on their own hosting infrastructure, apart from MoodleCloud. Mathieu
