Forum Post: 
Post title: Enabling guest access on log in page
Post description: I've enabled guest access in a class but there is no guest login field on the log in page. How do I enable that? In all the other noodle sites I've worked on its there at the bottom. Thanks in advance. Peter
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Peter, MoodleCloud hides the guest login button by default, to prevent abuse. You can enable its display by going in the admin section (/admin in your site) and searching for guestloginbutton, or by going to Admin → Plugins → Authentication → Manage Authentication, this setting will show under "Common settings". Let us know how it goes, Mathieu
Comment 2: Thank  you!!!!!

Post title: MoodleCloud Sites are now on 4.2.1!
Post description: Hi All, We're happy to announce that all MoodleCloud sites are now on Moodle 4.2! This latest release builds upon the refined user experience of Moodle LMS 4.1 with new and improved features that create efficiencies for educators, trainers and systems administrators. This update brings enhancements to course creation, reporting, activities and messaging, making it quicker and easier to create engaging learning experiences, measure learner progress and improve learner outcomes. MoodleCloud 4.2: New features Here is an overview of the key features and improvements in Moodle 4.2, or watch our YouTube playlist of 4.2 New features Bulk editing in courses Moodle Users Association brings a new bulk editing feature Allows you to bulk duplicate, delete, move or change the availability of activities or course selections. Gradebook improvements Streamline visibility of learner progress and performance through Gradebook A search option in the Grader report Grader report records Collapsible grade categories in the Gradebook setup Enhanced Course page design and features Duplicate sections and add an activity anywhere in a section Activity types are only shown to teachers (not learners) when editing mode is on Permalink URLs allow educators and trainers to share specific locations in courses and indentation has been restored Check out all new features in Moodle 4.2 Thanks for using MoodleCloud and we hope you like the new features! Cheers, Frances MoodleCloud - Product Manager

Post title: Challenges with setting up my site on MoodleCloud
Post description: Hello everyone, Please I do require help from the MoodleCloud administrators: I am a very first time beginner and just completed the January online course Teaching with Moodle. I have tried repeatedly to set up my own site on MoodleCloud (free) but have been unsuccessful. I get stuck at step 3: verification code. No verification code has been sent to my cell phone.I am very sure that y call listing is not the problem as I have used the same cell number for over 10 years now and have never had any such problems with it. Please is it possible to have this verification code e-mailed to me so that I can complete the set up process for my Moodle site? Thank you very much in anticipation of your prompt action.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello, Is your phone number on a ‘do not call’ listing and you need to contact your phone service provider to change your details (as mentioned in the MoodleCloud FAQ )?
Comment 2: Thank you for your reply Helen. I did read through the MoodleCloud FAQ and no my phone number is not on a 'do not call' listing. Is it really not possible to have it sent via my e-mail?
Comment 3: Hi Onyekachukwu, Please have a look at the instructions on http://mtnonline.com/dnd - it appears all MTN customers where put on a DND list some time ago. Our provider has confirmed the MoodleCloud sms were blocked by that system. Once the DND is turned off, you will have to ask for a new confirmation code from the moodlecloud.com site. If there is any issue with that, please use the contact system to contact us directly. Good luck, looking forward to seeing you get your MoodleCloud site! Mathieu
Comment 4: Dear Mathieu, Thank you for your reply. I read through the instructions on the the Mtn link you gave and followed them. I then went back to the MoodleCloud site to complete the setting up of my site. However, I still encountered the same problem. That was yesterday morning. I actually waited this long (Thursday) to send you this mail in the hope that I would receive a new verification code via a phone sms. Since that has still not happened till now, please I will be grateful if you can help sort this out. Thank you.
Comment 5: Hi Onyekachukwu, After contacting our sms provider again, I'm being told the DND status updates only once a day, so you might need to wait 24 hours after doing the change before it works (...it should have updated by the time you read this). Good luck, once more. Mathieu

Post title: "Error reading from database" when Database and Application on different servers
Post description: Hello Moodlers, We are using Moodle since 2018 in our university. Initially, the Database , Application , and "moodlefiles" folders reside on the same server . In June 2023 we migrated our servers to the cloud and there we changed the infrastructure and made the two distributed servers to enhance the functionality. One server is for the database and the other is for Moodle Application and Moodle files. This Moodle site is working in the university, Following are the details that could be the potential information to resolve the issue: Moodle Version: 3.5 Maria DB version: 10.0.35 PHP version: 7 Server OS: Windows Server 2012 R2 Server: Nutanix
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Shoun Paul, I recommend asking in the " Installing & Upgrading help " forum. The current one is for users of MoodleCloud . That said, if you haven't already read this page, the Server Cluster documentation on the Moodle wiki contains information you may find useful. While this may not have anything to do with your issue, Moodle 3.5 is old and not supported anymore, so I would strongly recommend upgrading to Moodle 3.11, PHP 8.0, and MariadDB 10.11, if only for security reasons. Matt

Post description: Hola me gustaría saber si se puede hacer que el nuevo menú que está situado a la izquierda aparezca siempre sin desplegar las pestañas, pues normalmente aparecen desplegadas las pestañas, y como son muchas, pues para poder navegar por el menú siempre tienes que estar cerrando las pestañas para que el menú se quede recogido y poder así visualizar todas las opciones del menú. Esta acción es tediosa y cansina, ese es el motivo por el que me gustaría configurar que siempre el menú aparezca recogido y sea el usuario quien despliegue el menú que le interese. Y por otro lado, en la página principal, en el menú superior, aparecen dos botones: Academia y Página principal, al hacer clic sobre ellos ambos me redirigen a la página principal del curso. ¿Podría configurar para que una de ellas se quede como está (me dirija  a la página principal del curso) y la otra pestaña me dirija a un curso en concreto? Espero haberme sabido explicar con claridad. Un saludo y muchas gracias.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Adding a landing page on Moodle cloud site
Post description: Hi, Just wanted to check this with veteran Moodlers here. Is it possible to put a small introductory video or a small page/course- "About us" right on the front page of moodle cloud site. I mean, I wish to educate the visitors about ourselves, the services provided by the site, how we deliver the curriculum etc etc. And majority of the visitors won't have a login credentials at the first place. Is it possible to put something like that, which everyone can freely access. Thanks in advance, Ash
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Ash, A (very) basic solution is to customise the "auth_instructions" config field, going to /admin/settings.php?section=manageauths on your MoodleCloud site. This is displayed on the login page of your site. Mathieu
Comment 2: Thanks Mat. That does help a bit; but, I have to explore other threads to dig this further. All I want is to educate the visitors to my site about our self, services we provide, Terms and Conditions etc. Just like on any other wordpress website. I was pondering, should we make a guest login and prompt the user to enter the site using that; and using Label resource add text and multimedia content. This way the content will be visible to the visitors. But, problem with this is, there is too much content and it will not be organised and presented well with this solution. Another aspect: Not everyone will be familiar with the icons we use in Moodle. So adding our content within a particular resource for example, book or page, or making a course to educate them about us, and asking them to go thru it, will perhaps be quite contrary to what I am thinking. Let's see. Thanks once again.

Post title: ADFS SSO support
Post description: Hi, does MoodleCloud support SSO with ADFS, or is a dedicated install of Moodle server required for this (additional required plugins etc)? We'd like to authenticate domain users using our ADFS server, similarly to what we do with several other cloud based services. Its a bit difficult to know which of the various howtos and articles on this subject on the web are applicable for MC, if any. Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Ok, MoodleCloud does not support SSO with ADFS. You will need your own server or hosting through a Moodle Partner. Mathieu
Comment 2: Hi, thanks for the info. Are there any plans to implement this? It seems like a standard part of many cloud implementations these days, implementing authorization across identity providers (adfs) and service providers (MC), so I think this would be a natural part of MC!

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud & unprecedented demand from COVID-19: Impacts and next steps
Post description: Hi everyone, MoodleCloud are currently experiencing staggering new demand (more than 20,000 new schools and businesses in the last 10 days), and I wanted to share the impacts of this increased demand, and a few things that we're doing in MoodleCloud to respond to this. 1. Infrastructure Uptime - We have succeeded in keeping all services up during this period by staying one step ahead of the hard bottlenecks that would have otherwise caused outages at specific threshholds of users/sites. This has been our focus (to the exclusion of all else) over the last 10 days. 2. Infrastructure Performance - We have not succeeded in maintaining fast page load times during this period (as this has been secondary to #1 above). We are now at the final stages of testing and expect to add capacity for more sites and concurrent users in the EU and US regions today and tomorrow. We expect these upcoming changes to substantially improve performance to usual page load times, but until then, users in EU and US regions will see slower page load times during their local business hours peak times. 3. Customer Support - We have not succeeded in maintaining our usual ticket respond/resolve times during this period. We have added support staff to the MoodleCloud team and are training them as we speak to assist with bringing down support ticket respond/resolve times. I understand this experience is challenging for you at a time when you need Moodle most, and for that I would like to apologise. Please know that the MoodleCloud team are doing everything we can right now to get back to providing a great service to you, and to the 20,000+ new schools and businesses that have signed up to MoodleCloud in the last 10 days alone. Hit me up below if you have any questions or concerns, I'd love to hear them. Cheers Lee Goldsworthy Product Manager - MoodleCloud
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi again everyone, I would like to apologise for yet another day of reduced performance. Our engineers attempted to deploy an upgrade today, but we chose to stop before finishing because we thought it posed too much of a risk of interrupting service for all users in the EU region. We have rescheduled completing this upgrade to 2020-03-25 23:00 and will provide an update here when I have more information. I am deeply regretful that we have not met your expectations on this occasion. The whole MoodleCloud team are working hard to resolve these performance issues as soon as possible for you. Thanks Lee Goldsworthy Product Manager - MoodleCloud
Comment 2: Hi folks, In our ongoing efforts to restore performance we've had some wins. Short term tweaks made about an hour ago have restored operation of both EU and US regions to normal performance. These are temporary in nature to buy us some time until we finalise the upgrade in the upcoming change scheduled for 23:00 GMT+0. More information as I know it. Cheers Lee
Comment 3: Hi folks, EU region capacity upgrades were successfully completed overnight. MoodleCloud Engineers are monitoring closely to ensure this region performs optimally today and going forwards. US region has temporary performance measures in place to ensure performance is not impacted between now and this region's capacity upgrades, currently scheduled for 2020-03-26 23:00 GMT+0. Thanks again for all your patience, we're almost there! Cheers

Forum Post: 
Post title: Delete backup files
Post description: A few months ago I backed up a couple of
courses and downloaded the backup files for storage off Moodle. Then I made
sure backup was disabled. Now it's time to delete the unneeded backup files
from Moodle storage. A forum post said to use this process: 1. Log in as admin 2. Go to the course 3. Click gear > Restore 4. Click Manage backup files 5. Click the File Picker icon (the little sheet of
paper) 6. Click the link of the file to be deleted 7. Click Select this file 8. Click the link of the file to be deleted again,
under the Files folder 9. Click the Delete button (here is where you also
have the option to download it before you delete it) 10. Click OK 11. Click Save Change
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Tennile, Can you please lodge a support request through your portal, including as much detail as possible so that we can investigate this for you? Cheers, Cam
Comment 2: How does one go about doing that? I thought this was the support portal.
Comment 3: I think I found a way to contact support. Thank you.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Notification when student completes course.
Post description: Hi We are training our volunteers for various jobs/tasks. Once they are finshed with a course, we need to move them to the job. Is there any way I can hook myself (webhook/email) into the completion of a course so I have at the very least the email address, name of the person and the course name so I can initiate the next steps? Webhook would be fantastic, email is OK because I could use procmail on one of our servers to scan emails and act upon the content. Thanks
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Jobst, Depending on what type of notification you need to send in Moodle, you can learn all about how Moodle sends notifications for different activities in our documentation: Managing a Moodle Course Forum activity Another option to set up notifications is to use the event monitoring rule. As a course teacher, go to Course administration > Reports > Event monitoring rules, or as an admin go to Site administration > Reports > Event monitoring rules. You can learn more about it below: Event Monitoring Hope that this helps Warm regards, Kelly

Post title: More storage space for Moodlecloude LMS  via external a provider
Post description: I'm using Moodlecloude LMS. It has a 256 MB storage capacity. So, I want more storage space(e.g. 20GB) via an external provider such as AWS S3. Is this feasible with Moodlecloude LMS? Which providers are more suitable? (We are a small online academy; need 20-40 concurrent users)
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Dilan, Moodle Cloud does not offer big storage and you cannot just use external storage. You will need to host the site on your own server or use a Moodle partner. You are welcome to contact me if you want to make use of our service. We host many Moodle sites and provide good storage. We are also the Moodle partner in South Africa, so depending on your country, it will be cheap to use us.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Upload users does not update country nor timezone
Post description: Hello All, this is my first post so sorry for newbie errors. I use Moodle on MoodleCloud. I am trying to update country and timezone for all my students (they are at different location than me). I use Site administration/Users/Accounts/Upload users. My CSV file looks like this: username,firstname,lastname,email,idnumber,country,timezone id1,fname,lname,who@mail.edu.cn,872362336,CN,8 There are 68 users in the file. All the accounts have already been created before (with the same file, but without the country and timezone columns). I am attempting to only update. In the upload settings I have: Upload type - Update existing users only Existing user details - Override with file Existing user password - No changes Allow renames - No Allow deletes - No etc... After clicking 'Upload users' I am getting 0 errors, but the country and timezone remain unchanged. Does anybody know what I am doing wrong? Thanks, Marcin
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Dear Marcin, Have you tried to purge all caches? You can easily do this as the site admin by going to Site Administration > Development > Purge all caches. Moodle can cache themes, language strings, filters and other bits of information that have been calculated and stored by the web browser. This link forces all user web browsers to refresh their screens of any information that Moodle has cached. Several modules that use cache have settings which will turn off caching for that module. Eliminating or purging caches slows performance. For more information, check out Purge all caches: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Developer_tools#Purge_all_caches You might also want to double check that all the fields in the CSV are valid. You can find more information here: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Upload_users#User_Fields_that_can_be_included I hope that this helps and you are able to update. Kelly

Post title: Modifying config.php
Post description: Hello, How can we modify this file for Moodlecloud sites? Thanx in advance
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Chat, It is not possible for you to edit your site's config.php file. MoodleCloud is designed with an optimal user experience in mind, so, with site integrity in mind, this file is unavailable for modification. Best Regards, Craig R Morton Analyst Developer (MoodleCloud)
Comment 2: Hi Craig, I understand the user experience argument. But wouldn't it be possible to have additionnal rights when in maintenance mode to achieve some goals? The file parameters might be editable only in maintenance mode with a rollback to previous values when switching off the maintenance. This would allow for basic features such as debbuging, which is impossible right now. It would be  really usefull. I hope this proposal will be discussed in Moodle HQ. Best regards

Post title: Notification Emails are not being sent
Post description: Hi, I am on a moodlecloud plan, and students are not receiving notification emails when 1. I post on any forum, students are on "Forced Subscription" 2. When assignments are graded In fact, students do not receive any emails at all. I have checked default notification settings, and it is set to permitted with "online" and "offline" both ticked. Any advice? Thanks,
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Depending on what type of notification you need to send in Moodle, you can learn all about how Moodle sends notifications for different activities in our documentation: Forum activity Another option to set up notifications is to use the event monitoring rule. As a course teacher, go to Course administration > Reports > Event monitoring rules, or as an admin go to Site administration > Reports > Event monitoring rules. Event Monitoring If you are trying to send notifications on enrolment, please note that you are only able to do this on self enrolment method and you are unable to edit this email. You can however step up notifications of enrolment expirations. Please note that notifications do not go out for at least 30 minutes in Moodle, but even after that, it does depend on when your cron runs for your site. You can view the setting here: Site administration > Security > Site security settings > Maximum time to edit posts. Which reduces that 30 minute wait time, but ultimately it still depends on when cron runs for your site and if you have a MoodleCloud site, this is run by us here at Moodle HQ. You can find the details of when the cron last ran for your MoodleCloud site on the System status page:
Comment 2: Thanks Kelly, that worked

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud storage
Post description: We currently use the self-hosted version of Moodle on our server but are considering moving onto the MoodleCloud platform. How do I determine how much storage space I will need on MoodleCloud based on the current size of my Moodle installation? Is there a place on my installation that can tell me what size it currently is?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Yvonne, There's not an easy way to see how "big" your moodle site is. I can give you the SQL query we use to calculate disk quota: SELECT SUM(f.filesize)
FROM (
SELECT DISTINCT
contenthash,
filesize
FROM mdl_files
WHERE filearea <> 'draft' AND
referencefileid IS NULL AND
component <> 'tool_recyclebin' AND
(component <> 'backup' OR mimetype <> 'application/vnd.moodle.backup') AND
component <> 'assignfeedback_editpdf' AND
component <> 'core_h5p' AND
component <> 'contentbank'
UNION SELECT contenthash, filesize from mdl_files WHERE (component = 'core_h5p' AND filearea = 'content'>
GROUP BY filesize, contenthash
) AS f"); This should return the number of bytes used by your site. Divide it by 1073741824 to get the value in gigabytes. Cheers, Cam
Comment 2: Thank you Cam, I appreciate your assistance, however running an SQL query is beyond my knowledge and comfort zone. We don't currently have a qualified administrator for our installation which is why we are wanting to move to the cloud. I was hoping there was a way to see the size in the Moodle admin or even in the directory as I have access and can use FTP to access the files.
Comment 3: Hi Yvonne, Since you have FTP access I've written a small PHP script to query the DB for you: <?php require_once('config.php'); global $DB; $bytes = $DB->get_field_sql(" SELECT SUM(f.filesize) FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT contenthash, filesize FROM {files} WHERE filearea <> 'draft' AND referencefileid IS NULL AND component <> 'tool_recyclebin' AND (component <> 'backup' OR mimetype <> 'application/vnd.moodle.backup') AND component <> 'assignfeedback_editpdf' AND component <> 'core_h5p' AND component <> 'contentbank' UNION SELECT contenthash, filesize from {files} WHERE (component = 'core_h5p' AND filearea = 'content' AND filesize > 0) GROUP BY filesize, contenthash ) AS f"); $index = floor(log($bytes, 1024)); echo round($bytes/1024**$index, 2) . ' ' . ['B', 'KB', 'MB', 'GB'][$index]; Save that in a file called "size.php" and upload it to the root of your moodle installation. Then browse to http://yourselfhostedmoodle.com/size.php It should tell you how "big" MoodleCloud considers your site. Cheers, Cam
Comment 4: If you store your course files on another network, you can see the storage size there, and it would be roughly equivalent... except SCORM files. Double the size of every SCORM package, because Moodle unzips your SCORM package, but also saves the ZIP. So a 10 MB SCORM course will use 20 MB of Moodle file storage.

Post title: Moodle Cloud to VPS
Post description: Hello, We recently created a cloud setup for moodle classes..however we are considering moving the database to a recently acquired vps server running uubuntu and mysql server. Is that possible? Thanks
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The MoodleCloud Portal is where you manage your MoodleCloud account, billing details, exports and access statistics on the usage of your site. To access your MoodleCloud Portal: From within your MoodleCloud site (as the Site Administrator), click on "Portal" icon on the mid right hand side of your site. OR Copy this URL and ensure that sitename is replaced with yours: https://moodlecloud.com/app/en/portal/view/sitename To login to the MoodleCloud Portal: Enter your Site Name and your MoodleCloud password (which is the same as the admin password for your MoodleCloud site). Once you are inside of your Portal, you can access Site Export by clicking on the "Tools" tab, selecting a database and clicking on 'Export this site'.

Post description: I need a tutorial to orient students to navigating a course on MoodleCloud. I can find tutorials for teachers, administrators, and developers, but not students. Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello Dan. I'll move your post to the MoodleCloud forum as it is specifically for MoodleCloud - although I think probably a generic tutorial - or perhaps you mean user tour ? on the latest version of Moodle, Boost theme, would work as I am not sure what is different about MoodleCloud when a student accesses it for the first time.
Comment 2: Doesn't some of this depend on how the instructor administers the course? For example, I see that MoodleCloud supports four different "course formats," two different "course layouts," and two different ways to "hide" sections . This becomes 16 different arrangements if my math is correct. And then, there are different ways to group quizzes, assignments, and other resources. So, I am saying that a tutorial might be hard to find.  You might want to consider making one for your specific Moodle site. However, as an example, this is what I tell my students, via this Moodle Overview video, for my older Moodle 3.11. I need to revise this for my current Moodle 4.2. I will attach the PowerPoints I used for my 3.11 Moodle Overview video to help you think about what you might need.
Comment 3: Dan I think Rick's point is valid, one of the reasons we don't build a product tour for students is it is extremely context sensitive and very dependend on the educational design of the course. A common practice I've seen in Moodle and other LMS is to post a short video/text at the top of the course to orientate students to the course structure and expectation, this generally needs to be somewhat customised to the course content or structure. Larger institutions tend to try and standardise to some extent the course formats which can help in that regard

Post title: Workbook-type activity
Post description: Hello, I have recently come across a tool called Wobo which basically allows you to integrate a digital workbook into your LMS. It looks great in lots of ways but is still quite new and unfortunately does not integrate perfectly with Moodle yet. As a small-ish charity we also don't have the funds to spend a monthly amount on it (even though it is very reasonably priced). I'm just wondering whether there is any way of creating a similar type of acvitiy directly in Moodle, on the MoodleCloud server . The kind of course which we run is one where students are required to: - complete self-assessment forms, which they may want to refer back to over the course of the programme - create action plans, which, again, they will need to refer back to, potentially make changes to, etc. - keep track of their progress by rating themselves on a scale for various parameters. Over time, this rating should improve, and they should be able to see this improvement The "Feedback" activity type does not work for these kinds of activities , because once submitted, participants cannot see their responses. The only work-around I have come up with so far is to ask them to download , complete and submit a worksheet as an "Assignment" activity, but this feels clumsy and I would really like these activities to be integrated. An online workbook like Wobo seems to be the ideal solution, but as I say, Wobo itself is not quite there yet. Does anyone know of a similar tool, or a good work-around on Moodle?

Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Sanjeev, All MoodleCloud Plans are billed in Australian Dollars only. You can pay either using a Visa or MasterCard credit card or through PayPal, and your credit institution takes care of the currency conversion. For that reason, we can't tell you in advance exactly how much you will be charged in INR; we don't handle the currency conversion. Also, some banks may apply a surcharge for this, and in some countries other taxes may apply for purchases in a foreign currency, but you'd need to find that out with your particular bank. Warm regards, Christian The MoodleCloud Team
Comment 2: Sanjeev Thanks for the feedback, as Christian outlined below there are a number of reasons we can' show local currencies with our current payment provider unfortunately. one great reference to convert the amounts is xe.com as you can quickly convert curreny amounts to see the cost. Forum Post: 
Post title: Difference Between a School Site and a Cloud Site
Post description: What are the differences between Moodle School and Moodle Cloud site?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Jessica, "Moodle for School" is one of our packages and is part of the MoodleCloud offering. You can find a clear breakdown of our available plans at the following URL : https://moodle.com/moodlecloud/#plans Hope this helps. Best Regards.
Comment 2: If I upgrade my current Moodle to the 1000 user plan and my URL changes do me existing users need to use the new URL to access their content? Do they automatically receive a redirect?
Comment 3: Hi, If you upgrade to a new MoodleCloud Plan (from a Moodle for School Plan), your site URL will change from “sitename.moodle.school” to “sitename.moodlecloud.com”. You will still be able to visit the old URL, but it will be redirected to the new one (and users will see the new URL in their browser). I hope that helps. Kelly

Forum Post: 
Post title: Use of Moodle for certified training course in manicure
Post description: Hi, we are looking for a platform where to base our training courses in manicure. This course will give at the end, after a final examination, the possibility to get a certificate issued by the local authority (Ministry) to start your own activity in Slovakia. The classroom has usually between 7 and 15 students. We have just 1 teacher so we run just a training session at one time. The course has a theoretical and a practical part so i can imagine a wide use of camera during the practical part. We have been investigating Moodle and i would like to ask you about your opinion; do you think it could fit to our needs ? We would like to move to a cloud based solution; we understood Moodlecloud has almost the same features of the on-premise installation (and less installation and technical stuff to setup, it seems to us much easier to get-it-ready). Is there something we should consider before making our decision on a moodlecloud solution ? Thanks in advance for your kind support Regards, Massimo
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Massimo, You can start a 45 day free trial on MoodleCloud (no credit card needed) to evaluate whether it will suit your needs. After 45 days, if you wish, you can upgrade your site to one of our inexpensive paid plans. Cheers, Cam
Comment 2: Hi Cam, sure, my question was most on knowledge about moodle used to support our line of business. We have in plan to test it 😉, just i would to know if somebody in this community had already occasion to build in moodle a business scenario similar to our case. Thanks ! Regards, Massimo

Post title: Question about MoodleCloud
Post description: Hello, My namn is NinaSehlin. How can I combine a corse into a learning program, LMS, at MoodleWorkplace 4.4, 4.2?  I have a moodlecloud account and I have already paid for a start plan. Is it free for moodlecloud members to sign up for a Pro or Premium plan? Yours sincerely NinaSehlin
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Nina, You can find the pricing for MoodleCloud plans on our website. Just click " Choose your tier ". Many thanks, Craig R Morton
Comment 2: Hello Nina my name is Sanjeev Mansotra core education in Tech from India. To combine a course into a learning program in Moodle Workplace 4.4 or 4.2, you can use the "Programs" feature to group courses into a structured learning path. Since you have a Moodle Cloud account with a Start plan, upgrading to Pro or Premium is not free; these plans require additional payment. You can upgrade through your Moodle Cloud account dashboard .

Post title: OneDrive Access Controlled Links Error
Post description: Hi, I am the admin of a moodlecloud site. We are using "Access Controlled Links" for some file submissions using Google Drive and Microsoft OneDrive. The ACLs work when submitted through Google, but not through OneDrive. The error message that users see is: "Exception - notAllowed: The feature has been disabled. Please contact your admin to get it enabled." From what I can tell the settings are almost identical for Google and Microsoft OAuth2 on my moodlecloud. The main difference is that discovery is not turned n for Microsoft in the OAuth2 Services. I don't know how to do this or if it is causing the issue. Supported files is on: Internal and External Default return type is on: External Only Any would help would be massively appreciated. Thanks
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Having the same problem here. Did you get this fixed?
Comment 2: Hi Gil & Richard, I believe this error is caused by a configuration issue on OneDrive's side, but not using it myself, I can't really help. I was going to point to the previous discussion in https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=353376 but I see Gil has already posted in that one, without much luck. Looking at that previous discussion, I don't think this issue is specific to MoodleCloud, so maybe it's time for a new issue on Moodle's bug tracker . I'm not a OneDrive user myself, but if one of you could precisely write, on the tracker, the steps taken and the errors encountered, it might help debug this issue and resolve it for everyone. Mathieu

The download link in the header offers some pre-built virtual machines images and other ways to have a local instance. Mathieu

Forum Post: 
Post title: quiz questions lost after update?
Post description: Our moodlecloud website got its 5.0 upgrade, and now we cannot find hundreds of quiz questions. We have a Course category "Thinking" with several courses "Thinking 1" to "Thinking 5". Quiz questions are shared among those courses (often randomized quizzes filtered by tags). The questions were stored in two question categories on the course category "Thinking" level. Now they are gone. The "Thinking 3" course has those 2 categories now, but they come with only part of the questions we had. Any idea where to find the hundreds of missing questions? Also, I am wondering how to use the system in future. Can we not share questions for use in several courses anymore?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The questions are not lost, but they have been moved by the upgrade process. In the Course category where the questions used to be, you should find a new course called something like "Shared teaching resources for category: Thinking". In that course, go to More -> Questions banks, and there should be a question bank with your questions. That is just what the upgrade does automatically. You can, of course, rename things, or move things around to organise them however works best for you.
Comment 2: Hi Tim, thanks for picking up on this. The whole situation looks like a huge mess. I even dont know where to start. Let's try: 1. The update started more than 24h ago. i got zero information when it started or about any progress. Most quizzes' questions bank now show this unfortunate error message: "Adhoc task \mod_qbank\task\transfer_question_categories has not yet completed or has failed. Some of your pre-installed question banks may not be transferred to mod_qbank instances yet. Any question categories they contained can't be shared or managed until the task has completed." Not yet completed OR failed?! After >24h? 2. The "Thinking" course category doesn't have a course called "Shared teaching..." 3. The top level category of Thinking has a course called "Shared teaching...". But that has only 6 questions that came from somewhere else. 4. When I click into a quiz activity which used the shared question bank on Thinking level with randomized questions, the following error message comes up: "Coding error detected, it must be fixed by a programmer: Unsupported context . More information about this error". Interestingly, I can still review old attempts and make new attempts. 5. When I open the QB of that quiz, the first mentioned error message "Adhoc task \mod_qbank\task\transfer_question_categories has not yet completed or has failed. Some of your pre-installed question banks may not be transferred to mod_qbank instances yet. Any question categories they contained can't be shared or managed until the task has completed.Dismiss this notification Question bank tertiary navigation" comes up. And the QB is empty.
Comment 3: Hi Dirk, Sorry to hear the upgrade of your MoodleCloud site has some lingering tasks relating to the question bank changes in Moodle 5.0. We have received your support request and our team is looking into this and will get back to you via email. Kind regards, Barbara

Forum Post: 
Post title: How to manually delete uploaded files or images?
Post description: Hi, Am currently on the MoodleCloud School Plan with 400mb of limited file storage. Would like to check, is there a way to manually delete the files that were previously uploaded? e.g. pdfs, image files etc I've been checking the forums, and it seems there is no way to delete files currently in MoodleCloud. Can anyone confirm that this is true?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, This is an unfortunate limitation due to the way the Moodle LMS handles files. MoodleCloud offers a files list plugin to help mitigate the issue. You can access it at: https://[YOURSITE].moodle.school/admin/tool/fileslist/ The "View in context " button can typically get you to the course that the file is used in; which will hopefully help you track it down and allow you to delete it. Note that it is not always possible to determine what context a file is used in, which is why the button is not always present. Sorry that it's not the easiest process. Cheers, Cam
Comment 2: Hi Cam, Thanks for your reply. I know about the files list plugin, but that plugin only shows a list of the files, without any ability to delete the files. There is a limitation to the file storage (400MB) in my current MoodleCloud Plan. Given that there is a limit imposed, it is necessary and critical to give customers the option and ability to housekeep and delete the uploaded files so that we can stay within the limits. Imposing a file storage limit, and not giving customers the ability to delete files is illogical and a major inconvenience. I hope there is a plan in place to allow customers the ability to delete the files manually, is this in the roadmap for implementation in the near term (within the next 3 months)? Thanks, David

Post title: Free hosting for minigroup?
Post description: Hallo, a teacher in lockout, urgently need a free moodle host for a minigroup of 10 online participants BEFORE  signing up for the $150 AUD / Year basic option. I have prepared the course on my home server (localhost) but am unable to make it accessible to added and duely enrolled participants. Thanks for any responses or appropriate links.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Dear Debjani, You can sign up for a Free 45 Day Trial of MoodleCloud and Restore the courses that you have created to the Trial Site. You can sign up for our Free 45 Trial on our plan page here: https://moodle.com/moodlecloud/ You visit each individual course and click on Settings, then Backup to create the Backup. You will need to go to your "Site Admin/Server Files" and find the automated backup there and download it to your computer. Then go to your MoodleCloud Free Trial - go to Site Admin / Courses/ Restore Course to upload that file and Restore it. You can learn more about backup and restore here: ​​​​​​​ https://docs.moodle.org/en/Backup https://docs.moodle.org/en/Course_restore I hope that helps. Kelly

Forum Post: 
Post title: Users email being updated to add .invalid at the end
Post description: I've noticed that if a Moodle user has an out of office on their account and Moodle tries to send them a notification their email address in the user gets updated to <<email address>>.invalid We're using Moodle Cloud . Any idea why this is happening?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Sam, If your site sends a message to a user and a "bounce" is detected (per our email provider's rules), the '.invalid' is added to prevent further emails being sent out to that person. This is required to prevent all MoodleCloud email being flagged as spam . If you believe this has been done erroneously, please open a support request from the MoodleCloud Portal , providing the email address, and we'll be able to investigate further. Mathieu
Comment 2: Thanks I've done a test and it looks like it's happening when there's an out of office on the email address, which is causing us a few issues.

Post title: Adding a site snippet to header
Post description: Hello, I'm trying to add a site snippet to the site header (Site Administration > Appearance > Additional HTML), in order to be able to integrate an external tool into our Moodle courses. The header box is greyed out and says "Defined in Config.php". Does this mean that I cannot edit the header? Is this perhaps because we are using the Moodlecloud server rather than our own server? Or is there some way of editing the header which I haven't discovered? Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Eleanor, MoodleCloud is an off-the-shelf, pre-configured version of Moodle LMS. Any feature/option with "Defined in Config.php" indicates that this has been set and cannot be changed by the user. If you require the flexibility of customising Moodle to suit, you can use Moodle LMS through a Moodle Certified Partner or you can download Moodle for free and host on your own server . Kind regards, Barbara

Post title: Full screen option for Course
Post description: Hi, Is there any chance to view the Course in full screen mode for Students? Regards, Thadeus
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Thadeus, MoodleCloud only has Moodle's default Boost theme available. There isn't a view in full screen mode as part of this. However, you can setup your site to minimise/hide the course index panel and the block drawer. You can also find out a little more about the Boost theme to find out what width customisation options are possible (and even SCSS customisation). Please note, that customisations should only be attempted if you have the technical expertise to do so, as support is not provided for any changes or customisations you make. Kind regards, Barbara

We've had 20,000 new schools and businesses start using MoodleCloud in just the last 10 days. We're working really hard to provide a great service and expect to have capacity increases in place today and tomorrow. Thanks Lee

Forum Post: 
Post title: Is LTI integration possible with MoodleCloud? Full list of plugins?
Post description: Hello, Our organization just signed up for a MoodleCloud site to test its feasibility for our program and determine if we need a self-hosted version of Moodle. I am wondering if it is possible to do LTI integration with MoodleCloud? Specifically, we are hoping to integrate with Proctorio or other LTI-supported proctoring service for our quizzes. Self-hosted Moodle supports LTI Integration. I have not been to find anything about MoodleCloud + LTI integration in the MoodleCloud FAQ. I've also contacted Moodle using the contact form to no avail. If you have experience using LTI integration with your MoodleCloud site and/or integrating your MoodleCloud site with a proctoring service, I'd love to hear from you. Alternatively, if you know where to find a full list of MoodleCloud plugins, can you please send it along? Thank you!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Allie, LTI should work with MoodleCloud just as well as it does on the self-hosted version, but we are unfortunately not able to teach each plugin as part of MoodleCloud, and no such list has been compiled so far. Please let us know how these plugins work for you, it might pave the way for more official support in the future. Please note that while MoodleCloud is due to be upgraded to version 3.9 soon, it's still on 3.8 at this time. Some more recent LTI-related improvements will become available after the upgrade is completed. Mathieu
Comment 2: Hi Mathieu, Thank you for your reply! After four messages, I received a reply from support@moodle a few days ago telling me that LTI does not work with MoodleCloud. Subsequently, a vendor I am working with (not Proctorio) was able to integrate their tool with MoodleCloud via LTI integration. As your reply suggests, it seems there's a lot of fuzziness in this area---it may/may not work, but in either case Moodle can't help. I also haven't found any Moodle partners that offer support just for MoodleCloud, you have allow them to build your Moodle site and/or host with them. I hope there's a more robust support option from Moodle at least for MoodleCloud in the future. Thanks, A

Forum Post: 
Post title: Influence of suspended MoodleCloud service for 'offline' users
Post description: Hi We have a Moodle cloud site and the subscription is coming up for renewal in a few weeks. Most/all our users currently access the content offline through the Moodle app. We're in the process of determining whether Moodle Cloud is the right place for the site for the next year, or if we need to move it elsewhere (depending on a number of factors). Due to red tape, it could happen that a final decision is not made by the time the subscription comes up from renewal. How will users accessing content offline through the app be affected? Will they still have access until they go online again, or will their access stop the same day subscription is suspended (if it isn't paid). Having all the facts will help prioritise decision making. Thanks. Jessica
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Jessica, Sorry to hear you might have to leave MoodleCloud . The offline availability of content in the Moodle app depends on the each activity. I suggest you turn the wifi & data connection off on your phone and see what works and what doesn't once you're "offline". I am unfortunately not sure if the app reacts differently in the case where the connection is not "offline", but the site is suspended. Either way, I would strongly suggest you download both a course backup from your site, and a full site export from the MoodleCloud portal (under the "Tools" tab in the portal). Mathieu
Comment 2: Hi Mathieu Thank you for your reply. Great tip on the course backup - thank you. I'll make sure to do that just in case. Kind regards Jessica

Forum Post: 
Post title: Add SpeechAce plugin to MoodleCloud
Post description: Hi. I've recently purchased a MoodleCloud subscription. Upon purchase I was not aware that external plugins are not allowed on this site. As a pronunciation teacher I need a tool where my student can record themselves and the tool will automatically check for their pronunciation mistakes. SpeechAce does this quite well, however it is a plugin which cannot be installed on MoodleCloud. I wonder if there are any alternative ways I can do to achieve the same outcome (Let my students speak + Check their pronunciation) on MoodleCloud. If not, how can I install an external plugin on my site? (Even with extra cost) Thank you.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi David, We do explain on our website, that MoodleCloud sites have a number of selected plugins installed. To keep the platform simple and stable for all users we do not allow you to install your own plugins at this time. You might want to consider if H5P will do this for you. H5P is a plugin that is included for free in all our MoodleCloud sites. There is a list of all available content types here: https://h5p.org/content-types-and-applications I wonder if this particular one might do what you require: https://h5p.org/speak-the-words-set The plugin list will grow and continue to be updated. So if MoodleCloud currently does not support the particular plugin you are after, we will record your plugin request and other feedback to inform future work and additions to the system. If however, you require this plugin to be installed immediately for your MoodleCloud site, I can pass you onto your Moodle Partners to discuss your custom needs. Please note that if you want to have plugins added to your site, you will need to move to a Moodle site hosted by our Moodle Partners or a self-hosted site.
Comment 2: Hi Kelly, Thank you for your response. If we transfer our site to one of your Moodle partners, is it possible to transfer our subscription as well? Or do we have to pay for it as well as the MoodleCloud site? Thanks.

Post title: MoodleCloud is now on 5.0.2! 🎉
Post description: Hello MoodleCloud users! We are excited to announce that MoodleCloud's Moodle version has been upgraded to Moodle 5.0.2. What’s new? These version upgrades include many exciting new features and improvements: A new centralised course overview page, making it easier for you to navigate your courses and find what you need faster Additional AI functionalities for improved reporting and an explanation option to summarise course content Improvements to SMS notifications An easier to use and more powerful question bank Important security improvements, such as the ability to set password requirements for your users. The 5.0.2 version upgrade also includes many accessibility and general improvements to further enhance your site. A big thanks to the teams involved! These improvements would not be possible without the work and expertise of our Product, Engineering, and QA teams. We’d like to take a moment to show appreciation for their motivation and commitment to providing our users with the best experience possible, their efforts have truly made an impact on MoodleCloud's quality and standards. What’s next? MoodleCloud is now running version 5.0.2, bringing new features, enhancements, and performance improvements. We’d love to hear how the update is working for you and how the new features are supporting your teaching and learning. Keep an eye on the forums for tips and ideas to help you get the most out of Moodle 5.0.2. Thanks for being part of the MoodleCloud community! Cheers, Frances Product Manager, MoodleCloud

Forum Post: 
Post title: Enrolment Email to New Students
Post description: Hi, First, thanks for making MoodleCloud available! I have used a hosted Moodle LMS for several years as a trainer, so I'm now looking for functionality that I'm familiar with in MoodleCloud. I have set a course up - this went very easily. I am now trying to enrol test students. I created a student using the "Enrol Users" button, I set the new user up as a student. An email was sent to the new student's address. It contains the Welcome text that I created. And nothing else. I was expecting the initial email to the student to contain a link to the course that I just enrolled him in, with options to create a password etc. This link is missing. How do I add the first signin link to a new student's welcome email? Many thanks, Ian
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Did you already create this user? So they already have an account on the site? They need an account before you can enrol them into a course manually (unless you do it all via a spreadsheet) (Assuming you know the difference between enrolment and authentication - apologies if you do.) If you log in as administrator, you can change the welcome text by going to the course and clicking Participants > then from the dropdown Enrolment methods and selecting Manual enrolment. Change 'Send course welcome message' to something other than No and the custom welcome message will appear. You can add a link in there. See the video: Giving learners course access. (link)
Comment 2: Hi Mary, Many thanks for the response! Yes, I first set my dummy user up and then assigned him to the offering. I have been testing various ways of giving the user a link - what you suggest is exactly the conclusion that I came to - I have to provide a link and detailed instructions on user name, initial password etc. This is fine; you have confirmed that the system doesn't automatically create and send a link (I thought I was doing something wrong), and this really helps me. I'll add the required details for the users. Ian
Comment 3: Dear Mary, I only see the Welcome Message as an option for self-enrolment (as shown in the video), not in manual enrolment. Is that due to my Moodle version (4.1)? Best regards, Paul.
Comment 4: Yes Paul. The new manual enrolment message came in Moodle 4.4

Forum Post: 
Post title: Two Front or Home pages
Post description: Is it possible to have to 2 Home (or Front) pages. We have our internal staff who can access/self-enrol into all of our courses, however we would like to be able to allow external people access to only one of our courses, and they would NOT be able to see any other courses. Is it possible to do this with 2 Home pages or is there another way to do it. We are on Moodle cloud so have limited ability to modify settings in the background.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Vicki, Your Site Home ( front page ) is somewhat customisable, but creating different login pages for different users is not possible. However, you may want explore the options around grouping courses into Course Categories and having these available to specific groups of users ( Cohorts ) on the site. You may also be interested in exploring Custom Roles to create user roles (e.g. a 'Staff' role) which has a unique set of permissions ( Roles and Permissions ) suited to your specific business requirements. Kind regards, Barbara

Forum Post: 
Post title: Billing - MoodleCloud
Post description: Good Afternoon, I was hoping someone would be able to direct me to where I can find a copy of my Moodle invoice? I have searched everywhere in my profile with no luck! Thank You. Greg
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Moodle is free. If you are paying, then you are most likely paying for hosting and support. Doesn't the payment state who the payment is to? That is where you should look.
Comment 2: Hello Greg, I am assuming you have a MoodleCloud site and am going to move your post to the MoodleCloud forum...
Comment 3: Hi, If it's a MoodleCloud site - then you can find your MoodleCloud invoice/receipt in your MoodleCloud Portal. The MoodleCloud Portal is where you manage your MoodleCloud account, billing details and access statistics on the usage of your site. To access your MoodleCloud Portal: From within your MoodleCloud site (as the Site Administrator), click on "Portal" icon on the mid right hand side of your site. OR Copy this URL and ensure that sitename is replaced with yours: https://moodlecloud.com/app/en/portal/view/sitename To login to the MoodleCloud Portal: Enter your Site Name and your MoodleCloud password (which is the same as the admin password for your MoodleCloud site). Once you are inside of your Portal, you can access your invoice by clicking on the "Billing" tab. You can then download your invoice by clicking on the download icon. I hope this information helps. Kelly
Comment 4: Kelly, Thank you so much for this - was able to find it! Really, really appreciate it. -greg
Comment 5: What are the payment methods?  American Express, Visa, Mastercard and Paypal? I was asking specifically if I would be able to pay the billing invoice via American Express? I appreciate your assistance in answering. Thank you, Phyllis
Comment 6: Hi Phyllis, MoodleCloud's payment processor accepts Visa, Mastercard and Paypal (not American Express sorry). I hope this helps. Happy Moodling! Kelly

Post title: MoodleCloud to WordPress
Post description: I am currently using moodlecloud 3.6.4 School mini. (First time user) I am trying to link my MoodleCloud with WordPress. I found an earlier question that was similar to mine. (Troubleshooting Edwiser Bridge connection WordPress to MoodleCloud) In this case, he switched his account from MoodleCloud to Moodle and solved his problem. I was able to add the External Service of Edwiser Bridge and found all the functions except for the ed_s. Am I still not able to link my Cloud site with my WordPress? Also, in WordPress there are many other plugins that says they could link the "Moodle" site... will this be the same problem? Eagerly await an answer.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Edwiser requires two elements: one plugin on the WordPress side and one plugin on the Moodle side. As you can’t install additional plugins on MoodleCloud , you cannot use Edwiser. On a hosted Moodle platform, you can install whatever plugins you need but not on MoodleCloud.

Forum Post: 
Post title: User Limits Moodle Cloud Plans
Post description: Hi, I'm trying to decide which moodle cloud plan might be the most appropriate for me and am not clear on what 'max users' means. Is that the number of currently active users? I understand that I can suspend users who no longer need access, so will they still be counted against that limit? Can I continue seeing information of suspended users from past courses, or will they be deleted entirely? These are plans I'm referring to: https://moodlecloud.com/app/en/?_ga=2.247390788.150636622.1601323116-1564104232.1601323116 Many thanks, and I would greatly appreciate any insights or links to more information. I wasn't able to find anything on this online.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: No one got back to you yet? We have the same question about annual users or concurrent users as our students are in and out not staying. Thank you.
Comment 2: Hi Stefanie, Suspended users to count towards quota. If you're at your user quota limit you'll have to delete some existing users to make room for more (or upgrade to a larger plan). Cheers, Cam
Comment 3: Hi all - according to moodle FAQs suspended users don't count towards your user quota see: https://moodle.com/faq/why-cant-i-add-more-users/ That being said - when I suspended some users the number of users indicated for my account did not change. I've logged this with moodle cloud support and will post an update once I have an answer.
Comment 4: Dear Michelle, We have set a limit of users for each MoodleCloud plan. In our new 'MoodleCloud plans' (these are plans purchased or upgraded after November 200 and have a xxx.moodlecloud.com URL ) you are able to suspend users so they don’t count towards your quota, but you’ll still have their data and will be able to run reports on what they’ve previously completed. The suspend user feature has always been there but it's on the new plans we have been able to change the way the user count works to not count suspended users towards the user limit. This means that suspended users will still count towards your user quota if you are on a Moodle for School plan or a lone of our older MoodleCloud Plans . If you are unsure what plan you are on, you can find out in your MoodleCloud Portal. You are welcome to upgrade to our new Plans at any time, so that you can access this feature from your Portal. We have updated the FAQ to reflect this information. If you do choose to move from a Moodle for School plan to one of our new MoodleCloud plans, please note that the following features are no longer available: School theme & school domain (sitename.moodle.school) MoodleCloud theme Group Choice Activity Level up! Quizventure However you continue to have access to xxx.moodle.school (it will just redirect to xxx.moodlecloud.com). I hope that this helps. Kelly
Comment 5: How exactly do you enforce quotas?
Comment 6: Bonjour Marc, The two quotas that are enforced on MoodleCloud are * file storage: file upload are limited to files that do not bring the site above it's allocated storage limit; * user accounts: once you reach the quota allocated to your plan, user creation features will be disabled (whether from creating a new account directly or bulk importing new users) In both cases, the system sends notification emails to the site owner, when the site gets close to those limits. Mathieu
Comment 7: Bonjour Mathieu, Thank you for your quick reply. I'm very interested in knowing technically how you are enforcing quotas, as this has been a pain to manage on our own servers. Anybody we could contact in the community who could point us in the right direction?
Comment 8: Users on MoodleCloud sites are anyone who has a login to your site, this includes Site Administrators, Managers, Teachers and Students. So they are current users (concurrent users) have access. We got our answers.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Impact Of Deleting A User & Re-Using The Vacancy
Post description: I am wondering if we can delete a user (student) from the MoodleCloud application, and what will the impact be on the courses in which that user has been enrolled in. We are currently on the 100-user package and it is estimated in about 3 to 4 months' time we will hit the 100% quota. Courses run by us are not long - 3 months to 6 months on the average. And some students will not continue with us after they have finished their chosen courses though they can opt to continue with other related courses. Can we delete such students from our users database and re-use the empty slots without breaking the courses that these students were enrolled in (in terms of grades and contributions from such deleted students)? Or would all information (grades & contributions) of such students be wiped clean as well? Would appreciate guidance on this so that we can make decision whether to increase the quota when the time comes. Thank you.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Eric, As far as the user limit on MoodleCloud is concerned, once you delete a user, you can create a new one. I'll leave it to someone more qualified than me to answer your question about what happens to grades after user removal. Mathieu
Comment 2: Hello, I can confirm that if you delete a student, then their grades and contributions are also deleted. However, you can prevent forum posts from being deleted if you manually delete the student via Site administration / Users / Accounts / Browse list of users and the setting 'Create automatic data deletion requests' (in Site administration / Users / Privacy and policies / Privacy settings) is NOT ticked. (If the setting is ticked, then the forum post content is removed.)
Comment 3: Thanks, Helen, for the valuable input. That will help us plan our classes accordingly. Cheers Eric
Comment 4: Thanks, Mathieu. Appreciate the reply. Cheers Eric

Post title: SCORM file too large

Forum Post: 
Post title: August 2021 Upgrade - Affected grading of essay questions - Appears to be an error
Post description: Hi Everyone, Has anyone else noticed what seems to be an error with the grading of essay questions in MoodleCloud since the upgrade? Prior to upgrade Teacher selects make a comment or override mark link Types comment (automatically uses paragraph font) Types in grade Hits enter - this automatically saves the entry Post upgrade Teacher selects make a comment or override mark link Types comment (automatically  uses Large title font) Types in grade Hits enter - this automatically opens the font selector in the comments section, you have to select a fond and this then takes you back to the comments field (the ATTO editor) Teacher has to scroll down and select save to complete grading that essay question answer Are there any moves at Moodle to address this issue? Thanks Michelle
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This does not just affect grading in the quiz, nor just Moodle Cloud . The same issue happens here in these forums. I have reported this bug as MDL-72346 . (Presumably these weird symptoms are an unintended side-effect of someone trying to improve accessibility .)
Comment 2: Thanks Tim, Hopefully, it will be fixed quickly. I followed the links to the bug report - yours and MDL-72286 . Hopefully it won't take too long for it to be corrected - with the 'minor' priority set.

Post title: Cost of MoodleCloud
Post description: Hi, Can you use Moodle Cloud as a workplace or is it only for schools? Also, if I was to set up training courses on Moodle Cloud, are they accessible to people outside of my workplace? (e.g through a link sent to them).

Comment 1: You can use it for anything (legal) and as it is a 'cloud' system it would be available to anyone with a link to the general internet.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Migrating old moodle to moodle cloud
Post description: Hi all, We have an old training module on our web server that is built on an old version of Moodle (2.61) and it apparently requires an older version of PHP than what is running on our server today. I am wondering if I could just migrate it to moodle cloud to get it up to speed.  Is it possible to migrate an existing legacy moodle instance to the cloud and work on it there? Or c an I configure a Moodle cloud account to accommodate this older version of the training module?  Specifically run an old version of PHP to accommodate an older version of Moodle?  As I write this I am thinking this is probably not possible as it is probably some kind of shared hosting, but I am hoping that using the cloud version will be an easier environment to updgrade it to ver 3.7. Thoughts on migrating an old Moodle app to the Moodle Cloud? Hopefully I am making sense and thanks for any help you can give me. - Joe
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Joe, Long story short - no, MoodleCloud does not offer older versions of Moodle. As you found out, since Moodle 2.6.1 does not support php 7, you will have a hard time finding a commercial host that will offer you this service. At this point, you can contact a Moodle Partner (find yours on https://moodle.com/partners/ ) to ask for support. They should be able to provide help. Otherwise, if you have a backup of your course, you can try to upload it into a MoodleCloud site  and see how things go­. If you do not use contrib modules, your content should be upgraded and work in the up-to-date Moodle version MoodleCloud provides. Let us know how it goes, Mathieu

Forum Post: 
Post title: Boost theme preset
Post description: My Moodle Cloud site has a boost colorfunction preset, and all of a sudden it has stopped working. It is still there, still selected, but not doing anything.  Three days ago, it looks from the logs as if I logged in and changed some system files, but I didn't.  Any ideas? I can attach the log.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Linda, Moodle 3.5 upgraded the bootstrap theme library which requires all pre 3.5 boost preset files to be upgraded to the new format. If Moodle detects an old (broken) preset, it will revert back to Moodle default of no preset, which would explain what you are seeing. Please ensure your preset file is Moodle 3.5 compatible, you can read more about that here: https://docs.moodle.org/35/en/Upgrading#Possible_issues_that_may_affect_you_in_Moodle_3.5 and here https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Updating_a_boost_based_theme
Comment 2: Thank you Jordan!

Forum Post: 
Post title: Automated backup Enabled setting is not saved
Post description: Hello, We are using the Moodle for School/Mini package and when
trying to setup the automated backup to Enabled, after saving the setting remains
Disabled. It is very important for us to back up our data
automatically, so I’ll appreciate your quick response and help with this issue. Thanks in advance
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Jacki, We disabled automated scheduled backups due to everyone using it going over their site quota. MoodleCloud packages have a relatively low disk quota, and backups eat into this extremely quickly.
Comment 2: Hi Jordan, This is very frustrating... It doesn't make sense to provide this package without the ability to backup the data and without documenting this limitation clearly! I would be willing to pay more to have a larger quota and would expect Moodle to provide this option and manage the quota letting the user know when the usage is close to the limit and decide whether to buy more space or clean some old data. As the above is impossible, I would like to cancel the 1 year package I paid for and get a refund, after I will manually backup the work I have already made. May I notify you when I want to do that? Thanks
Comment 3: You can backup your data at any time by doing a manual course backup, we have not stopped users from doing this. If your site has 200mb of quota and you have a 100mb course, 1 backup of this course will put you close to your quota limit. If you had automatic backups on then you would be over quota after 2 automated backups and this is exactly what was happening to our users which prompted us to disable automatic backups. At this time we are not able to offer additional storage space in our plans. Our system already notifies you when you are close to or over your quota limit. Refunds are considered on a case by case basis (as per our terms you agreed to), and you should submit a ticket via the Support tab in your MoodleCloud Portal in order to get this process started.

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud Sites are now on 4.0.1!
Post description: Hi All, We're happy to announce that all MoodleCloud sites are now on Moodle 4.0.1! Moodle has a new personality! Welcome to a new contemporary interface, intuitive tabbed navigation, and a redefined course experience that makes it easier for educators or trainers to create and edit courses and for learners to reduce distractions and prioritise course work. What’s new on Moodle 4? Connect your site with MoodleNet MoodleNet is an open, social, media platform for educators to share and curate collections of open educational resources. With this new update, you’ll be able to easily send ready-to-use content from MoodleNet to your site. Learn more about how to use MoodleNet on MoodleCloud in our knowledge base article . Once your site has been updated, you’ll receive an email that confirms that MoodleNet has been enabled for your site. Theme Changes The Classic theme is no longer available on MoodleCloud and the Boost theme is set as the default. If you have used custom CSS to style your site, any custom CSS that goes with the Classic theme also is removed. You can learn more about what to do with your custom CSS in our knowledge base article . Enhanced course creation experience New navigation to find your way around the course and activities with clear tab menus. Drag and drop sections and activities to organise your content in seconds. Enhanced support for screen readers and keyboard navigation to make your courses more accessible. Check out all new features for teachers in Moodle 4 . New features for Moodle administrators Custom reports: easily create reports at user, course and site level in a new drag and drop interface and share them with your team. Site configuration presets: keep things simple and remove anything your users don’t need with just one click. Plus, save your site configuration as an exportable Preset to import into other sites. Customised login page: add a background image for the improved login page Check out all the new features for administrators in Moodle 4 . Thanks for using MoodleCloud and we hope you like the new features! Cheers, Frances MoodleCloud - Product Manager

Forum Post: 
Post title: Collating several "Feedback" activities into one document
Post description: Hello, I am wondering if there is a clever work-around on MoodleCloud to collate several "feedback" activities into one document. To explain - we are developing a child protection training, during which, at the end of each module, participants will produce a part of a child protection policy. e.g. in Module 1 they will be asked to describe the laws around child protection in their country, and to put this information into a "feedback" activity. By the end of the training, they will have filled in lots of these "feedback" activities and by doing so, will have written most of their Child Protection Policy. Is there a way of extracting the information that they give and collating it into one document? Ideally into a pre-existing template where their responses get slotted in at the appropriate points? If not, is there a work-around which would achieve the same results? Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Eleanor, This is not going to be achieved with normal Moodle function due to the Feedback activity being created for Feedback and not document building. You will need to develop a custom report/function to collect al the responses from the user in that course and place it in one document for you. Seeing that Moodle already has the responses and information, I cannot see why this will be too difficult to develop. The bigger issue now is that you are on Moodle Cloud and it does not allow any custom development. You will need to host the site yourself or ask a certified Moodle partner to host it and help develop this for you. I work for AOSIS, a South African Moodle partner and we can help with both the option I mentioned.
Comment 2: This topic is known in the online business as the portfolio, "a selection of a student's work (such as papers and tests) compiled over a period of time and used for assessing performance or progress" (Source https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/portfolio ). Moodle is not designed primarily to be a portfolio, as you have realized. Still there could be limited solutions within Moodle. For example you can create a "cohort course". Say the full intake of a certain year/semester is also enrolled in this course. You keep that course running till they graduate. Depending on how mature they are, the students might like or dislike shifting a summary of their work from the (detailed) courses to this central course. The plus side is, the students do it themselves, you the teachers, don't have to copy things between courses.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Migrating everything to MoodleCloud
Post description: Hi folks, I have a client still running Moodle 2.9, and I have advised him to migrate to MoodleCloud. Are the steps and options for such a migration documented anywhere? In addition to course material, he would like to migrate users and all associated data, and is quite worried about losing historical data. What will he be able to migrate, and what will he lose? Is any of this documented anywhere? Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Anton, To migrate from a self hosted server to a MoodleCloud site, I would suggest taking backups of your courses and then restoring them into your MoodleCloud site. Be mindful that you have to select whether to include student data etc when you create the backup. If you don't select it then it won't be in the Backup. You visit each individual course and click on Settings, then Backup to create the Backup. You will need to go to  go to "Site Admin/Server Files" and find the automated backup there and download it to your computer. Once you have signed up for a MoodleCloud site then go to Site Admin / Courses/ Restore Course to upload that file and Restore. You can learn more here: https://docs.moodle.org/310/en/Upgrading All the best, Kelly
