Forum Post: 
Post title: Restoring course that has just been deleted
Post description: I was devastated to receive an email on December 17 saying that our course ( https://mds.moodlecloud.com/course/view.php?id=3 ) has been deleted. We spent about two years developing that course for our international students. The email read that "this is a courtesy email to inform you that your site mds.moodlecloud.com has been deleted from MoodleCloud." We have students who are expected to come from many different countries to take the course this spring and we cannot possibly replace this material in time. I read that you are able to restore courses within 14 days. I would be so grateful if you could do that. I understand that restoring this course is performed by the technical team, so I will gladly pay the fee for this service immediately. I apologize for my negligence in not being aware of the frequency with which I need to log in. I promise it won't happen again.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Robert, Sorry to hear you have lost your MoodleCloud site. Under our free site retention policy, if your Moodle for Free site has been inactive for more than 14 days, it is removed in order to maintain a vibrant and active system for all users. We do send a reminder email message before the site is removed. To get the site back online, we are able to restore your site data but as this is performed by our technical team there is a fee of $100.00 AUD. Also, please note that to comply with our GDPR policies, as you are no longer as a customer, you will need to reply to this email for us to go ahead with the site restore within 14 days of the site deletion date or your site will be deleted from our systems. Your other option is to recreate your site. You can do this in the MoodleCloud Portal or by completing the signup. Unfortunately, the content of the site has been deleted. To ensure it does not get removed in the future you need to make sure it is accessed regularly or you can choose to upgrade your site to a Starter or Moodle for School plan where the inactive policy does not apply. I shall send you a PayPal invoice to the registered address and if you do decide to go ahead with the site restore then we will action this restore for you. If you have any further questions, please let me know or visit our FAQ page. Also, it's worth a gentle reminder that in order to retain your restored site you will need to login every 14 days. With that in mind, we recommend that you upgrade to a Paid Subscription (starting from $80 depending on which Plan you select). With a Paid Subscription there is no regular requirement to log in every 14 days.
Comment 2: Thank you so much, Craig. I am very happy to let you know that Support has already helped me with this issue. (I was desperate to get the course restored and didn't know whether to contact Support or MoodleCloud forum. And, I didn't want the 14 days to lapse.) When my supervisor returns from holiday break, I will strongly encourage her to push for the school to upgrade to a paid subscription. Since I inherited this course fairly recently, I didn't know much about Moodle, but now that I have read more over the weekend, I can tell you that I'm really impressed with your mission and vision. Also, a colleague recently conducted a training session to other instructors to demonstrate how useful Moodle has been to our international students in this course. Again, thank you for your prompt reply. To say that I am relieved would be an understatement.
Comment 3: Hi Craig I am in the same situation as my site has also been deleted as I could not login to the system for several weeks. I have exported my site, which came as SQL file. Do you think I can transfer this site to another Moodle account?  I am also ready to pay to get the site back. Thanks in advance for your help.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Exporting Grades in Moodle 4.01
Post description: On moodlecloud pre update when we went to the grader report  and chose to export the grades, we were first saw the checklist export, with a submenu to move to the excel grade export. Now the submenu doesn't appear, so all we can export is checklists but not the actual grades. Is there a way around this?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: We are having the same problem and are required to download our grades today.  Please let us know how to download student grades please, at this time we can only download that they have clicked the box to say they have read guidelines to start the course - this is useless as if they had not they could not have done the course and gained a result. A quick resolution please Thank you Christine
Comment 2: This appears to be a bug that is being looked into. In the meantime if you modify the URL , you can get to the export link for excel e.g. https://.moodlecloud.com/grade/export/checklist/index.php?id= Change the value of "checklist" in the URL to "xls" to get the format options e.g. https://.moodlecloud.com/grade/export/xls/index.php?id=
Comment 3: Thanks for this workaround. I ran into this issue today. Grade export was working fine in Moodle 3.11 before the upgrade to Moodle 4.0.1. Here are the specifics of my experience in case it's helpful to anyone else. In Site administration > Grades > General settings, I have "Primary grade export methods" set to "OpenDocument spreadsheet" and "Excel spreadsheet." Thanks!
Comment 4: The reason that checklists show up is that it is an additional plugin ( https://moodle.org/plugins/view.php?plugin=gradeexport_checklist ) included with MoodleCloud that is not part of Moodle core and is what is causing this to appear first. On that note, the reason why there isn't a public tracker for this one is that it is being internally worked on by the MoodleCloud team as it relates to this additional plugin and isn't a core Moodle issue.
Comment 5: Thanks, Praj! That's very helpful. I appreciate your explanations about why the issue is happening and why there is no tracker for it.

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud - PayPal enrolment and tiered pricing
Post description: Greetings all. Is it possible in Moodle Cloud to set up PayPal auto enrolment with some type of tiered pricing scheme, so that different groups are charged different amounts?  So, for example, students are charged a lower cost than professionals?  Or would I have to create different versions of the course and use some other tool to direct the appropriate people to the appropriate course? Thanks in advance for your help!  (If this has been answered somewhere else I apologize; I did a search but failed to find anything.) Mike
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Dear Michael, Apologies for our late response. PayPal is part of the standard MoodleCloud account, so you don't need to install a plugin to use it, just enable it. How it works is that each student or user will need to create an account first. You can read more here: https://docs.moodle.org/en/PayPal_enrolment You can read more about setting up PayPal on your site here: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Set_up_payment You can read more about PayPal Side setup and enabling PayPal enrolment here: https://docs.moodle.org/en/PayPal_enrolment As for your question, you are not able to have different prices for the same course. For this reason, the best solution would be what you had suggested, creating a duplicated course instance with a different enrolment price. I hope this information helps. If you have any further questions, please let me know or visit our FAQ page . Warm regards, Zuriñe

Forum Post: 
Post title: About Moodlle cloud - Plans
Post description: Hi all, I'm beginning to use Moodle cloud so I have some questions about it. 1. Should I use moodle seft-hosting or Plans - moodle cloud. It cost about 61 USD. 2. Where I can take a list of plugins which "Plans - moodle cloud" support? Are they useful? Thank all.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Hoang, There is a long thread which discussed the pros and cons of self-hosting , vps and other options in comparison to Moodlecloud, but the difference is massive, both in limitations and responsibilities. MoodleCloud Starter only provides the "custom certificate" extra plugin and does not allow installation of custom themes or plugins (which is possible when self-hosting). You can view the list of extra plugins on https://moodlecloud.com/app/en/ , by clicking on the "+" sign right of "Extra plugin pack". A list with more detailed descriptions is available on https://moodle.org/plugins/browse.php?list=set&id=80 - note that most of them are only available on "school plans" (which are available to anyone, don't let the name confuse you). Since MoodleCloud offers a free tier from which you can later upgrade, I would suggest you get started with it. You can later export your courses and import them into your self-hosted site if you wish. Hopefully this helps make sense of it. Mathieu

Post description: I have an account at Moodlecloud. I have deleted a number of users, but I see that their assignments seem to stay in the site, consuming a lot of useless space. Any idea/suggestion about this issue? Thanks! Enrique
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Dear Enrique, You will need to delete the files from every location that they are located in. If it is assignment files you are trying to delete, unfortunately you cannot leave an assignment submission with no file after one has been submitted. This is a known problem in Moodle with a very long history in our issue tracker. There are a few ways you can work around this: Wait until your course has finished, export the grades if you need to save them and then reset the course - this removes all data that was in the course (including files). OR In the file picker, remove the PDF and upload a small dummy file (empty text file will do) and then save that as the students submission. An empty text file should only be a few bytes in size compared to the several megabyte PDF. I know this isn't ideal, but this assignment submission file handling comes from Moodle itself and is not specific to the MoodleCloud environment. Please note that, the cron clear up runs daily so these deleted documents may appear to be still there but if you leave it and don't check on it for a day or so, they will be deleted. If you continue to check on the files, it creates drafts and prolongs the deletion of the files. I hope that this helps. Warm regards, Kelly

Forum Post: 
Post title: MOODLE CLOUD - DIFFERENT QUESTIONS - MOODLE CLOUD
Post description: Dear Moodlers, I have some question about MoodleCloud. 1) I have already created a course on the free option of MoodleCloud, can I take everything and put it on the mini or small option or I have to create everything again  when I will upgrade? 2) If I want to load a video in my mini or small option, can I do it ? Because now in the free version, I cannot do it. 3) If i take the mini or small option, can my classes be still available on the net in 10 or 50 years time or the account will expire ? The question is: If in 2 years time I want to opt for the normal Moodle and quit moodlecloud to give my classes, but i want to keep the moodlecloud version, can I still access to it ,if I do not pay anymore ? thank you very much in advance, Best margherita maria de lorenzi
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I have another question about MoodleCloud: how do I restrict access to some section or forum of my class ? Because I do not want some teacher to see or modify everything and I do not want some student to see or modify everything. Thanks again !
Comment 2: Hi, If you decide to upgrade to a paid plan of MoodleCloud , your current site will be upgraded. There is no need to move/rebuild what you have - everything stays as it is Since I work full-time on MoodleCloud, I sure hope it will still be online in 10 or 50 years, but there are unfortunately no guarantees about it. On a Moodle level, courses from 10 years ago can definitely still be restored in Moodle nowadays, so that's already a good thing. I feel this is a discussion as much about formats you use in your course as it is about the platform itself. In both cases, "I sure hope so and I'll do my best to make it happen" is the best I can say. You can definitely load videos in a free MoodleCloud site (though the space is limited). For both of these questions (videos and access control), since they are not MoodleCloud-specific, I strongly recommend you ask in the relevant support forum (have you tried the Assistance technique and Assistance pédagogique ?). Mathieu
Comment 3: Ok perfect thank you very much !!!

Forum Post: 
Post title: MoodleCloud Copy Course Activity
Post description: Hello, I am new to using MoodleCloud and I find most of the information out there applies to regular Moodle and not MoodleCloud. Is there a way to easily copy course activities from one course to another in MoodleCloud? I appreciate any assistance. Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello Jessica. I'm sure the MoodleCloud team will respond soon but in fact , most of what applies to regular Moodle also applies to MoodleCloud. If you want to copy a course activity from one course to another in MoodleCloud then you can use the "import" feature - go to the course into which you want to copy the activity and click the More link - then click Course reuse - then click Import. You will then be prompted to select the course and activity you want to bring in. See the documentation Import course data
Comment 2: Thank you! This worked and was so helpful. I appreciate it. I believe that much of it is the same. However, I’ve found for me at my level of experience with Moodle, when I try to search for help I mostly find posts and instructions that involve plugins and coding (which I can’t do in MoodleCloud), or names of settings that do not exist in my MoodleCloud account. However, everything that you said was straightforward and easy to find, so thank you!

The course encourages participants to take part in some exercises each week and to set a goal which they can aim to achieve over the six weeks of the course. I want to create a function through which participants can set a goal at the beginning of the course and then come back to review/reflect on it (and even edit/add to it) throughout the course. However, I'm struggling to find a function that suits this on Moodlecloud. For example, the Feedback option is good for open entry text but participants cannot review it after they've submitted it. I've also considered using the Quiz option. This works well in terms of function but the language is misleading since it refers to things like 'quiz', 'result' and 'assessment', which are not relevant. I read that you can change this language under 'language administration', but when I try I see a message saying "this feature is not available in MoodleCloud." I also read about other plugin options to help with customisation, or options such as the journal plugin - but it would seem these aren't available with Moodlecloud either? My questions are: 1. Am I missing some steps that would make the above options work with MoodleCloud? If so, what are they? 2. If these options don't work with MoodleCloud, is anyone aware of alternative ways I could create this goal-setting function? I basically just need them to be able to type in a goal and be able to refer to it throughout the course. Is it possible to code within MoodleCloud? Also just to note I'm working on behalf of an organisation so don't have control over what type of account they have. Thank you.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello there. I understand the limitations of changing the language in MoodleCloud. You don't specify whether these goals will be read by "teachers" or are just personal, and whether they can be viewed by others or must be private to the learner. How about Moodle's Blog or Assignment activity?
Comment 2: Hi Mary, thanks for your reply! The goals would be seen by "teachers" and "students", but only by the student who wrote them. I think Assignment is similar to Quiz in terms of language. Not sure about blog but I'll take a look and see if that will work. Thanks for your advice : )
Comment 3: Well another option is the Database activity which you said to moderate but the teacher never approves the moderation -so a student's entry is only ever seen by the student and the teacher. I accept that the Database activity is not the easiest of activities to set up though. Is it such a big problem, the language? The student won't see the word Quiz on the page and you can make the link to a quiz say anything you want in your title and description?
Comment 4: To update on this looks like blog isn't available for MoodleCloud. Assignment does look slightly better than Quiz for what I'm trying to achieve so thanks for that advice - although the issue with language like 'submit assignment' and the grading table do remain and it would be great if anyone has advice for getting round this.
Comment 5: Do you have the Checklist activity on your MoodleCloud site? Have you explored that option? Incidentally, I have a MoodleCloud site and the blog is available for me. Click on your profile top right, then you will see a section in your profile Miscellaneous and there you can add a new blog entry. However.... blog entries can't be restricted (well, not easily) to just the teacher and an individual student) so again not ideal really.
Comment 6: Hi Mary, sorry for the long time between replies! Checklist could be another option although again the language isn't very intuitive ('add your own item') etc. It can be worked around but would be ideal if I could just somehow change the language to 'add your goal' and remove references to grading, etc. Thanks for taking the time to help and share some different options - I really appreciate it!

Post title: MoodleCloud announce increased free quotas plus NGO and nonprofits program
Post description: Hi all, We are committed to providing open source, free e-learning tools for educators. That’s why all our software is free and open source, and this will never change. Hundreds of thousands of institutions have downloaded and are using Moodle on their own servers worldwide. MoodleCloud is one of our official hosting services that makes it simple for anyone to get a Moodle site without needing to install it on a local server .  Since 2015, MoodleCloud has provided a number of simple packages for smaller users, including a 50-user Free plan with 200Mb. Announcement 1: New free trial with larger quotas We are happy to announce the launch of a new MoodleCloud Free Trial with four times more users (200) and double the storage (400 MB). Everyone will be able to use their MoodleCloud Free Trial for 45 days before deciding to move to one of our inexpensive paid plans. Announcement 2: NGO and nonprofits program As part of our mission we are now offering our larger MoodleCloud plans completely free to registered NFPs and NGOs. All you need to do is apply here , and if accepted, we will give you a full-size MoodleCloud plan for no cost. Costs are subsidised by donations we've received. Does this replace the existing free plan? Yes! This new Free Trial upgrades and replaces our old Free plan (that expires if unused for 14 days). Will people keep their existing MoodleCloud free sites? Yes! Sites currently on the old Free plan will remain unchanged (so long as you use them at least once every 14 days!). Your support is welcome If you, or someone you know, would like to make a donation towards paying for deserving institutions to have free MoodleCloud sites, please visit moodle.com/donations . Thanks, and happy Moodling! Lee Goldsworthy Product Manager - MoodleCloud (Edited by Frances Le Page - original submission Wednesday, April 15, 2020, 3:06 PM) (Edited by Frances Le Page - original submission Wednesday, April 15, 2020, 3:06 PM) (Edited by Frances Le Page - original submission Wednesday, April 15, 2020, 3:06 PM)

We had to put a message in the MoodleCloud so no one could take the name. We know your team has been very busy. Don't worry for the paid 1 year plan, it cost us almost $1000 USD, but keep it for your efforts on building a robust LMS. Thank you for your reply.

Post title: Retrieve Course- Account De-activated
Post description: I had built a course over the past two years.  Because it was a "Free" account, there is a requirement to log in every 60 days.  I would regularly receive reminder emails to log in or the account would be deleted. This week I did not have time to log in and seemed to have missed the small window you are allowed. So now I go to log in and my password doesn't work and there is no RESET or Forgot password button.  It gives me a choice for the various accounts (Free and Paid). When I "sign up" again for a new account - since using my current account no longer works - I am allowed to use my old site name/ URL and "claim" it.  When I do all that, what I get is the site name but the content is gone!  Anyone else have this experience?  How can I retrieve the course content? I can't believe it is actually gone. Not sure who to email?  Thanks!!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello Kate. Just to let you know I've moved your question into the dedicated MoodleCloud forum. Unfortunately it appears according to the MoodleCloud FAQ that if you don't access your site for 60 days it is deleted, including content. As you mention, you did receive several email reminders.
Comment 2: Having a 60 day rule to access your course doesn't make sense.  The course can be complete but waiting for content. Doesn't mean it's abandoned. Perhaps a Year is more understandable. thanks for responding. Will rebuild the course in Canvas.
Comment 3: Hi Kate, The free site retention policy is there to ensure we can continue to provide free and low cost Moodle hosting options for all.  We do send an email to the admin of your account well before the removal. If your site is not going to be used for a period of time, you can choose to upgrade to one of the plans where the policy does not apply. I can see how this is frustrating for you when you lose your site. Maybe the email got stuck in a spam folder. If you would like to continue with MoodleCloud, email support@moodlecloud.com with your site details and we'll see what we can do with your site. Thanks Chris

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle Cloud slow
Post description: Hello, Please please give the users information about moodlecloud slowlyness. This isn't normal anymore. This isn't ok anymore for us . No info,  no reaction , no help . We pay for support and info but this isn't working anymore. Please help us.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Mouna, Thank you for reaching out and sharing your concerns. We understand your frustration, and I want to apologise for the inconvenience caused by the recent issues sincerely. After looking into the issue, we found that the main reason for the slowdown was the very high demand on our shared Infrastructure from multiple quizzes with thousands of users running simultaneously. This unexpected surge in activity has then affected the performance of some other sites. Our technical team have identified the problem, and we’ve since implemented changes to increase the overall capacity for all clients and mitigate further impacts to our infrastructure. We’re monitoring the issue and continuing to implement further changes to improve performance. We know how important consistent service is for your experience, and we take this very seriously. We hope that the increased infrastructure will mitigate the issue and will be continuing to monitor over the coming days. If you're still encountering any problems or need assistance getting back up and running smoothly, please don’t hesitate to reach out to our support team. Kind regards, Frances

Post title: Looking for assistance
Post description: good afternoon. I am looking for someone to be able to assist me with my moodlecloud.com site. I need to be able to either chat over the phone or zoom. Please let me know.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello Darryl. I removed your email address to avoid you being spammed. I am going to move your post to the dedicated MoodleCloud forum but you know that you can also contact the MoodleCloud team directly from your portal (the orange tab on the right) when logged into your MoodleCloud site? Is it something to do with the set up that we can help with here?
Comment 2: I have tried multiple times to find assistance through the portal. I haven't received any help. That is why I am here.
Comment 3: Is it something we can help with here? What exactly is your problem?
Comment 4: The problem is 2 fold I have added students, instructors, and administrators. When attempting to send the email out to the students they receive nothing. Plus on the home page, there is no listing of my course. I need to be able to see the course so I can send it to the students.
Comment 5: Hello Darryl. Where are you sending the email from when you send it to students? Also, assuming their emails are correct, have they checked in their spam folders? Secondly, do you mean the course is not listed on your Dashboard ? If you want a course to be listed on the Dashboard then you as teacher need to be enrolled in it. As for sending it to the students, you could enrol them in the course and then when they log in they will see the course on their Dashboard as soon as they log in. Have you gone through the Moodle Admin Basics course? I do recommend it for your type of query.
Comment 6: i took the Moodle Admin Basic Course. I am still having the same problem.
Comment 7: Hello Darryl Regarding the Moodle Admin Basics course, I would certainly recommend that you go through it thoroughly, digesting the material in the books and videos and doing the quizzes several times to get a high grade, as the course will definitely help, whether you want to get a badge/certificate or not. In the meantime, can you give more information regarding the other questions in my previous post? I can point you in the direction of the relevant links in that course or explain a bit more.
Comment 8: Dear Darryl, Depending on what type of notification you need to send in Moodle, you can learn all about how Moodle sends notifications for different activities in our documentation: Managing a Moodle Course As a course teacher, go to Course administration > Reports > Event monitoring rules, or as an admin go to Site administration > Reports > Event monitoring rules. You can learn more about it below: Event Monitoring If you are trying to send notifications on enrolment, please note that you are only able to do this on self enrolment method and you are unable to edit this email. You can however step up notifications of enrolment expirations. You can learn more about below: Self enrolment: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Self_enrolment Manual enrolment: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Manual_enrolment Course enrolment: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Course_enrolment Please note that notifications do not go out for at least 30 minutes in Moodle, but even after that, it does depend on when your cron runs for your site.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle Cloud Price Increase
Post description: I have just received notice that my subscription to MoodleCloud will be increasing. Not that I don’t expect an increase, but it is increasing by 65%, going from $230 per year to $380. No mention of why such a dramatic increase is being imposed. Is anyone else seeing this large cost increase?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Rick, Thanks for raising this. We understand that price increases can be concerning, especially for smaller organisations and individual educators. However, this may be a misunderstanding. It sounds like the $230 figure comes from the reference pricing shown in US Dollars on our pricing page . It’s important to note that MoodleCloud plans are billed in Australian Dollars (AUD) . For customers outside Australia, the amount charged in local currency will vary depending on exchange rates set by banks or card providers. Currently, the Mini plan is 340 AUD per year , which is approximately 230 USD at today’s exchange rate. This plan will increase to 380 AUD per year starting 13th August 2025 . We hope this helps clarify things! All the best, Christian
Comment 2: Thank you for taking the time to respond and to clear up my confusion. I appreciate it.

Post description: Hi, I have a moodlecloud starter site, which is currently suspended. The annual payment of the site was due last week, however, the payment was declined by my credit card. Comments associated with the post:

If your site has been suspended then your subscription has been cancelled and there will be no more payment retries. If you login to your portal there will be a message at the top advising you to update your payment details and reactivate your site. This will take payment immediately and restart your subscription and reactivate your site. I hope that helps.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Migrate MoodleCloud database to MoodleLMS
Post description: Hello, can someone advise if we can migrate MoodleCloud database to MoodleLMS (local machine)
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Someone else may know better than I know, but I don't think what you seek is allowed by MoodleCloud. It's not a fault of MoodleCloud, either. Many systems that use shared databases don't allow users to do this. (However, I might be wrong.)
Comment 2: It would be possible to backup and download each course, then restore to your other site.
Comment 3: Trivnesh has a parallel post in this other topic .
Comment 4: Hi Trivnesh, There are a few ways to do this. As explained by Marcus, you could follow the course backup/restore route. I would recommend to use this method if your MoodleCloud site has only few courses and not too many custom settings and users. You can also Export your MoodleCloud site , which will give you a zip file, which can be used to set up a Moodle site on another server . While this method will give you everything at once (courses, files, users, settings, etc.), it will require you know how to import a (possibly large) sql file into your server and move the files to the correct dataroot folder manually. Mathieu
Comment 5: Thanks everyone, really appreciate the help and support.
Comment 6: Ah, Mathieu, I didn't know about this "export your MoodleCloud site" feature. Cool. Someone was really thinking ahead. I am going to try this and see if I can restore this in my local MAMP Moodle. Thanks.
Comment 7: Yep, I tried this Export your MoodleCloud feature and it works. However, the logstore table is empty, probably as expected because MoodleCloud probably doesn't keep all these entries.  So, Trivnesh, follow Mathieu's advice.
Comment 8: Thank you very much Rick and Mathieu.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle Cloud https won't connect with an LTI with http location
Post description: I'm attempting to add an External Tool but it's failing to load (blank screen).  I consulted an IT professional and he stated that as Moodle Cloud is https, and the External Tool I'm trying to add is http, Moodle Cloud will reject the request. The host providing me with the LTI tool and shared secret are http only. I'm also assuming Moodle Cloud cannot and will not deactivate https either... Is there anyway where I can get around this to have both LMS' connect to one another?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Natalie, sorry that you are encountering some troubles. The IT professional you consulted with is correct, http LTI tools can't be used on an https moodle instance. (but the reverse case would work: https tools can be used on http moodle instances, but I digress) You are correct, moodle cloud doesn't offer an option to disable SSL/https. Even if it did, you would not want to because of the security risk that would pose to your site. Basically, https on your cloud instance ensures that all content is encrypted and verifiably from your site. But if an http tool is used on that site, the content from that tool would not be encrypted, which would allow attackers to gain access to information about your users passed over LTI requests. So all modern browsers will not allow http content (such as LTI) on an https site. So your best option is to contact the provider of your tool and ask them to start using SSL on their site so you can use it via https. This is in their best interests as well as it protects all their clients' data. SSL certificates are cheap these days, and the extra processing power required is not really a problem. If you haven't already you might want to just double check that the tool is definitely not already working when you use https instead. If the tool provider really refuses to start using SSL, your do have the option is create a proxy server on top of their tool which allows you to send the LTI requests via https and then forward them to the original tool. But I would recommend leaving that as your last option

Post title: MoodleCloud users to get automatically enrolled in a course
Post description: Hi All, Is there any way (in a MoodleCloud site with just one course) for users that create their own account in the site to be automatically enrolled in the course in the 1st login? Or will and admin need to go and manually enroll those new users in the course? Thanks a lot for any help!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Antonio, If you only want one course on your site, you can make the front page into a course page and add activities to it. In the front page settings you will need to set the default front page role to student. Assuming you have enabled Email-based self-registration , users will then be able to create an account on the site and participate in the activities.
Comment 2: Hi Helen, Thanks a lot for your fast reply! Is the Quiz and other activities going to properly work when added to the front page? I think there is no gradebook on the front page, but that might not be a problem. Thanks, Antonio
Comment 3: Hi Antonio, As you've found, the front page is not exactly like a course page, though it has many similarities. I suggest you experiment to find out if it suits your needs. For some things, such as the gradebook, you can find the link in an ordinary course e.g. https://sandbox.moodledemo.net/grade/report/grader/index.php?id=2 and then change the number at the end to 1 to obtain a link to the front page gradebook i.e. https://sandbox.moodledemo.net/grade/report/grader/index.php?id=1

Post title: Trouble enabling Custom Certificates in MoodleCloud
Post description: Hello, We upgraded our MoodleCloud site to School/Medium. With that said, I cannot figure out how to enable and/or install Custom Certificates or the other approved plugins for MoodleCloud. When I navigate to the Plugins section under Site Administration, I see the following next to Custom Certificates: " Additional" and " To be installed" Does anyone know how I can go about fixing this so that we can use Custom Certificates? Thank you in advance for your assistance. - Joseph
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Joseph, To access the Custom Certificate in MoodleCloud , you need to go to ▶︎ Site administration ▶︎ Plugins ▶︎ Activity modules ▶︎ Custom certificate. From there you will be able to edit, duplicate and create templates for your custom certificates. All plugins available on our MoodleCloud sites are already installed in your MoodleCloud site and ready to use, they do not require you to install them yourself. I hope this helps! Kind regards, Frances The MoodleCloud Team
Comment 2: Hi Frances, Thank you for your response. While Custom Certificate is listed among the plug-ins, it says "Disabled" and indicates "To Be Installed." I do not have the options you have described to duplicate or modify certificates. In fact, Custom Certificate is not appearing under "Activity Modules" when i click on that category either. All of the elements listed under "customcertelement" are also listed with "To Be Installed" next to them. I am alsp receiving the disabled message for several other plug-ins included with MoodleCloud (e.g. checklists). Thanks in advance for any guidance. Kind regards, Joseph
Comment 3: Hi Joseph, This has been fixed for you now. Sorry for the inconvenience. Cheers, Cam

Forum Post: 
Post title: Forum policy - PLEASE READ before posting
Post description: This forum is for community discussion about MoodleCloud. MoodleCloud is our own hosting platform, designed and run by Moodle HQ, the people who make Moodle.  MoodleCloud provides a super simple way to get up and running with the latest Moodle version in minutes. MoodleCloud hosting is inexpensive because we don't include a lot of support. If you need assistance with setup and configuration of your site, visit the Moodle community and Moodle documentation for lots of helpful information on any Moodle topic.  There is a handy link in the footer on each Moodle page to take you to the appropriate Moodle documentation for that area of Moodle. To this point, we have developed this policy for posting to this forum.  Posts which violate this policy may be edited, moved to a more appropriate forum or deleted at the discretion of our forum moderators. If you have a question about MoodleCloud Ensure you have explored our dedicated FAQ page to see if your question already has an answer. Is your question a Moodle question? Does the question start with "In Moodle, how do I..."  If so, then please search for the appropriate forum for the post. This will provide a better experience for all and the answer may already be provided. If you think it may be an issue or bug in MoodleCloud and you can verify your issue does not happen on the same version of Moodle outside of MoodleCloud, please open a bug over at https://tracker.moodle.org under the CLOUD project. Etiquette Discussion tone should be kept polite and focused on facts. Our public forums must not be used for defamation or flaming. Don't forget to talk about good experiences as well as the bad! Your identity Fake identities created on Moodle.org for the purpose of criticism will not be tolerated, and those accounts may be closed. Text taken from the Moodle.org site policy .

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodlecloud Website was deleted
Post description: Hi. As the subject says, my Moodlecloud website was deleted due to inactivity because I had to stop teaching the children I homeschool since I had a research project that had to be finished (University Student here btw ). By the time I was done with my research, physical distancing and stay-at-home orders were enforced because of Covid-19. I then received instructions I need to compile the children's outputs and grades (conveniently stored in Moodle) Two weeks ago I tried to access my website, it prompted that my site no longer exists! I immediately posted to support.moodle.com asking if it was possible to recover my website since I also had instructions to prepare to teach the children online, and until now, no reply from Moodle Support. Yes, I acknowledge that Moodle does send emails reminding me that I should frequently log in to my website, and I did receive those emails it didn't prompt since I sort them using the tabs in Gmail (crazy and lazy, I know). Any help from anyone is appreciated. Thanks! Alfonso
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Alfonso, sorry to hear that you've lost your site! as you can imagine - the moodlecloud support team has been slammed in the past few months - with tens of thousands of new sites being created, and many people looking for support, and the support inbox for moodleclouds "free" sites has been hard for them to keep on top of. As you have found - if your "free" site isn't used it will be deleted - and unfortunately there isn't a process that allows you to recover this. The cost of maintaining backups for all the free sites and a process to restore them is just too high considering the massive number of free sites the moodlecloud system hosts. The best way to prevent this from happening in future would be for you to upgrade to one of the paid plans - the other thing that would be good for you to do is to use the Moodle course backup process and store a copy of your course backups locally. all the best!
Comment 2: Hi Dan, thank you for replying. It's sad to know that there isn't a way to recover my moodlecloud website. Thank you for the tips you've suggested on backing up and storing it locally. Continue being awesome. Again, thank you! Alfonso

Forum Post: 
Post title: Important Update: MoodleCloud Performance
Post description: Hello MoodleCloud Community, We’re reaching out to update you about the recent performance issues that have affected some MoodleCloud sites. We understand how frustrating this has been for you and your learners, and we want to assure you that resolving these issues is our highest priority. After a thorough investigation, we can confirm that these problems are not related to any security breach or external attack; your MoodleCloud site remains secure and protected. Our technical team has identified several underlying causes that have contributed to slower performance in specific situations. In simple terms, we’ve found that some parts of the system have been handling background tasks and caching less efficiently than intended. These inefficiencies have, at times, increased load on our servers and caused slower page response times. We’re actively working on a set of fixes that will: Reduce unnecessary background activity, helping pages load faster. Optimise how data is stored and retrieved , especially in courses with more complex structures. Improve memory management for users who access sites without logging in. Ensure commonly used information loads more quickly and consistently. These improvements are currently being finalised and tested. They will be included in the upcoming Moodle 5.1.1 release, scheduled for 8 December 2025 . We’ll send a follow-up update on that date to confirm the release and share any further details. Thank you for your patience and continued trust as we make these improvements. We’re committed to ensuring MoodleCloud remains a reliable, high-performing platform for you and your learners. Frances The MoodleCloud Team

Forum Post: 
Post title: Checking for Unmarked Assignments
Post description: All, I've been receiving really useful help here - maybe this will help others in the same situation as me: Ona typical course, I have 40 students, each has between 8 and 24 assignments to submit. Going through Moodle, opening each assignment one by one and checking for unmarked assignments is a real nuisance. I have made a spreadsheet with a bit of VBA. It cycles through all assignment windows in a course and opens each one in a separate tab. I then run through the tabs, and any where "Needs grading" is not zero, I know I have assignments to mark there. Where I see a zero, I just close that tab. In seconds, I'm left with only the tabs where I have marking to do. To make this: Create a spreadsheet, save it as an .xlsm (macro-enabled spreadsheet) Select a range of cells - single column. Into the cells, copy & paste the url's of each grading summary page (the one that shows Participants, Submitted, Needs grading), one under the next. Name this range - I called mine " Assignment_URLs" Copy & paste the following code in as a VBA module: Sub Open_Assignment_URLs_In_New_Tabs() Dim rng As Range Dim cell As Range Dim URL As String Sheets("Sheet 1").Select ‘Change this to the sheetname where the links are [Assignment_URLs].Select ‘Named range where the links are ' Check if a single column is selected If TypeName(Selection) = "Range" Then If Selection.Columns.Count = 1 Then Set rng = Selection ' Loop through each cell in the selected column For Each cell In rng ' Get the URL from the cell URL = Trim(cell.Value) ' Open the URL in a new tab If URL <> "" Then CreateObject("WScript.Shell").Run URL End If Next cell Else MsgBox "Please select a single column containing URLs.", vbExclamation End If Else MsgBox "Please select a single column containing URLs.", vbExclamation End If End Sub If you aren't sure how to insert VBA, ask ChatGPT - it gives a good explanation and examples. To use the spreadsheet: Log in to Moodle as teacher. Run the code; it should open as many new tabs in your browser as you have url's in the named range. Hope this is of use, Ian

Forum Post: 
Post title: Invite manually added user
Post description: Hi, I consider myself quite intelligent but I can't find out how to invite a manually added user in MoodleCloud. Should it not be sent an invitation link automatically? /Niklas
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Niklas, If you're adding users manually and want Moodle to send an email to them automatically, you'd have to select the option Generate password and notify user when adding the user. If you're uploading users in bulk , you can select Create password if needed and send via email in the field New user password. Moodle will generate a temporary password and email the user with instructions on how to log in and change it. Keep in mind, the standard message cannot be edited in MoodleCloud. I hope that this information has been helpful. Regards, Christian

Comment 13: Hello, do we need to change the theme for 3.7? And, if so, what are the steps to changing/selecting my theme? We are using School.

Forum Post: Post title: Collapsible buttons suddenly not working Post description: Hello, I have a course which has several collapsible buttons in Pages and Books - i.e. when participants click on the button, it expands and has further text inside it. This has always worked fine, but today I happened to notice that the boxes are not expanding anymore when you click on them. Here is an example:

Go to the Commit section of this guide to find out more about this stage of the improvement cycle and see related tools and resources.

As I say, this has been working with no issues, so I'm unsure why it has suddenly stopped. Would appreciate if someone could shed some light! And also let me know if there is a way of fixing this without going into each individual Page / Book and making changes to the html. Thanks Go to the Commit section of this guide to find out more about this stage of the improvement cycle and see related tools and resources. Comments associated with the post: Comment 1: Eleanor The latest version of Moodle has upgraded the Bootstrap framework from Bootstrap 4 to Bootstrap 5.  Your instance would have been upgraded to the latest release recently.  This is to ensure that it remains secure, on supported libraries, and to give you access to the latest functionality.  It appears that you are using some classes which are not supported in Bootstrap 5, I believe data-toggle has changed to data-bs-toggle in the first instance, but there may be others. There are a couple of ways to fix this, the first is the obvious and edit each page.  This is probably the simplest and long term probably the best option as it will work for the life of Bootstrap 5 (V4 was released in 2018).  The second option would be to add the required classes to the SCSS setting in the Custom theme settings options in the site administration.  This requires some HTML/ CSS knowledge to do correctly but it will potentially fix the issue site wide.
